loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married and has eight children.

Chari has operated a firewood selling business for the past three years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. With this loan, Chari wants to purchase more bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 25 лет. Она проживает в селе района Шахритус. Гулрухсор добрая, отзывчивая учительница, которая уже несколько лет преподает в местной сельской школе. Она любит свою профессию, своих учеников и школу. Однако заработная плата, которую она получает не хватает на семейные расходы. Гулрухсор решила параллельно не отрываясь от работы начать новый бизнес. Ее интересует купля и продажа крупнорогатого скота. Она знает как ухаживать за ними, так как в ее хозяйстве имеется одна дойная корова с теленком. Чтобы закупить четырех голов телят, Гулрухсор просит кредит. Ее начальный капитал составляет 20 процентов от запрашиваемой суммы. Она надеется, что ее поддержат и она начав новый бизнес сможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Gulrukhsor is a young married woman, 25 years old. She lives in a village in the Shahrituz region. Gulukhson is a kind and thoughtful teacher who has been working in the local rural school for several years. She cares about her work, students and school. However, her salary is not enough to cover the family expenses. As a parallel activity, without leaving her job, Gulrukhsor decided to launch a new business. She is interested in buying and reselling cattle. She knows how to take care of livestock since she has a dairy cow and a calf. Gulrukhsor is applying for a loan to buy four calves. Her starting capital is 20% of the requested loan amount. She hopes to receive support so that she could launch her business and improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy four calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy edible goods including rice, sugar, bread, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mill.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 38 years old and he is married with three children. He and his wife help each other manage their farm, growing and harvesting rice both for food and sales. Pov has been involved in this business for more than 14 years. The main hardships that Pov faces in his business are insects, weeds and floods. The income from the business he usually uses for daily food, clothes, and other related expenses.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Pov is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding his family's health and protecting the environment. He will use the loan he's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family.

loans.name: Maximina Del Socorro

texts.es: Maximina del Socorro es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene 41 años de edad y habita en el municipio de la Libertada. Ella anhela tener su propia granja productora de cerdos y aumentar la oferta en los próximos años, también desea enseñarles a sus hijos de 16 y 19 años de edad quienes aun estudian y saben cuán importante es desarrollar esta rentable actividad. Maximina solicita el crédito para comprar 3 cerdos, los cuales engordará durante 3 meses, proporcionándoles una alimentación balanceada que incluye maíz que ella misma lo produce en su finca como parte de las actividades agrícolas que por varios años le ha proporcionado estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Maximina del Socorro is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She is 41 and lives in the Libertada municipality. She dreams of having her own hog farm and expanding her products in the next several years. She also wants to teach her children, ages 16 and 19. They are still in school and know how important it is to work in this profitable area.
Maximina is requesting this loan for the purchase of three hogs which she will fatten over three months by giving them balanced feed, including corn that she produces herself on her farm. This is part of the farming activities that have provided stability to her family for several years.

loans.use: to buy 3 hogs which she will fatten for 3 months and then sell.

loans.name: Simoni

texts.fr: Revendeur de produits de détail( médicaments, brosses à dent, pâtes dentifrice et produits alimentaires) à Lomé depuis 2001 Mr Simoni pour renforcer son activité sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Il souhaite assurer et agrandir son activité et aider sa famille à s'épanouir( Marié à une revendeuse et père de 06 enfants scolarisés).
texts.en: Mr. Simoni has been selling products wholesale (medications, toothbrushes, toothpaste and food products in Lome since 2001. To strengthen his business, he is seeking a loan from WAGES. He would like to secure and expand his business and assure his family’s well-being. (His wife is a vendor, and he has six children in school).

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items for resale.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 30 years old and married. They have been blessed with one child. She has been selling clothes for three years now. She would like a loan to add more stock of clothes for selling to clients in her area.

She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES. 65,000. She would like a loan of KES. 75,000 to buy more clothes to sell. From her anticipated profits, she will improve her family's welfare. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling to clients in her area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics, clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of two children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a food-production business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her food-production business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Josephine has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to stock more personal products to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for six years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more personal products to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Perlita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Perlita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past thirteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as manure and fumigant.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Rita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Rita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Rita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es: Ligia, tiene la edad  de 31 años, está casada y vive con su familia. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos  cerdos y el alimento del mismo. Ella cuenta con varios cerdos   y lo que pretende es aumentar sus animales. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de engorde  de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ligia, age 31, is married and lives with her family. With this loan, she will buy hogs and hog feed. She has several hogs, and wants to increase her number of animals. She wants to have them at an ideal weight to re-sell them in the local market or surrounding area. 
She wants to generate more income for her family's well-being, and to expand her hog business.
This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has had no other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better options and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy hogs.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a widowed woman and has four children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Mwanakombo has operated a fish selling business for the last seven years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With this loan, Mwanakombo wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a widowed woman with three children, one of whom attends school and two of whom are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, biscuits, bread, milk, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, biscuits, bread, milk, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to stock more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to stock more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Samin

texts.en:
Samin appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes to sell. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of items such as wheat flour, milk, maize flour, and sugar for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items such as wheat flour, milk, maize flour, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: María Dora

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad,  estudio hasta primer grado de básica, su compañero de vida ya falleció, era agricultor, solo su hijo varón vive con ella y trabaja dando mantenimiento a la cancha municipal del pueblo.

Ella trabaja en una empacadora de pescado ya tiene varios años haciendo esto, la distancia en bus es de una hora y de parte del trabajo les brinda transporte; la planta se instaló y necesitaba mano de obra sin experiencia y a esto se dedica, antes ella compraba y revendia en el pueblo y alrededores.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar madera nueva para el artesón del techo de su casa, varas, clavos y tejas para el techo, debido a que esta por inicira la época lluviosa en el país.  A futuro la cliente y su hijo piensan ir construyendo su casa de ladrillo o bloque ya que actualmente es de bahareque.
texts.en:
María, age 51, studied until grade 1. Her partner has passed away; he was a farmer. She has only one son living with her; he works in maintenance for the village's municipal sports area.
María works in a fish packing plant, and has been doing so for several years. It is an hour away by bus, and her work offers transportation; the plant needed unexperienced workers when it opened. Before this job, María worked as a buyer and seller in the village and neighbouring areas.
She will use this loan for the purchase of new wood for the arch of her home's roof, as well as rods, nails, and tiles for the roof. The rainy season is approaching.
In the future, she and her son plan to build a brick or block home, since their home is currently made of wattle and daub.

loans.use: to buy new wood for the arch of her home's roof, as well as rods, nails, and tiles for the roof. The rainy season is approaching.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and resell them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ingredients for her business selling food

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 54 years old. She is married and has two children. She has been farming for the last eight years. She would like a loan of KES 70,000. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 13,000. 

She has successfully repaid all her previous loans and will use this loan to purchase a grade cow. She will use her anticipated profits to educate her children. Her dream is to buy a bigger plot.

loans.use: to buy a grade cow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, tiene la edad 41 de  años, está casada y vive con un hijo y  el esposo. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos novillos . Ella cuenta con unos novillos  en su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación  para su engorde más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella  quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María, age 41, is married and lives with her child and husband. With this loan, she will buy some heifers. She has some heifers at the moment, and she feeds them so that they will fatten rapidly. She wants to have her animals at an ideal weight for re-sale in the local market or neighbouring areas.
She wants to generate more income for her family's well-being, and to expand her business.
This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with better options and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Commerçante de mèches et tissages depuis 2008, madame Ama pour répondre aux besoins des clients sollicite un second prêt pour acheter des marchandises au Grand Marché. Elle souhaite créer une autre boutique plus tard et fonder une famille. Ama est âgée de 31ans et célibataire.
texts.en:
Ama, age 31, is a single woman who has been a reseller of hair extensions and weaves since 2008. 

To meet customer demand, she is seeking a 2nd loan that she will use to stock up on merchandise at the Grand Market. 

Her long-term goals are to open another store, and to have a family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves.

loans.name: Wend La Malgda Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNA représente le groupe WEND LA  MALGDA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 29ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des céréales  depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 06 sacs de 100kg de maïs.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne  s’acheter une moto et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. MAMOUNA is the representative of the group WEND LA MALGDA. She is doing very well. She is a married mother of seven children aged 12 to 29, three of whom go to school. She supports four people. 

Mrs. MAMOUNA has been selling grains for twelve years. She buys her stock at the local market. 

She wants to purchase six 100-kg sacks of maize. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business. 

Her goals are to purchase a motorbike and to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy six 100-kg sacks of maize.

loans.name: Allan

texts.es: Allan  tiene la edad de 30 años, es soltero  y vive solo  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará  a salir adelante. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Allan is 30, single, and currently lives alone. He needs this loan for the purchase of livestock. When they are larger, he will sell them at a profit. His livestock business will help him to get ahead. He hopes that with this project his business will grow and he will achieve his goals in order to, in the future, provide his family with a better quality of life and economic stability. 
This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better options and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba de 32 años de edad, está acompañada, estudio hasta  noveno grado.  Su compañero de vida trabaja como jornalero en actividades varias y es empleado eventual de la procesadora de pescado, sus hijos viven con ellos y van a la escuela los dos mayores, viven solos en la casa aunque su familia vive cerca.

Alba trabaja en una empresa de procesado y envasado de pescado en la zona costera, desde hace nueve años fue una oportunidad cuando esta empieza, les dan transporte en bus todo los días trabaja una hora adicional.  Con el préstamo comprara bloques para construir su casa más segura y cómoda y comprara otras cositas y materiales no perecederos  como el hierro. La idea de pagar a corto plazo y renovar el préstamo de modo de construir su casa más segura de bloque, porque la que ahorita tiene es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Alba, age 32, is in a relationship. She studied up to grade 9. Her partner works as a day labourer for various businesses, and he is a seasonal worker at a fish processing plant. Their children live with them and the two eldest go to school. They live alone in their home, but their family live close by.
Alba has worked in a fish processing and packing plant on the coast for nine years. This was an opportunity when it started up; they provide transportation by bus every day that she works an extra hour.
With this loan, she will buy blocks to make her house more secure and comfortable. She will also buy other small items and materials such as iron. The idea is to take out a short-term loan and renovate. Her home will be of bricks, and more secure; it is currently made of wattle and daub.

loans.use: to buy blocks to build a more secure and comfortable home, and to buy other small items and materials like iron.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel estudio hasta segundo grado de básica, tiene 38 años de edad, es empleada, está acompañada.  Ella trabaja de forma eventual en una procesadora de pescado desde el 2003 y a veces como jornalero agrícola,  tienen 3 hijos y todos estudian viven juntos en casa aunque su mamá y hermanos viven cerca, casi a la par. 

Antes Rosibel no trabajaba solo los oficios de la casa, cuando la familia creció y fueron a la escuela los gastos eran mas en la casa. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar bloques y hierro para ir poco a poco construyendo su casa, los  planes son tener una vivienda digna y segura  para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosibel was in school until grade 2. She is 38, employed, and in a relationship. She has been a seasonal labourer in a fish processing plant since 2003, and also works sometimes as an agricultural day labourer. She and her partner have three children and they all live together in their home. Rosibel's mother and siblings live close by.
Rosibel didn't work before, other than housework. As her family grew and the kids went to school, the household costs increased.
She needs this loan to purchase blocks and iron in order to build her home bit by bit. She plans to have a dignified and secure home for her family.

loans.use: to buy blocks and iron to build her house bit by bit.

loans.name: Leidy Esmeralda

texts.es:
Leydi de 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, estudio hasta sexto grado de básica; sus dos hijo  mayores van a la escuela de la comunidad.  

Ella posee una pequeña tienda de víveres  en su casa, vende bebidas, helados y  pupusas los fines de semana con un crédito anterior compro la plancha y aumento la tienda, su mamá le ayuda en el manejo del negocio.
Con el préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas variedad de bebidas y helados.  Debido a que el inventario se le a reducido ya que ha aumentado la demanda de sus clientes, la cliente espera que su negocio sea estable y poder darle el apoyo económico a sus hijos para que estudien y pensar en mejorar la casa, ya que actualmente es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Leydi, age 33, is a single mother of three. She attended school until grade 6. Her two oldest children attend the community school.
She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells drinks, ice cream, and pupusas on the weekends. With her previous loan, she bought her griddle and expanded her store. Her mother helps her manage the business.
With this loan, she will purchase a greater variety of drinks and ice creams. Because her inventory has decreased and her customer demand has increased, she hopes that her business will be stable and able to support her children so that they can study and have a better home; their home is currently wattle and daub.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of drinks and ice cream.

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en:
These group members are part of Truth Group. It consists of three women living in Accra-Teshie, Ghana. This group has requested financial aid of GHS 3,000 from ID Ghana to boost their businesses.

The group's representative, Christiana, is 48 years old and married, with one dependent child, living with them in their own house. She is the group representative. 

Christiana studied until secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies because of many circumstances inside her family. She decided to help her husband in the expenses of their family. 

Six years ago, she started selling palm oil at her residence. Her income from this small business is good, but not enough to develop it. Most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family. Therefore, she applied for a loan of GHS 800 from ID Ghana in order to purchase more palm oil to sell. 

Chistiana looks forward to expanding her business and providing her family with better living conditions. The members will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 35-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and 2 children of 14 and 12 years old in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. She has decided to improve her family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Adela’s family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks, but especially Adela's children to do their homework. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this housewife pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in her house.

loans.name: Vip Vip Group

texts.en: Halima is in her late thirties and a divorced mother of four school-aged children. For twenty years now, she has run a business selling fried chicken. She buys the chickens and cooks them herself from 4:00 pm to midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit. She is requesting her first loan, which she will use to buy chickens, potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams that one day she will be able to improve her life and business. Halima will share this loan with her group, which is called VIP VIP and has three members. Each member will hold the others accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens, potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Pour renforcer son activité de bijoux, de jus et de l'eau minérale commencé depuis 2010, madame Ama sollicite son quatrième crédit pour pouvoir atteindre son objectif. Le gain tiré de la vente lui permettra de créer une boutique vu qu'elle fait son activité de façon ambulante et assurer une meilleure éducation à ses enfants. Mariée à un chauffeur, elle a 03 enfants en charge qui sont scolarisés. L'ainé a 17ans et le dernier 08ans. Ama quant à elle est âgée de 40ans.
texts.en:
Ama, age 40, is the married mother of three dependent children aged 8 to 17 who go to school. Her husband is a driver. 

Ama has been an itinerant vendor of jewelry, juices and mineral water since 2010. Hoping to bolster her activity, she is seeking a 4th loan to meet her objectives. 

The profits earned from her sales will allow her to open a store and to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy pearl jewelry, juice and mineral water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy wheels and spare parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school and two adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, salt, maize flour, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, salt, maize flour, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his land.

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
These group members are part of Promise. It consists of three ladies living in Accra-Teshie, Ghana. This group has requested financial aid of GHS 4,300 from ID-Ghana to boost their businesses.

The group's representative, Getrude, is 56 years old and single with one dependable child, living with her in her own house. She is the group representative.  Getrude studied until secondary school, and decided to start doing business. She started selling jewelry, African fabric, and lace eight years ago through hawking from door-to-door. Her income from this small business is good, but not enough to develop it; most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family. Therefore, she applied for a loan of GHS 3,000 from ID-Ghana in order to purchase more jewelry, African fabric, and lace to sell. 

Getrude looks forward to expanding her business and providing herself and daughter with better living conditions.  They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry, African fabric, and lace to sell.

loans.name: Odanis Del Cristo

texts.es:
Odanis es una mujer luchadora, amante del campo y amorosa madre de 2 hijos menores de edad.
Ella vive en una casa construida en bareque en un terreno que le regalo su madre, desde allí trabaja como independiente con la cría y levante de pollos de engorde.
Inicio su negocio impulsada por la necesidad de conseguir ingresos para su hogar y sostenimiento de su familia. Junto a su compañero trabajan extensas horas en el mantenimiento de sus animales.
Tiene un galpón construido de manera provisional en el que alberga sus pollos.
Ella tiene la esperanza de poder tener un galpón más grande y comprar mayor cantidad de pollos para su producción de esta forma podrá obtener ingresos más estables y garantizara la sostenibilidad de su negocio.
Sueña con tener una vivienda propia y fabricada en adobe.
texts.en:
Odanis is a plucky woman and a lover of the countryside. She is also a loving mother to two children, both under the age of 18 years.

Odanis lives in a house built on land gifted to her by her mother. Odanis works there independently raising chickens to fatten up.

Odanis started her business as she needed an income for her household and to support her family. Both she and her partner work long hours to look after their animals.

Odanis has a temporary shed where her chickens stay.

Odanis hopes to have a larger shed and to buy more chickens. She would then have a more stable income and her business would be sustainable.

Odanis dreams of owning her own home made with adobe bricks.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and to adapt her shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Héctor Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Héctor es un hombre muy trabajador, simpático y emprendedor, dedicado 100% a su familia y a su negocio.
El tiene una salsamentaría en la que vende variados productos como frituras, pasando por carnes frías, hasta licores y cigarrillos, trabaja desde las diez de la mañana hasta las horas de la noche.
Tiene grandes aspiraciones y una de ellas es tener un negocio más grande y ubicado en una zona más central, por esta razón solicita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido y variedad de productos.
De esta forma podrá aumentar su inventario y ofrecerá más productos sus clientes.
Aunque sus hijos ya son mayores, él desea apoyarlos en todo lo que necesiten por eso hace hasta lo imposible por ellos.
texts.en:
Héctor is a very hard-working, kind and enterprising person. He is dedicated 100% to his family and his business.

Héctor has a shop where he sells various items such as fried foods, cold meat, liquors and cigarettes. Héctor works from 10 a.m. until late at night.

Héctor has big dreams, one of which is to have a larger business and for it to be located in a more central spot. 

Héctor is applying for financial support in order to buy stock and a variety of products. With these items he will be able to increase his inventory and offer his customers more goods.

Although his children are now adults, Héctor still wants to support them with everything that they need and so will do anything that he can for them.

loans.use: to buy stock - such as liquors, fried foods and more - for his shop.

loans.name: Sojod

texts.en: Sojod is a 25-year-old, married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband in a simple house in the city. Sojod and her husband started their own business, which is a workshop for making furniture. It is new, but Sojod's husband has some experience from his previous job. Sojod helps her husband with the sewing.  Sojod took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy new tools and machines for making furniture. By taking this loan, Sojod and her husband can start their own business and improve their living conditions.  Sojod appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and machines for their furniture making business.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 36-year-old, married woman from Khan Younis. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. Fatmeh would like to help her husband with part of the family expenses and improve their living conditions, so she decided to open a small grocery store. It is a good business and the demand is high. Fatmeh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more items for the grocery store. By taking this loan, Fatmeh will be able to increase the sales and also her income.  Fatmeh appears in the photo in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more items for the grocery store.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José de 33 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y padre soltero, su nivel de estudio es de primer grado, no estudio más por motivos económicos,  él  no pudo aprender a leer ni escribir.
 
José se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace más de quince años y sus padre fue quien le enseño a trabajar fuertemente  en el campo  ya desde niño su papá lo llevaba a trabajar, él trabaja todos los días  de seis de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde,  viaja unos dos  kilómetros diarios.
Con respecto al crédito lo necesita para la siembra de maíz y frijol compra de fertilizantes, abono y una bomba de mochila, para así poder regar los fertilizantes a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
José, age 33, is a hard-working man and a single father. He was only able to stay in school through the first grade, and then had to leave for economic resources. He never learned to read or write.

José is a farmer, and has been for more than 15 years. He learned about working hard in the field from his father, who took him to work since he was a small child. He works every day from six o'clock in the morning until two in the afternoon, traveling about two kilometers every day. With this loan, he will be able to plant corn and beans, buy fertilizer, manure, and a backpack sprayer to help him irrigate and fertilize his crops.

loans.use: buy the supplies he needs for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Ruth Lourdes

texts.es:
Ruth de 34 años de edad, no tiene grado de estudio,  está casada su esposo trabaja de jornalero, tiene tres hijos dos de ellos van a la escuela.
Ella  se dedica  a la venta de yuca,  pasteles y  antojitos por las tardes en su comunidad, trabajo que ha hecho desde 10 años.  El crédito lo necesita para comprar verduras, carne, maíz, condimentos, yuca, aceite, sal, etc  y para realizar algunos arreglos en su vivienda. Desea poder darle el estudio a sus hijos para que puedan llegar hacer profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Ruth is 34 years old and did not go to school. She is married; her husband is a labourer. The couple has three children, two of whom are in school.

Ruth makes a living selling yucca, pastries and snacks in the afternoons in her community. She has been doing this work for ten years. Ruth needs this loan to buy vegetables, meat, corn, condiments, yucca, oil, salt and more, and to make some improvements to her home. Ruth wants to give her children an education so that they may become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, corn, condiments, yucca, oil, salt and more, and to make some improvements to her home.

loans.name: Doroteo

texts.es:
Doroteo de 68 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado su señora se dedica  a los oficios domésticos y la ayuda a su esposo en su trabajo agrícola, tienen 4 hijos ya mayores, solo uno depende de ellos.
Doroteo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería trabajo que ha realizado por años,  sus padres también se dedicaban a la misma t actividad.

 Necesita el dinero para comprar  abono, fertilizantes y herbicidas, desea poder dejares a sus hijos capital propio para que puedan trabajar y vivir en lo propio.
texts.en:
Doroteo is 68 years old, and he studied until the second grade. He lives with his wife who takes care of the house and also helps him with his agricultural work. They have four children who are now grown, and only one depends on them.

Doroteo works in agriculture and livestock-raising. He has been doing this work for years; and it was his parents’ occupation also. He needs the money to purchase compost, fertilizer, and herbicide. 

He would like to be able to leave his children capital of their own so that they could work and live independently.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, and herbicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the costs of obtaining her title for graduating from the university.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a single mother of eight children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphan). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from poultry farming and from rental rooms. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to sell only wholesale, and also to buy a plot of land and build more rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is now 41 years old and is still doing well in his businesses. He has started a new business venture for construction of houses, which he will rent. His businesses have been doing well, and he gets a monthly profit increase by almost KES 10,000. He has borrowed a loan of KES 94,500, which he will use to purchase building materials to complete his rental houses. With the anticipated profits, he will pay his children’s school fees and loan repayment, as well as expanding his business. His dream is to give the best to his family as the breadwinner, as well as expand his business to a point he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives at the Coastal region.

For the past 2 years, she has been selling goats and cattle at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats and cattle for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cattle for her business.

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is a married woman with seven school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with nine children, eight in school and one adult.

Mbodze has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past 2 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a hardworking and enterprising woman, who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with four children, two of whom are in school and two are underage. Mwanajuma sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school and two are underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past year, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices.  She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Lina María

texts.es:
Lina es una madre muy dedicada a sus hijos y a su trabajo, todos los días se dedica a la venta de comidas como empanadas y otros fritos en un pequeño carro.
Ella se esfuerza día a día para que sus alimentos sean reconocidos en el sector y que esto le permita montar un local en el que pueda vender otros productos.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar insumos e ingredientes para sus preparaciones, de esta forma podrá capitalizar su negocio y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es poder ver a sus hijos crecer como personas de bien, universitarias y exitosas pues seria para ella el mejor regalo que le podrían dar.
texts.en:
Lina is a mother who is very dedicated to her children and her work. Every day she sells food such as empanadas and other fried food from a small cart.
She works hard day by day so that her food will become well-known in the area, and so that this will allow her to open a storefront from which to sell other products.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies and ingredients for her food. This way, she will be able to have more capital for her business and offer more products to her clients.
Her greatest dream is to be able to see her children grow as good, educated, and successful people. This would be the greatest gift they could give her.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a grass-grinding machine to feed his cows.

loans.name: José Paz

texts.es:
José de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato. Esta acompañado su pareja es vendedora en una tienda de venta de productos  de primera necesidad, aun no tienen hijos en común y viven en casa arrendada donde mensualmente pagan una cantidad de dinero.


José es trabajador social de una institución gubernamental que fomenta la salud, la educación, el ahorro familiar, el desarrollo comunitario, entre otros,  él tiene este trabajo desde hace 3 años por su responsabilidad y su estrega al trabajo ha sabido mantenerse estable;  además de este trabajo también se dedica a la agricultura ya que vive en una zona donde es el principal factor económico de la población.

El trabajo ( De trabajador social) es de 8 horas al día y tiene que recorrer varios cantones y caseríos del municipio los cuales transita en bus, en bicicleta y en ocasiones a pie.

El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de material para  el mejoramiento de vivienda, comprara adobes, tejas de barro y madera para mejorar un parte de la casa que está deteriorada, esto le ayudara a tener un mejor lugar para vivir 
	
El sueño de José es tener una familia, tener hijos. Para su negocio desea seguir trabajando para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
José, age 31, has a bachelor's degree. He has a partner; she is a clerk in a grocery store. They do not have any children together yet. They live in a rented home, and pay rent monthly.
José is a social worker and works for a governmental institution that promotes health, education, family savings, and community development, among other things. He has had this job for three years. Thanks to his responsibility and dedication to his work, he has been able to stay stable. On top of this job, he also works in agriculture; he lives in an area where farming is the main economic factor.
His social work job is 8 hours per day. He has to travel through various cantons and hamlets in the area by bus, by bike, or sometimes on foot.
He will invest this loan in the purchase of material to improve his home. He will purchase adobe, clay tiles, and wood to improve a part of his home that is deteriorated. This will help him to have a better place to live.
José's dream is to have a family: to have children. For his work, he wants to keep working in order to cover his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy adobe, clay tiles, and wood to improve part of his home that is deteriorated.

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
The two members of the Noyaa Group are into very active business, as individuals. They both live in Accra-Teshie, Ghana and they got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities. 

The members of the group have small businesses, buying and selling fish, slippon (slippers), and second-hand clothing. In order to be able to get fresh supplies for cash, the group members decided to collaborate with ID Ghana and they are on their ninth group loan cycle.

Simon is 60 years old, on the right in the photo. He is a significant seller of fresh fish and slippon (slippers). He is planning to use his loan to buy fish and slippon to sell to customers in Accra. He resells his products to a customer in the market on a retail basis. Simon expects to make a good monthly profit as a result of this loan and he will reinvest this in his business and provide for small household needs.

loans.use: to buy fish and slippon to sell to customers in Accra.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy five pigs, which she will fatten and sell.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a widow with four children, and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents).  She has a business of selling poultry and poultry feed, and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags chicken feed and chickens. She sells on a retail basis and works seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to be a wholesaler of chicken feed and to start rearing chickens. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to be driven by an expert driver, which she will outfit with a roofed cabin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as sponges, special needles, and thread.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business of poultry farming, and has been in this business for a few months. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feeds and chicks. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. 

Her major business challenges include transportation, poultry diseases, and thieves. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler, buy a plot of land, and build rental rooms. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is a widowed woman and has eight children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Patani

texts.en: Patani is a hardworking and enterprising woman, who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  She is married with seven children, all of whom go to school. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Patani sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of Khangas (women's wrap cloths) for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old. She is married and together they have been blessed with four children. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 15,000 and would like a loan of KES 5,000. She has been in the business of selling water for two years.

She will use the loan to buy a donkey which she will use to transport water to her clients. From her anticipated profits, she will educate her children. Her hope is to have financial stability so as to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a donkey to transport water to customers

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
This is Amina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan, to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Jumwa has operated a coconut-selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Diana Liset

texts.es:
Diana vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Diana  tiene 23 años, vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 años y sus padres en casa propia. Ella ha velado por su hijo todo este tiempo y se ha esforzado mucho por sacarlo adelante.
Diana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, le vende a sus amigas y clientas conocidas, ellas las visita de casa en casa, además los fines de semana ella recibe contratos para brindar sus servicios de fotografía, arte que aprendió de su padre. Ha trabajo durante estos años para sacar adelante a su pequeño, incluso Diana da clases de halterofilia, para poder llevar el alimento a su hogar, Diana es una señora muy trabajadora.
Diana es clienta de Fundación Alternativa, ahora necesita un crédito para la compra de una cámara fotográfica profesional y para una impresora donde podrá imprimir sus fotos, necesita de este crédito ya que es una temporada muy buena para la fotografía por la época estudiantil; Diana además en un futuro no muy lejano tiene planeado ponerse un estudio fotográfico y asi crecer con su negocio.
Agradece a la institución y a Kiva por el crédito ya que con ello podrán mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city in the coastal region with an agreeable climate. It is a very commercial city and is considered the place that joins the coast and the mountains.

Diana is 23 years old and lives with her 2 year old son and her parents in their own house. She takes care of her son all the time and has made a lot of effort to get ahead.

Diana sells cosmetics to her friends and clients she knows. She visits them at their homes. Also on week-ends she receives contracts to provide photographic services, an art she learned from her father. She has worked hard all this time to bring up her son , including giving classes in weightlifting in order to feed her household. She is a hard-working woman.

Diana is a client of Fundación Alternativa, and she now needs a loan to buy a professional camera and a printer to print her photos. She wants the loan now as it is the season with lots of work with students. Diana also plans in the future to open a photographic studio and expand this business. She is grateful to this institution and Kiva for the loan through which she can increase her revenues and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera and a printer to print the photos.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina, mujer de 70 años, no tiene ningún grado de educación, ella esta soltera, vive con un nieto, el nieto no estudia ya que tiene que trabajar para darle el sustento diario a su abuela.

Ella  tiene una pequeña tienda con la que pretenden sostenerse y conseguir para el alimento de su hogar, este trabajo lo aprendió personalmente.

Necesita el préstamo para reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que se encuentra en mal estado y el invierno ya esta muy próximo.

El sueño de  Adelina es seguir adelante, que su tienda crezca y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su nieto para brindarle una vida digna a su nieto
texts.en:
Adelina, a 70-year-old woman, has no education. She is single and lives with a grandson. The grandson is no longer in school, as he has to work to support his grandmother.

She has a small shop with which she tries to provide for herself and feed her household. She learned this work on her own. 

She needs the loan to repair the roof of her residence, since it is in bad condition and winter is very near.

Adelina's dream is to get ahead so that her store grows, and to improve her and her grandson's quality of life so that she can provide him with a decent life.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her residence.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is an ambitious, enthusiastic and full-of-energy young Iraqi entrepreneur. She studied hard to enter the Faculty of Dentistry, and studied hard at the university to achieve her dream of being a dentist. Furthermore, she worked hard to gain practical experience and build a reputation through her precise work and genuine work ethic.

Noor is a 31-year-old single woman with the full support of her family, who are also very proud of her achievements and are watching her attentively to see what additional endeavors she will take on in the future.

Living in a conservative community with restrictions on women working late did not prevent her from delivering her humanitarian mission and adhering to her patients’ needs for afternoon and night dental appointments.

Noor is the managing partner of a dental clinic that was opened five years ago from her savings and some support from her father, and now she is ready to take another step in growing her business. Noor has qualified for a WLIFT loan in the amount of $10,000 to open a dental beauty center and buy dental equipment, such as a dental chair, OPG X-ray, amalgamator, etc.

Noor’s simplicity and lovely personality makes the visit to her dental clinic pleasant, especially to children. As she is aware of her strengths and she likes to work with children, Noor hopes to have a preventive dental care center for children and to launch special preventive programs for them.

As a participant in the WLIFT program, Noor participated in the modular business training offered by the program and will also participate in one-on-one coaching as well as be connected to a business mentor.

loans.use: to open a dental beauty center.

loans.name: Gilberto Evaristo

texts.es:
Gilberto de 73 años de edad, esta casado, padre de tres hijos, su pareja no trabaja, los hijos ya no viven con él porque dos viajaron al extranjero y otro vive en este país pero ya se aparto del hogar de sus padres, todos los hijos son mayores de edad.

Gilberto es agricultor y ganadero desde hace 25 años, la agricultura la ha practicado desde que estaba con sus padres y como no termino sus estudios se dedico a trabajar en la tierra.

El crédito lo utilizara, para pagar el arriendo de 35,000 metros cuadrados de terreno para pasto del ganado y el préstamo le ayudara mucho, ya que las vacas teniendo pasto dan mas leche y eso mejoraría sus ingresos.

Su sueño es seguir teniendo vida y salud para luchar por sus hijos y sacarlos adelante y verlos graduarse de la universidad,  ya que para ellos siempre ha deseado lo mejor.
texts.en:
Gilberto, age 73, is married and the father of three children. His spouse does not work. His children do not live with him because two have gone abroad, while the third still lives in their home country, but apart from his parents. All his children are grown up.

Gilberto has been a farmer and rancher for 25 years. He learned the work alongside his parents, and as he didn't finish school, he began to work the land.

He will use this loan to pay the rent on 35,000 sq.m of land that he uses for cattle grazing. The loan will help in a lot, since cows with more grazing opportunities give more milk, and this will improve his income.  His dream is to stay healthy and living so that he can fight for his children, get them ahead, and see them graduate from university. He has always wanted the best for them.

loans.use: pay the rent on the land where his milking cows graze

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
After five years of teaching in kindergartens, Huda built her self-confidence, gained experience, and saved money to achieve her dream of opening her own kindergarten.

A 36-year-old mother of five, Huda experienced firsthand the challenge of balancing work outside the home and childcare, a common challenge among women in her community. By providing safe and quality early learning environments for children, Huda is enabling women in her community to feel more comfortable about working outside of their homes. The income from her business helps her support her family, and she is also motivated by educating her town’s next generation.

Two years ago, with very little money and little support from her husband, and facing other challenges, Huda opened a private kindergarten and day care center. While many people did not believe in her potential for success, today her successful business gives her a sense of identity and a role within the community.

Huda’s business has created four job opportunities for community members, three of whom are for women, and hopes to employ more women as her business grows. Her growing business and willingness to learn and develop her business skills qualifies her to participate in the WLIFT program and take a SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 7,000 USD. With the loan, she plans to install a special carpet for the kindergarten, purchase educational toys and games, and build a playground in the courtyard.

loans.use: to install a special carpet for the kindergarten, purchase educational toys and games, and build a playground in the courtyard.

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called God is Able and are on their fourth cycle. They are into the sale of rice, cooking oils, noodles, canned fish, underwear, slippers, drinks, and foodstuff. 

Cecilia is one member. She finds herself improving her situation of life through the sales of groceries at her residence. She can help her family and loved ones by doing this. She is very much a fighter, and moreover, a hard-worker with a yearning to work and progress. 

Cecilia is requesting a loan to buy more groceries, as by doing this, she can continue her sales and strive to improve the conditions of her life. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving and it will be very useful for her. She is married with two children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
Juan de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de educación. Esta acompañado desde hace 12 años su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar,  tienen en común 3 hijos una está estudiando segundo grado de educación. 


Juan se dedica  a la industria, a la elaboración de pan durante 16 años, el trabajo lo aprendió de involucrarse en una panadería de una familiar, se decide dedicar a esta actividad debido que no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad era a agricultor.

  El trabajo está a 5 cuadras de su casa lo que le facilita llegar. El principal problema es hacer llevar los insumos hasta su negocio porque tiene que recorrer 26 kilómetros en bus para llevarlos hasta su negocio. El horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.  


El préstamo que está solicitando,  es para comprar insumos para la elaboración del pan, como harina, levadura,  azúcar y miel. Entre otros productos importantes para la elaboración del pan.

El cliente sueña con tener un lugar propio donde tener su negocio,  pues actualmente y desde que lo puso está alquilando;  para su familia sueña con que sus hijos estudien y salgan adelante, espera que ellos al igual que él sean personas de bien trabajadores.
texts.en:
Juan, age 30, studied up to grade 6. He has been in  a relationship for 12 years. His partner does the housework. They have three children together. One of their daughters is in grade 2.
Juan has been a bread maker for 16 years. He learned this work from getting involved in a family bakery. He decided to do this work because he couldn't find another way to help his family. Before doing this work, he was a farmer.
His work is 5 blocks from his home. His main problem is getting certain supplies to his business, because he has to travel 26 kilometres by bus to get them to his business. He works 6 hours per day.
He will use this loan for the purchase of supplies for baking bread, such as flour, yeast, sugar, and honey. 
Juan dreams of having his own space for his business; he is currently renting. For his family, he dreams of his children studying and succeeding. He hopes that they, like him, will be good, hard-workers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making bread, such as flour, yeast, sugar, and honey.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has two children, both currently in school. For the past three years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and increase her savings. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a residential house. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hard-working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her business selling ladies' and children's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Ruth generate greater profits and increase her business capital. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a secretarial bureau. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past four years, Viola has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks, and will help Viola generate greater profits and open another business type. Viola hopes that in the future she will be able to operate a saloon by the end of the year. 

Viola is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Carol has been working hard to manage her retail business selling charcoal, fruit, and vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Carol has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and fruits and will help Carol generate greater profits and increase her capital. Carol hopes that in the future she will be able to open a saloon. 

Carol is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and fruit.

loans.name: Sharot

texts.en:
Sharot is a hard-working woman. She is 23 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Sharot has been working hard to manage her brick laying business. 

To help expand her business, Sharot has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy wood and water and also pay for more labor, and will help Sharot generate greater profits and improve her capital. Sharot hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a house. 

Sharot is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy wood and water and pay for more labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu has operated a food-selling business, selling from home to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments. She dreams of expanding to a Café business. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a single woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling clothes and materials for men, women, and children. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Janet is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with six school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

She operates a kiosk food business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase tea leaves, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is married with no children. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kuvuna has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial supports.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standard. She is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale .Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Amanda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Amanda a sus 67 años es una mujer guerrera, activa y trabajadora. Ella logro levantar sola a sus 3 hijos después de que el padre de los hijos los abandonara desde muy niños.
Ella se dedica a la venta de variedades como accesorios de belleza, blusas, jeans, bolsos, entre otros.
Ella trabaja incansablemente para conseguir sus propios ingresos y aunque sus hijos le ayudan económicamente ella prefiere trabajar.
Es una mujer inagotable, con muchos ánimos y ganas de vivir. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar más surtido de3 productos para su negocio, de esta forma podrá vender más variedad a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y ver a sus nietos crecer.
texts.en:
Amanda, age 67, is a fighter. She is an active and hard-working woman. She was able to raise her three children alone after their father abandoned them at a very young age. 
She sells variety items such as beauty accessories, blouses, jeans, and bags.
Amanda works indefatigably to make her own income. Even though her children help her economically, she prefers to work.
She is a tireless woman with great spirit and a love of life.
She is requesting this loan to purchase more stock of products for her business. This will allow her to sell more variety to her clients.
Her greatest dream is to be able to have her own home and watch her grandchildren grow up.

loans.use: to buy products such as accessories, clothing, and bags to sell.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es: Ángela es una mujer de 56 años de edad que como profesión opto por la psicología, actividad en la que se desempeñó gran parte de su vida hasta pensionarse, pero Ángela es el claro ejemplo que no hay límite de edad para realizar sus sueños puesto que ella siempre le había apasionado la marroquinería pero ejerció la profesión de psicóloga por sugerencia de sus padres, pero encontró una oportunidad con un curso gratuito que ofrecieron y se matriculo en marroquinería, empezando así con el proyecto de montar su propio taller hasta que lo logro, ya que tiene un taller de marroquinería con buenas maquinas, sus acabados son muy demandados por sus clientes, pero tiene un gran problema y es que el proceso de devanación de cuero  lo subcontrata lo que le genera pérdida de tiempo, y dinero en producción. Solicita el crédito para la compra de una maquina  devanadora de cuero, para suplir esta falencia. Su principal sueño es crecer como empresa, cumplir con las fechas de entrega a sus clientes, hacer que su marca sea reconocida en la ciudad, ampliar su taller ya que cuenta con una empleada pero quiere que sean muchas más que junto con sus empleados forjen un negocio que prevalezca en el tiempo y sabe que con esta máquina puede lograr estas metas.
texts.en:
Ángela is a 56-year-old woman who decided to be a psychologist. She did this for a large part of her life before retiring. Angela is a clear example of the fact that there is no age at which it is too late to reach your dreams. She has always loved the leather industry but became a psychologist at her parents' suggestion. She had the opportunity to take a free course. This is how she got started with the project of opening her own workshop, and she achieved it. She has a leather workshop with good machines. Her products are in high demand, but she has a big problem.
She has subcontracted the process of leather wrapping, and this causes her to lose time and money. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a leather spooling machine. Her main dream is to grow as a business, to meet her clients' order deadlines, to make her brand well-known in the city, and to expand her workshop. She currently has one employee, but she wants many more, so that she and her employees can forge a business that prevails. She knows that with this machine she can reach these goals.

loans.use: to buy a leather spooling machine in order to speed up the process, minimize production costs, and meet her deadlines.

loans.name: Selvis De Jesús

texts.es:
Selvis de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a la situación económica que vivia su familia, esta casado, padre de dos hijos, uno de ellos estudia y el otro no va a la escuela todavía por su edad.

Selvis es pescador, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres a la edad de 12 años, también se dedica al entraye de redes de pesca.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar lamina, arena, cemento, para reparar su casa. 


El sueño de Selvis, es dejarle un lugar digno a sus hijos donde ellos puedan vivir, ademas quiere prepararles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Selvis, age 41, studied only through the second grade before he could no longer attend due to his family's economic stituation. He is married, and the father of two children. One of his children is in school, and the other is still too young to attend.

Selvis is a fisherman, work he learned from his parents at the age of twelve. He also works at weaving fishing nets.  He will use this loan to buy sheet metal, sand, and cement to repair his home. Selvis' dream is to leave his children a dignified home where they can live, as well as to prepare them for a better future.

loans.use: purchase sheet metal, sand, and cement to repair his home

loans.name: Pedro Noe

texts.es:
pedro de 35 años de edad,  es un hombre que estudio hasta el bachillerato, ya tiene 15 años de casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos, hasta la fecha han procreado tres hijos una va a la escuela ya esta haciendo octavo grado, y los otros dos los llevan al centro de bienestar infantil, que es donde cuidan los niños y les enseñan como en un kinder.

Pedro se dedica a la reparacion de electrodomesticos y articulos electronicos,  aprendio a reparar televisores etc, cuando estaba pequeño dice que dañaba los televisores para intentar repararlos y de esa manera fue aprendiendo, y asi inicio hace 14 años  decidio dedicarse a este trabajo.

El trabajo lo busca en diferentes lugarares del pais,  se traslada en una moto, su esposa le ayuda aunque sea a conceguirle clientes, él trabaja cada que tiene trabajo entonces no tiene un horario especifico.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar desarmadores, tenasas, extencion, perforadores y para  ayudar a su padre a comprar abono para ir preparando la tierra para la siembra de maiz.
