 Con el prestamo podra salir de la situación en la que se encuentra, porque a retrazado trabajo por no tener los materiales a la mano.Sus sueños son poner un puesto de trabajo en el pueblo vecino.
texts.en:
Pedro is 35 years old and finished his Secondary school education. He has been married to his wife for 15 years. She does domestic work. They have three children. One of them will be starting Grade 8 and the other two go to a daycare where the children are cared for and taught like in a kindergarten.

Pedro works repairing household appliances and electronics. He learned how to repair TV's etc. when he was young. He says that he wrecked TV's in order to figure out how to fix them. And this was the way he learned and started the business he has been in for 14 years. He finds work in different parts of the country, getting around on motorcycle. His wife helps him to find work. He works when he has repairs to do not on a fixed schedule.

The loan that Pedro is requesting is to buy screwdrivers, pliers, extension cords, and drills and also to buy manure to help his father prepare the land to plant corn. With the loan he can get out of the situation he is in. He has to delay his work as he does not have the materials on hand. His dream is to open a repair shop in the neighboring city.

loans.use: to buy screwdrivers, pliers, extension cord, drills and to help his father buy manure to prepare the land.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 29-years-old woman living in Kalerwe, which is in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children; 1  attends school.

For the past 4 years, Rebecca has worked hard to manage her retail shop to sell detergent, bread, soda, curry powder and other items. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy detergent, bread, sodas, curry powder and other items, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and improve family's income. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to boost her business. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy  detergent, bread, soda, curry powder and other items.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, which is in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children; 4 attend school. For the past 5 years, Maimuna has worked hard to manage her food stall to sell fruits and vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Maimuna has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more watermelons, onions, tomatoes, Irish potatoes, mangos, and pawpaws.  Maimuna will be able to generate greater profits and improve her family's income. Maimuna hopes that in the future, she will be able to grow her business. 

Maimuna is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Maimuna who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more watermelon, onions, tomatoes, Irish potatoes, mangos, and pawpaws.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, which is in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children;  all attend school. For the past 4 years, Hilda has worked hard to manage her business to sell spare auto parts. 

To help expand her business, Hilda has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy  oil and will help Hilda to generate greater profits and improve familys income. Hilda hopes that in the future, she will be able to meet customers expectations. 

Hilda is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hilda who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy spare parts and oil.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past two years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase ladies' clothing and will help Josephine generate greater profits and improve her savings. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a boutique. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' clothing.

loans.name: Zamu

texts.en:
Zamu is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Zamu has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Zamu has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Zamu generate greater profits and increase her business capital. Zamu hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a residential plot of land. 

Zamu is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: 17 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Trung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Trung is 50 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 17 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải solidarity group. 

This is Trung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

In the future, Trung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: 07 Thôn 6 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Huyền works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. she is requesting a loan to purchase young cattle to raise and sell in the future. Huyền has been involved in this business for 6 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Huyền is 44 years old and she is married with 3 children. she is the leader of a 4-member group, the 07 Thôn 6 Quảng Hải solidarity group. 

This is Huyền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With the business profits, Huyền hopes for the business to do well, to build a new house, and to travel for a vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase young cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for the purpose of mining.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 44 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Josefina is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Josefina requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

Josefina has been raising ducks for 22 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josefina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth, 43 years old, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school. Janeth works very hard to provide for them. For the past 15 years, Janeth has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Janeth would like to save money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with eight children, all of whom go to school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past year. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka appreciates a previous loan that improved her living standards.  This loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She would like to apply for a new loan to buy  goats for her business.

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy  goats.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a businesswoman who is very hard-working. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is married with six school-going children.

Mejumaa has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yakoob Al- Orok Group

texts.en:
This group is called Yakoob Al-Orok. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB. 

Amat Al-Ghani is a 40-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in their own house. She is the leader of the group. She works as a housewife, and she is very dynamic and vigorous. The husband is the sole breadwinner for the family and his income is not enough to cover all the necessary needs of the house. 

Many years ago, Amat Al-Ghani and her husband purchased a piece of land and they built their own house on that land. This business cost them a lot of money. Unfortunately, they couldn't purchase windows for the rooms, kitchen, and bathroom of the house. This thing makes the rain, sunshine, flies, fireflies, and bad bugs come into the house and cause sickness for the family. 

Recently, they needed financial support to prepare the house to become in a good condition and more safe. As a result, Amat Al-Ghani is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase windows to complete the renovation of their house.
 
Amat Al-Ghani's dream in the future is building more on one floor and renovating it.

loans.use: to purchase windows to complete the renovation of the house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ice-cream materials, such as flour, sugar, and tangs, in order to make ice-cream and sell it.

loans.name: Banader Al-Waytat Group

texts.en:
Banader Al-Waytat is a group consists of four women, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AL-Amal Micro-finance Bank (AMB). 

Banader is a 22-year-old married woman. She is the leader of the group. Banader lives with her spouse in their own house. She is a very dynamic and active woman. 

Many years ago, her husband bought a piece of land and built a house on it. This business cost him a lot of money. He finished the construction of the first floor, but it needs renovation. Banader's husband became unable to renovate the house. For this reason, Banader decided to help him with the expenses of the renovation. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, Banader is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials, such as paint, in order to finish all the renovation of the house.
 
Banader's dream in the future is to complete the building of the second floor and renovate it. She hopes to furnish all her house with new furniture.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as  paint, in order to finish all the renovation of the house.

loans.name: Alcina

texts.en: Alcina is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a fishing  business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy such as net purchase and repair boats. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of $ 200.00. Alcina is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy net purchase and repair boats.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is married with two school-going children. They live in a family house that has electricity and water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Regina has operated a cooking utensil business for the past nine years. She sells from door-to-door so that she can be close to her customers. She dreams of establishing a mini depot in the future. With this loan, she wants to purchase more cooking utensils for resale. She decided to join ID-Ghana to get financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking utensils for resale.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine's group comprises hardworking women. Justine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 4 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells raw food and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bananas and charcoal, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and increase her capital and stock. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a residential plot. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more bananas and charcoal

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a hardworking woman. Norah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Norah has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which deals in sewing clothes.

To help expand her business, Norah has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine and materials and help Norah generate greater profits and improve on capital and savings. Norah hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a clothing wholesale shop. 

Norah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills-training.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children, two in school and one underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase rice, sugar, tea leaves, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, tea leaves, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 36 años de edad,  solo logro estudiar hasta noveno grado, esta  casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y trabaja junto con Carlos en el trabajo de agricultura,  es padre de dos niñas una de 11 años y otra de 5 ambas niñas se encuentran estudiado, una esta cursado quinto grado y la mas pequeña esta estudia parvulario. Cuando las niña están en la escuela Carlos se va junto a sus esposa a trabajar al campo para sacar una buena cosecha de maíz	

Carlos inicio en el trabajo de la agricultora desde los 14 años, trabajo que aprendió debido a la falta de recursos económicos de sus padres. Pero el poder haber aprendido este trabajo a sido una buena sastifaccion ya que debido a ese ingreso que tiene con lo que siembra del maíz a podido darle educación a sus dos hijas y no le ha faltado nada en sus hogar. 

El préstamo lo quiere invertir en la compra de semilla y fertilizante para la siembra y cosecha de maíz y tener un buen cultivo para cuando sea el tiempo lo venderá y sacara buena ganancias y podrá pagar su crédito y darle otro ingreso económico a su familia y manifiesta que solo con los créditos que CREDICAMPO le brinda él puede salir adelante.

En el futuro el desea que sus hijas sea unas profesionales y brindarles un ambiente mejor y poder vivir muy felices con sus familia
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years old. He was only able to study through ninth grade. He is married. His wife takes care of the household tasks and works in farming with Carlos. He is the father of two daughters, a 5-year-old and an 11-year-old. Both daughters are studying. One is in fifth grade and the smallest is in nursery school. When the girls are at school, Carlos goes with his wife to work the land in order to get a good corn harvest.

Carlos started working in farming from the time he was 14 years old. He learned the work due to his parents' lack of economic resources. But having been able to learn this work has been a great satisfaction to him, since due to this income that he has from the corn that he plants, he has been able to give his two daughters an education and nothing has been lacking in their home.

He wants to use the loan to buy seed and fertilizer in order to plant and harvest corn and have a good crop so that when it is time he will sell it and get a good profit and he will be able to pay back his loan and give his family another source of income. He says that only with the loans that CrediCampo provides can he get ahead.

In the future he wants his daughters to be professionals and to provide them with a better environment, and for them to be able to live very happily with their family.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, and fertilizer

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her cosmetic shop, which sells cosmetic items. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic items, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and increase her income. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her income. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juliet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic items

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Deborah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nansana, which is in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children; 2 attend school. For the past 6 years, Deborah has worked hard to manage her food stall business to sell food and beverages. 

To help expand her business, Deborah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bananas  and will help Deborah to generate greater profits and improve her capital. Deborah hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a big supplier. 

Deborah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Deborah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta 8° grado debido a la situación económica, tuvo que dejar la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y tiene una tienda, tienen dos hijos y uno está en la escuela y el otro en kínder, y nadie más vive con ellos.


José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 10 años, pues su padre siempre le dijo que era bueno estudiar pero que también era necesario aprender a trabajar,  siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo. Su día comienza a las 4:30 am para llegar temprano al trabajo pues tiene que caminar 30 minutos para llegar donde tiene la milpa, donde trabaja 7 horas y luego regresa a su casa para pasar un momento con su familia  y ayudar a su compañera.


El crédito será invertido en la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrdaos de maíz y 3,500  de frijol, también comprara semilla, abono y herbicidas.

Sus sueños son:

-  Comprar un  terreno y construir su propia casa (hoy vive en casa de un familiar)
-  Que sus hijos se gradúen en una profesión.
-  Pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and studied up to Grade 8. Due to the family's economic situation he had to leave school. He is in a common-law relationship and his partner does the housework and has a store. They have two children, one of them is in school and the other goes to kindergarten. No one else lives with them.

José has farmed for 10 years. His father always said that it was good to study but it was also necessary to learn how to work. He grows corn, beans and sorghum. His day begins at 4:30 am in order to get to work early. He has to walk 30 minutes to get to his fields where he works for 7 hours. Then he returns home to spend some time with his family and help his wife.

The loan will be invested in the planting of 7,000 sq. meters of corn and 3,500 sq. meters of beans buying seeds, fertilizer and herbicide. His dreams are to buy land and build his own house (they now live in a family member's house), have his children study to become professionals and to pay off his loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and herbicides to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionicio, tiene de 40 años de edad, vive en union libre con su pareja con quien tiene 6 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio la Campa Lempira. Toda su vida la a dedicado a cultivar maiz,frijoles y café,esta produccion la vende en grano en la misma Zona. El préstamo que esta solicitando es por 28,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizates para el cultivo de café. Considera que mejorara la cosecha  y va poder sembrar mas para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dionicio is 40 years old.  He lives in a common-law marriage with his partner.  They have six children and live in a neighborhood in the town of Campa Lempira.  He has worked all of his life planting corn, beans, and coffee.  He sells his crops in the same area where he lives.  

He is requesting a loan of 28,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizer for his coffee crops.  He thinks it will improve the harvest so he can plant more and help his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Maria,tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Quimistan,Santa Barbara. Trabajo por varios años en una maquila y hace un año decidio vender mercaderia como ser lociones, bisuteria, aretes, pulceras etc.  esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante. El prestamo es por 12,000 lempiras para comprar lociones y bisuteria y vender. Su meta es tener el negocio en un local propio, surtido y lograr mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the town of Quimistan, Santa Barbara.  She worked for many years in a garment factory and a year ago decided to sell merchandise such as lotions, costume jewelry, earrings, bracelets, and more.  She does this work as a street vendor.  

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 lempiras to purchase lotions and costume jewelry to sell.  Her goal is to have her business in its own well-stocked store so she can achieve better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase lotions and costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: María De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 61 años de edad caracterizada por sus buenos valores y ante todo por su espíritu para trabajar ya que siempre le ha tocado valerse de sí misma para mantener los gastos familiares ya que su hija estudia en la universidad y siempre se ha preocupado por su preparación tanto así que no le permite trabajar, María se cree autosuficiente para mantener todos los gastos permitiendo que su hija ocupe el tiempo en estudio y trabajas pertinentes a la universidad. 
Ya por todos los gastos que le toca acarrear se le ha vuelto muy difícil el surtido de su negocio y lo está notando muy decaído, razón por la cual solicita el crédito para la compra de surtido de helados y añadido a esto de carne que le distribuye a personas conocidas y familiares, el amor de una madre pro su hija no se podrá medir nunca en la vida y esta mujer no podrá descansar ya de sus años hasta que su hija sea una mujer profesional y competente tanto en la vida laboral como personal lo que es su único anhelo.
texts.en:
María is a 61-year-old woman known for her good values and, above all, for her work ethic, as she has always had to depend on herself to pay for her family's expenses. Her daughter is studying in the university; María has always been concerned about her education, so much so that she doesn't allow her to work. María feels she is self-sufficient; she takes care of all the expenses, allowing her daughter to fill her time with studying and university-related work. 

Because of all the expenses she has to cover, stocking her business's inventory has become very difficult and she is noticing that it is very low. That's why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of ice creams in addition to meat, which she distributes to relatives and people she knows. 

The love of a mother for her daughter can never be measured in life, and this woman will not be able to rest until her daughter is a competent and professional woman, both in her work life and her personal life. This is her only wish.

loans.use: to buy ice cream products in addition to pork, which she will distribute to relatives and friends so that she can continue to cover the expenses of her house and her daughter.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille is 41 years old. She is married with six children. She sells sorghum and rice. 

With the loan, Dancille would like to buy more rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy more items for resale.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nansana, which is in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children; 1 attends school. For the past 5 years, Charles has worked hard to manage his food stall to sell bananas. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bananas and will help Charles to generate greater profits and improve his working capital. Charles hopes that in the future, he will be able to start a retail shop. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bananas.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 29 years old and lives in the town of Makindye, which is in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children; 1 attends school. For the past 3 years, Olivia has worked hard to manage her shoe business. 

To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes and will help Olivia to generate greater profits and open up another store. Olivia hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house. 

Olivia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Olivia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Godeberthe

texts.en:
Godeberthe is 56 years old. She is married, with three children. She owns a hardware shop where she sells construction materials. 

Godeberthe has requested a loan to buy more steel, cement, and lamps to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow to provide milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy more steel, cement, and lamps to sell.

loans.name: Tomas De Jesús

texts.es:
Tomas de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, actualmente esta casado, ha procreado una hija que ya es mayor de edad pero ya esta acompañada. Su esposa se dedica a la costurera, ella hace remiendos y cualquier tipo de costura que le llega.  Su nieto que vive con ellos, va a la escuela. 

Tomas se dedica a la agricultura ya tiene cinco años de dedicarse a la agricultura esto lo aprendio, él solo cuando salia con sus padres que ellos son jornaleros, pero que en la necesidad les toco dedicarse a la agricultura para tener la comida diaria, tambien tiene trabajos eventuales como por ejemplo va hacer sus quincenitas a un hospital, su funcion es de vigilante; pero dice que solo gana para los pasajes, le queda lejos como dos horas hace en bus asi que decidio, este nuevo año sembrar el maiz y frijol para tener comida durante el año. Su esposa le ayuda cuando llega el tiempo de sacar el maÍz y de vez en cuando le ayuda a limpiar. Su horario se lo acomoda dependiendo, la cantidad de trabajo que tenga.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla, abono, herbicidas y pesticidas, para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
texts.en:
Tomas is 53 years old. He studied up to third grade. He is married and has a daughter who is now an adult and has a partner. His wife is a seamstress, she does repairs and any kind of sewing that comes her way. His grandson, who lives with them, goes to school.

Tomas works in agriculture and has been doing so for five years. He learned by himself, when he used to go out with his parents who are labourers, but necessity forced them to become farmers to be able to feed themselves. He also has temporary jobs such as, for example, he will go to do his two weeks in a hospital, his job is as a guard. However, he says he only earns enough for the journey, as it is two hours away by bus. 

Therefore, at the start of this year, he opted to plant corn and beans to have food during the year. His wife helps him when the time comes to harvest the corn and occasionally helps him with the weeding. The hours he works depends on the amount of work he has.

The loan he is requesting is to buy seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides, in order to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides, in order to plant 7,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Jaime Enrique

texts.es:
Jaime es un joven ecuatoriano de 18 años de edad es soltero, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia Pastocalle de la provincia de Cotopaxi, este sector es muy reconocido ya que la mayoría de la población se dedica a la elaboración de materiales de aseo como escobas, trapeadores y cepillos.  Vive en este mismo sector junto a su familia, no tiene hijos, el lugar donde vive es en una zona rural de la ciudad su clima es muy frío por el mismo hecho de encontrarse al norte de la ciudad y cerca del volcán Cotopaxi, considerado como el mas grande del Ecuador.
Con el sacrificio de sus padres Jaime pudo terminar la secundaria, y por la situación económica tuvo que trabajar. Jaime es nativo de la parroquia de Pasocalle del cantón Latacunga provincia de Cotopaxi, desde muy pequeño ha tenido el alma de un luchador. 
El crédito que ahora Jaime requiere y nos pide es para la compra de material y fertilizantes para las siembras que tiene de cebolla y así aumentar su producción. 
Muy humildemente Jaime quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Jaime is a young Ecuadorian who was born in the town of Latacunga, in Pastocalle parish, which is in the province of Cotopaxi. This area is quite well known, since most of its residents work making cleaning supplies like brooms and mops. He is eighteen years old, single, and doesn't have any children. He lives with his family in a rural area of town. The weather is very cold there because it is in the north of the town, near Cotopaxi volcano, which is the largest in Ecuador.

Thanks to the sacrifices made by his parents, Jaime was able to finish high school. After that he had to start working due to the financial situation. Ever since he was little, he has always had the soul of a fighter. The loan that Jaime is requesting is to buy farm supplies and fertilizer for his onion crops, so that production may increase.

Jaime wants to humbly express his sincere gratitude and congratulations to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making his business and personal growth possible.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chris

texts.en:
Chris is 32 years old and lives in the town of Masindi, which is in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who attend school. For the past 5 years, Chris has worked hard to manage his spare parts business.

To help expand his business, Chris has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts, and will help Chris to generate greater profits and boost the business. Chris hopes that in the future he will be able to establish more rentals. 

Chris is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Chris who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi, which is in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 7 years, Jane has worked hard to manage her shop to sell general stationary and cold drinks. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stationary items and will help Jane to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a residentail house. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy stationary items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cassava, soap, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and lives in the town of Masindi, which is in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 6 years, Esther has worked hard to manage her Stationary shop to sell reams of paper, books, toilet paper, and file boxes. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a new printing machine and more reams of paper, books, toilet paper, and file boxes, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and construct a  house. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to establish an internet café. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a new printing machine and more reams of paper, books, toilet paper,and file boxes.

loans.name: Meddi

texts.en:
Meddi is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kijura, which is in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who attend school. For the past 5 years, Meddi has worked hard to manage her welding business, which deals in welding metallic doors and windows. 

To help expand his business, Meddi has requested a loan of 4,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials for welding, and will help Meddi to generate greater profits and increase the family income. Meddi hopes that in the future, he will be able to produce hign quality goods. 

Meddi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Meddi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy  welding materials.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kijura, which is in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Julius has worked hard to manage his retail shop to sells sweets, blue band, soft drinks, bread, sanitary pads, and pampers. 
 
To help expand his business, Julius has requested a loan of 4,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar ,rice, maize flour, cassava flour, and beans, and will help Julius to generate greater profits and increase his income. Julius hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a grinding machine. 

Julius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Julius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, cassava flour, and beans.

loans.name: Jacquilene

texts.en:
Jacquilene is 24 years old and she has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Jacquilene and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Jacquilene is taking out a housing loan, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jacquilene has been a Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her buy-and-sell frozen food business.

With your help, Jacquilene can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 58 years old and married, with one child in school. Erlinda works very hard to provide for her family.

Erlinda's business and family home were destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Erlinda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Erlinda has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Erlinda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 61 years old, married, and has five children.  

Norma and her family  survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Norma is taking out a housing loan, amounting to PHP 7,000, to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Norma has been a Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her agriculture business: rice-planting.

With your help, Norma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es una joven de 25 años de edad, esta a punto de terminar sus estudios de Relaciones Públicas, ella vive con su hermana la cual se hizo responsable de ella desde el momento que su madre falleció, han logrado cumplir metas que juntas se han propuesto. Carolina se destaca por su gran don como bailarina, especialmente Floklore costarricense, con lo que ha logrado representar a nuestro país en los cinco países que ha bailado, ganando en los primeros lugares del concurso. Ella desea este crédito para terminar su carrera universitaria ya que son las últimas materias para cumplir con su plan de estudio. Ella inicio con esta actividad hace seis años, la iniciativa vino desde el momento que vio a su hermana con mucho trabajo y que debía terminar un pedido muy grande en un tiempo establecido, su hermana le enseño y desde ese momento le continua ayudando. Aunque se inicio con poco capital de trabajo, actualmente cuenta con las máquinas necesarias para empastar libros y un cuarto que acondicionaron como taller.Carolina se destaca por su gran carisma y ganas de culminar sus estudios para mejorar su condición de vida que su hermana siempre ha luchado para que sea la mejor. Ella sueña con apoyar a su hermana económicamente y que ya no trabaje más, para ella continuar asumiendo todos los gastos del hogar. Eligió Fundación Mujer por su baja tasa de interés y buen servicio.
texts.en: Carolina is a 25-year-old young woman. She is just about to finish her studies in Public Relations. She lives with her sister, who took responsibility for her from the moment their mother died. They have been able to reach goals to which they have set their mind together. Carolina stands out for her great talent as a ballerina, especially Costa Rican folklore, with which she has succeeded in representing our country in the five countries in which she has danced, winning first place in the competition. She wants this loan in order to finish her university course, since she has reached the last subjects to complete her study plan. She started working six years ago. The initiative came from the moment she saw her sister had a lot of work and that she had to finish a very large order in an established period of time. Her sister taught her and from this moment she continues to help her. Although they started with little working capital, currently they have the machines necessary to bind books and a room that they fitted out as a workshop. Carolina stands out for her great charisma and desire to finish her studies in order to improve her living conditions, which her sister has always fought to make better. She dreams of supporting her sister economically and for her sister to not work anymore, and for her to continue taking on all of the household expenses. She chose Fundación Mujer for its low interest rate and good service.

loans.use: to pay for the last quarter at the University

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene is 27 years old.  He is single and sells shoes. He has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes for his inventory. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business  .He was very successful with the previous loan which was used to restock his inventory.

loans.use: to buy  used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Annonciata is a 51-year old woman with six children; all attend school. 

She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum, cassava flour, and peanuts to sell. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, cassava flour and peanuts.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 60-year- old married woman with three children. She sells cooking oil and soaps. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil and soaps to sell. The profits will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es: Jose,tiene 35 años de edad,es casado,tiene 5 Hijos y reside en el Municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara. Lleva 12 años de dedicarse a comprar y vender envases,botellas plasticas,hierro,aluminio,lata,etc para vender en las empresas recicladoras. el compra chatarra y luego la vende. El prestamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar material desechable y vender como ser hierro, plásticos, latas, aluminio etc. Su proposito es llegar a tener un negocio grande de reciclaje y con las ganancias darle el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old. He is married, has five children, and lives in the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Barbara. 

For 12 years, he has earned his living buying and selling containers, plastic bottles, iron, aluminum, tin, etc., to sell to recycling companies. He buys scrap and then sells it. 

The loan that Jose is requesting is for 10,000 lempiras (HNL) to buy recyclable material to sell, like iron, plastic, tin cans, aluminum, etc. His intention is to eventually have a large recycling business, and to use the earnings to give his children an education.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials to sell, like iron, plastic, tin cans, aluminum, etc.

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del peñón es un pequeño municipio ubicada en el departamento de león donde la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la explotación y venta de oro, cada día más el comercio va creciendo,  Mina la india es una comarca que le pertenece a dicho municipio es aquí donde habita la señora Cándida Rosa. 

La señora Cándida Rosa de 54 años de edad casada no tiene hijos  bajo su cargo, su esposo está desempleado con lo poco que ella gana mantiene el sustento diario de su hogar.
 
Tiene 17 años de iniciar esta pequeña fritanga el cual consiste en la venta de comida a trabajadores que laboran en la mina y de la misma forma le vende a estudiante y clientes de dicha comarca este negocio lo empezó con sus propio esfuerzo, pero son sus sueños crecer un poco más en su negocio. 

La forma de vender, esto lo hace en su propia casa de habitación, esta idea le surgió por la necesidad que la zona presentaba en no contar con ningún comedor.
  
El destino del crédito solicitado es para la compara de: queso, pollo, plátano, verdura, aceite, Arroz, Frijoles y Azúcar, esto sería de gran importancia para mejorar el crecimiento de su negocio.   

Espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio de Kiva y Ceprodel de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho en el desarrollo de su vida.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is one of the small municipalities that make up Mina la India, in the department of León. Most of its residents work mining and selling gold, and trade is growing day by day. This is where Cándida Rosa lives. 

Cándida Rosa is 54 years old and married. She has no children in her care. Her husband is unemployed and she manages to provide for her household with the little money she makes.
 
She has been running a small foodstand for seventeen years, where she sells meals to the mine workers. She also serves students and other customers in the area. She put all her effort into starting her business, and she would like to see it grow a little more. Her food stand is located in her home. She decided on this idea to fill the need for dining space in the area, since there was none.   

She will use this loan to buy cheese, chicken, plantains, vegetables, oil, rice, beans, and sugar. This will be instrumental to improve her business growth.

She hopes to God she will continue to have the privilege of receiving these small loans through Kiva and Ceprodel, which are of such great help to her in life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, chicken, plantains, vegetables, oil, rice, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super-typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Julieta will be able to rebuild her devastated life more quickly. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 37 years old. She has one child who is four years old.

She sells clothes and has spent nine years in the business. With the loan, she should like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 61 years old and married, with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca's business and family home were destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rebecca has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rebecca has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Rebecca is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Deden

texts.en:
Deden runs a small stall which sells snacks, mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. He has been running this stall for two years.  Deden lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Deden is married.

To increase the family income, Deden also works as a dealer.  He joined Ruma two months ago to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. 

Deden is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Deden is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will be able to help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer to process bill payments

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 47 years old. She has operated a bookshop for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more books and other educational materials to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more books and other educational materials.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married and has two school-aged children. They live in a rental house that has electricity and water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Patience has operated a second-hand clothing business for the past 2 years. She sells on an outside paved area close to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini kiosk in the future. 

With this loan, she wants to purchase quantities of second-hand clothing to resell. She decided to join ID-Ghana to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase quantities of second hand-clothing.

loans.name: In God Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called "In God" and are on their 6th loan cycle. They sell vegetables and fresh fish.

Ruth is one member of the group. She has improved her situation of life by selling groceries from home. She helps her family and loved ones by doing this. She is  a fighter and  a hard-worker with a yearning to work and progress. 

Ruth requests a loan to buy more vegetables and fresh fish.  This will allow her to  continue her sales and improve the conditions of her life. She is grateful for this opportunity; it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fresh fish.

loans.name: Cạy

texts.en:
Cạy operates a food stall/restaurant selling crabs. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Cạy is 59 years old, and she is married with four children. She lives  in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Cạy faces in her life is not having money to repair her latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair the toilet. This is Cạy’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Cạy hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to repair her toilet.

loans.name: Đoàn

texts.en:
Mr. Đoàn operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. He has been involved in this business for six years.

Đoàn is 30 years old, and he is married with two children. He lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Đoàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his business. Đoàn has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a latrine; his family shares a neighbor’s latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Đoàn hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 43 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 4 children.
Carmen works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 7 years. She has requested a loan for additional capital to purchase more fish to sell.
Carmen has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is married and has three children. She is 50 years old and lives in the Pagadian.

Conception is a farmer who grows fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. 

She has requested a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer for her garden. She has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Conception hopes to become a fruits distributor in their place.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 40 years old, married, and has five children.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emerita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Emerita has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emerita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Erna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Erna is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Erna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae works hard to support her family. Cherry Mae is married and has a photography business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like printer ink, lamination paper, film, etc for her photography business

Cherry Mae has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Cherry Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like printer ink, lamination paper, film,  etc for her business

loans.name: Ma. Presentacion

texts.en:
Ma. Presentacion works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 9,940 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Ma. Presentacion will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Florieta

texts.en:
Florieta is 42 years old and has seven children. She is a widow and has two children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Florieta is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 8,200 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Florieta has been an NWTF borrower since 2010. She plans to recover through her rice farming.

With your help, Florieta can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to expand her business to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 32 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Rowena and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Rowena is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Rowena has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her sari-sari store business.

With your help, Rowena can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Pacita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Pacita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is taking out a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has four children. She is running a fishing business, which helps her to generate income for her family. She will use this loan to buy net and to repair boats. She opened her fishing business a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Fatima is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy net and repair boats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Purchase High Yielding Grafted Cacao Trees

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Lolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 39 years old, married, and has four children.

Teofila and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Teofila has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Teofila can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 33-year-old married man with three children. He works as a seasonal worker to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. David has requested a loan to pay for an air ticket, clothing, a visa, an x-ray and pocket money. He joined SPBD in 2014. With his earnings, he hopes to improve his family's living standard and support his children's education.

loans.use: to pay for an air ticket, clothing, a visa, an x-ray and pocket money

loans.name: Soliya

texts.ru: Солия жительница района Шахритус, ей 48 лет. У нее четверо совершеннолетних детей, из которых трое сыновей и одна дочь. Солия в данный момент работает поваром в детском саду. Ее единственная дочь занимается швейным делом. Солия хочет тоже параллельно заняться шитьем. Она умеет кроить и шить таджикские женские платья. Солия планирует совмещать работу с швейным делом, так как хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Однако она нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить для себя вышивальную швейную машинку и принимать заказы. Солия надеется, что таким образом она сможет помочь мужу в обеспечении семьи.
texts.en: Soliya is a resident of the Shahrituz district, and she is 48 years old.  She has four adolescent children, three sons and one daughter.  At the present time, Soliya works as a cook at a kindergarten.  Her only daughter is involved in sewing.  Soliya wants to also get involved in sewing concurrently.  She can cut and sew Tajik women's dresses.  Soliya plans to combine her work with the sewing business because she wants to improve her family's financial situation. However, she needs a loan to purchase an embroidery machine and start accepting orders. Soliya hopes that this way she would help her husband with providing for the family.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and start her own sewing business

loans.name: Munavvara

texts.ru:
Мунавваре недавно исполнилось 27 лет. Она уроженка района Шахритус. Мунаввара замужем за охранника. Сама она преподает в местной сельской школе. В данный момент Мунаввара и ее муж планирует начать собственный семейный бизнес по животноводству. Они решили заняться откормом и продажей крупнорогатого скота, для ведения которого имеются все условия в их районе. В их селе имеется хорошее пастбище для животных. 
К сожалению для реализации цели их собственного капитала не хватает. Поэтому Мунаввара обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить четыре голов крупнорогатого скота. Она надеется, что им дадут шанс, чтобы начать свой бизнес и решить финансовые проблемы семьи.
texts.en: Munavvara recently turned 27 years old.  She is a native of the Shahrituz district. Munavvara is married to a security guard. She teaches at the local village school. At the present time, Munavvara and her husband are planning to start their own family business in animal husbandry. They decided to get involved in fattening up and selling cattle, a business for which their district has all of the necessary conditions. Their village has a good pasture for livestock. Unfortunately, they do not enough of their own capital to achieve their goal. This is why Munavvara requested this loan to buy four heads of cattle. She hopes that they will get the chance to start their own business and solve the family's financial problems.

loans.use: to buy four heads of cattle in order to start her own business

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia” La cual  está constituida por 06 socios responsables y entusiastas. Mirian de 54 años de edad es casada. Ella se dedica  a la venta de tamales. Su mayor deseo es implementar su local para poder exhibir sus productos.  Solicitó el crédito para la compra  de maíz, carne, cebolla y aceituna. El grupo “Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia” agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Mirian es la tercera del lado derecho y viste 	casaca con raya celeste.
texts.en:
This is the new group "Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia," which consists of 6 responsible and enthusiastic members. Mirian is 54 years old. She is married and makes a living selling tamales. Her biggest wish is to open a stand to market her products. She applied for a loan in order to buy corn, meat, onions, and olives. 

The group "Mujeres en Acción De Fhiladelfia" thanks everyone who facilitated this loan. Mirian is third from the right and is wearing a striped blue jacket.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, onions, and olives

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has been a farmer for many years. With her husband, she is managing their own farm of corn and she earns well, providing the needs of the family. She was also able to successfully repay her previous loan, used for farm inputs. She never stops working on their farm because it is their only main source of income. 

To prepare for the coming planting season, Erlinda took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to save for their future needs.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Cimarron Group

texts.es:
En una humilde familia de la comunidad de Pichiyacu conocimos a LUCIA, joven de 22 años de edad. Quien gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres. Termino la secundaria en Borbón. Por la falta de centros educativos en su comunidad. Actualmente Lucia compra y vende cacao fino de aroma. Negocio que heredó de sus padres de 56 y 60 años y que aún viven con ella.A más de este negocio, también se dedican al cultivo de plantas de cacao. Para aprovechar sus tierras.
Las aspiraciones de Lucia. Son convertirse en una gran empresaria en el tema de cacaotener mayor productividad y mejorar ingresos. De esta manera. Lucia dará trabajo a los jóvenes de su comunidad ya que tienen la tierra y están gustosos de trabajarla.
En la comunidad se consume el agua de lluvia o del rio. Ya que no se cuenta con servicio de agua potable. Lucia es muy participativa y le encanta hacer deporte con sus compañeros de grupo.
El grupo cimarrón: llamado así por el apellido de varios de sus integrantes. A demás de tener su significado ancestral. Son 12 integrantes y recibirán los nuevos$500 y quienes hacen el segundo préstamo. $700   siendo en total $7400
El líder del grupo está saludando en la fotografía.
texts.en:
In a humble family in the Pichiyacu community, we meet Lucia, a young woman at 22 years old, who thanks to the strength of her parents finished secondary school in Borbón due to the lack of education centers in her community. Lucia currently buys and sells Cacao Fino de Aroma, a business that she inherited from her parents who are 56 and 60 years old and still live with her. Aside from this business, they are also dedicated to the cultivation of cacao plants in order to make the most of their land. 

Lucia's aspirations are to become a great businesswoman in the cacao industry, to have greater productivity and to improve her income. In this way, Lucia will give work to the young people in her community since they have land and are happy to work it. The community gets their water from the rain or from the river since they cannot count on safe drinking water. Lucia is a great participator and she loves to play sports with her group companions. 

The Cimarrón group is named for the last name of many of its members, aside from having its ancestral meaning. It is made of 12 members and they will receive $7400 in total; $500 for the new members and $700 for those who are doing their second loan. The leader of the group is waving in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase Cacao Fino de Aroma.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of eggs business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Jessica is borrowing 1,800 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp. She is getting a solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency. Jessica is aware that by using a solar lamp she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Agusta to improve her business. She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, Coca Cola, Fanta, Sagiko, bread, eggs, and body lotion. She has been involved in her business activities since 2010. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Agusta independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, Coca Cola, Fanta, Sagiko, bread, eggs, and  body lotion

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and has five children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Virginia and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Virginia is taking out a housing loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Virginia has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Virginia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “CRISTO REY NICOLAS DE PIEROLA” se encuentran muy satisfechas por encontrarse pasando el 20 ciclo. Luisa  tiene 60 años es casada con  un hijo educando en la universidad. Ella se dedica a la costura compostura de todo tipo de prenda desde muy joven. El crédito lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser y en la compra de agujas hilos telas cierres para su trabajo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Luisa es la primera persona parada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Cristo Rey Nicolas de Pierola" are very satisfied to have passed through 20 loan cycles. 

Luisa is 60 years old, she is married and has a son studying at the university. She has made a living sewing all types of garments since she was very young. She will use the loan to maintain her sewing machine and buy needles, thread, cloth, and clasps for her work. 

The group thanks Kiva investors for the loans offered. Luisa is the first person standing on the left.

loans.use: to maintain her sewing machine and buy thread, needles, cloth, and clasps

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La Joven Rosalina habita en el municipio de santa Rosa del peñón, comarca mina la india departamento de león, una comarca donde se explota el oro y el comercio cada día más va creciendo.  

La Joven Rosalina de 45 años de edad casada cuenta con una hijita  bajo su cargo la cual estudia primer año en la universidad, con lo poco que ella gana mantiene el sustento diario de su hogar y los gastos universitario de su hijita.
 
Tiene dos 12 años de iniciar esta pequeño negocio y le ha permitido sobrevivir, dicho negocio consiste en la venta de carne de cerdo, esto lo vende a consumidores y pequeños comedores ubicado en la zona.
  
El destino del crédito solicitado es para la compara de Cerdos en pie para luego destazarlo y vender la carne de igual forma compra carne de res para vender a consumidores de la zona.     

Espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio de Kiva y Ceprodel de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho en el desarrollo de su vida.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a young woman who lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón in the Mina la India region of the Department of León. It is a region where gold is mined and trade is growing everyday.
Young Rosalina is a 45-year-old married woman with a young minor daughter. She is studying in her first year of high school. What little they earn for their daily bread keeps their home and pays her daughter's high school expenses.
Twelve years ago, Rosalina began this small business that has allowed her to survive. Her business is the sale of pork. She sells to customers and small restaurants in the area. 
The purpose of the loan she is requesting is the purchase of a pig that she will butcher and sell the meat. She will also purchase beef to sell to the customers in her area. She has hope in God that she will continue to receive the privilege of Kiva and Ceprodel for these small loans that help a lot in her life and its development.

loans.use: to purchase pork and beef

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 45-year-old mother of five children.

To earn a living, she helps her husband operate their own farm. For five years, they have been growing and harvesting coconuts and other crops, which has allowed the couple to provide for their family. She explains that she works very hard to support her husband because she dreams of having a better future.

In order to expand their farming operations, she is seeking to borrow a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase organic fertilizers. Going forward, she wants to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to expand and improve her farming business by purchasing organic fertilizers

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna lives in Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental.  She is a widower and earns a living by owning a sari-sari store business. She applied her membership to Paglaum MPC in 2010. Once she heard about all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one.  She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pay her loans in a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for a loan of PHP 4,000.00 for additional capital for her sari-sari store. She will buy inventories of sugar, noodles, matches, milk, and oil to sell. She wants to raise more income and help expand the business. She has found comfort in her financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for additional inventory for her sari-sari store.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is married with four children. She is 51 years old and lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban in the Philippines.

Florentina sells logs and timber to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 50,000 to finance her logging business.She wants to build a storage room of her inventories.

Florentina has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to build a storage room of her inventories

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For many years, the couple has earned well to provide for the family. She had planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to have higher returns. In the future she wants to provide a good education for her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia is from Rizal, Ozamis City. She is a 53-year-old married mom with four children. She has been growing and harvesting vegetables for a living.  Aside from her garden, she also operates a business weaving nipa to sell. With her generated income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy materials for manufacturing nipa. Currently, Cornelia took a loan  which will be used to purchase fertilizer to improve her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Chino

texts.en:
Chino has been providing transportation services in his community for more than three years. He earns well from this. He wants to provide his family with a better living and save for the future of his child.
