Recently, he took a new loan new to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance. In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business and wants to save his profit to use it when they get old.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es: Don Leonidas tiene 48 años de edad,es casado tiene un hijo, reside en el municipio de Quimstan,Santa Barbara. Hace mas de tres años que se dedica a comprar y vender materiales para reciclar como ser hierro,plasticos,articulos electrodomesticos en mal estado y otros para reciclar. Esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante. el préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar materiales de reciclaje como botellas plásticas, hierro, y otros para reventa. Su plan es crecer en su negocio e incrementar las ventas para terminar su casa.
texts.en: Don Leonidas is 48 years old, married with a son, and lives in the town of Quimstan, Santa Barbara. He has made a living for the past three years buying and selling recyclable materials such as iron, plastic, electrical appliances in bad condition, and more, to recycle. He conducts his this business as a traveling vendor. He is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy recycled materials like plastic bottles, iron, and others for resale. His plan is to grow his business and increase sales to complete the construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like plastic bottles, iron, and others for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more of goats in order to raise and sell them in the local markets .

loans.name: Al- Noor Baghdad Group

texts.en:
Al- Noor Baghdad is a loan group. It comprises of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. Zubyda is the leader of the group. She is 54 years old and a widow with five children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest one is 22 years old. Zubyda is an educated woman and is vigorous and dynamic. She works as a housewife and she has a lot of duties inside her house. Her husband was the sole breadwinner for the family. He passed away several years ago. After death of her husband, Zubyda assumed the responsibility of the family. Her oldest child shares her in that responsibility. He works in a private sector and the money that he earns is not enough to cover the expenses of the family. Zubyda says that her house lacks of many home appliances and she can’t afford this condition. For example, inside her kitchen, the oven is very old. She needs a new one to make good breads, cake, and other delicious food. 

The Al- Noor Baghdad group is requesting a 260,000 YER loan from AMB. Zubyda will use her 80,000 YER portion of the group loan to purchase a new oven to prepare delicious bread and cake. She looks forward to furnishing her house with new furniture and hopes to purchase all the home appliances she needs in order for her house to be comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven to make delicious bread and cake

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is married. She sells different items in her general store. 

Lea requested a loan, which she will use to buy more lotions, utensils and soaps for sale. She will use the profits from the business to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more lotions, utensils and soaps to sell

loans.name: Renubala

texts.en:
Renubala is a married woman of 51 years from the rural village Baroghoria in the district Jalpaiguri, where she lives with her husband and only one son.  They have a small kachha house there (mud, bamboo and straw-made).  Both Renubala and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their son is in school in grade 10.

Renubala's husband Jogen, aged 57 years, has been engaged in agricultural activities for ten years.  He has an inherited plot of land where he grows potatoes, beans and other vegetables.  He sells the produce in the local markets and earns income for the family's livelihood.  But the income from this business is too scanty to give the family enough financial sustenance.  To help her husband and to generate additional income for her family, Renubala started animal husbandry.  She has a milk cow and she sells milk in her neighborhood.

In order to expand her business she wants to purchase a cow and for that, she needs money.  So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She will utilize the loan for purchasing another cow and she hopes to improve her milk supply business.  It will provide her a steady income to tide them over rough patches and allow them to save up for their son's future.

In the future she aspires to construct a concrete-made house with the profit from her business. She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk supply business.

loans.name: Hussniya

texts.en:
Hussniyah is a persistent, self-made entrepreneur with 30 years of experience in various careers. Although she started her professional life in sewing workshops, specializing in embroidery and rug weaving, circumstances and opportunity led her to open her own grocery store.

A 52 year old mother of six children, Hussniyah had a challenging marriage and her life has not gotten easier since her divorce five years ago as she is now the sole caregiver and provider for her children. Despite traditional roles and cultural norms in her town, she entered the commercial world of men to open her grocery store at the age of 49. In the last five years her business has grown steadily, attracting clients; adding new goods and merchandise; and creating new job opportunities for community members. Currently she employs four individuals and expects that number to increase.

Hussniyah’s growing business and willingness to develop her business skills qualified her to participate in the WLIFT program and take a SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 8,000 USD. With the loan Hussniyah plans to purchase new products, increase her stock, and purchase inventory software to organize and track her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase new products, increase her stock and purchase inventory software to organize and track her merchandise

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
Marvis is a father of two children who attend school. He is 56 years old and married.  For the past seven years, he has been sewing for both men and women, and also for children. He works from 7:30 A.M. to 10:00 P.M. daily, and is able to make a very good profit each month.

This will be his seventh loan from ID-Ghana. He successfully repaid his previous loans that he invested into his tailoring business. His business has grown substantially and he needs this loan to buy different materials to sew and sell to his customers. Marvis used his profits to cover part of his children's school fees, food expenses, and shop expenses, also to expand business. He dreams to expand his shop and employ apprentices. 

He will share this loan with his loan group members, which total four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy different materials to sew and sell to his customers.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel owns an oil change center in the area of Sana'a, Yemen and lives near his store. His store is situated close to other oil change centers.  It is challenging for him to attract more customers. This competition highly affects his daily business. 

To grow his business income and differentiate him from his competitors, he decided to purchase more equipment. He hopes that this strategy will be positive and bring customers to his center.

He cannot act upon his strategy without some capital, so he requested a Kiva loan of 500,000 YER through Kiva's field partner AMB to purchase a car battery charger and a motor generator. 

Adel is married and he looks after his children and aging parents, but he hardly spends time with them due to his business.  Adel looks forward to opening another center. He hopes to provide his family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase a car battery charger and a motor generator for his center.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de 8 hijos, de los cuales 4 son mayores de edad e independientes y los otros 4 cursan su secundaria. Habita en la comunidad de Bilwas, que se localiza a 45 minutos del área urbana de Waspam. Cuenta con una experiencia de aproximadamente una década de ser docente. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales para mejorar el techo de su vivienda de tambo de madera: laminas de zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las acondiciones para vivir de manera segura y digna.
texts.en:
She is originally from Waspam. She is 50 years old and is a single mother with 8 eight children of which four are independent adults and the other 4 are in secondary school. She lives in the community of Bilwas, which is 45 minutes away from the urban area of Waspam. She has approximately a decade of teaching experience. 

She is applying for a loan to buy materials like zinc sheets and nails and to pay workers to improve the roof of her wooden stilt home.  Her dream is to have a home that provides her with the conditions to live in a safe and dignified manner.

loans.use: to buy materials like zinc sheets, nails, and to pay workers to improve the roof of her wooden stilt home

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago came to the United States over twenty years ago with the dream of creating a better life for both himself and his family. In 1998, he started working as a handy man for multiple hotels in the state of Florida; however “handy man” is most certainly an understatement. A jack of all trades, Santiago focuses on everything from maintenance to janitorial work and effectively ensures the hotels run smoothly and efficiently. 

In 2004, two hotels in particular required Santiago to incorporate, and thus, Solutions Maintenance, Corporation was born. He has received a steady flow of business of the past few years and has earned a reputation as a hardworking and friendly man. However, Santiago needs to purchase new cleaning equipment in order to provide better and expanded service to his growing customer base.

Help this hardworking man make a better life for both himself and his family!

loans.use: to purchase new cleaning equipment

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
After nine years as a tractor-trailer driver, Catherine decided it was time to go into business for herself. Her greatest success was finally earning the money to get her own truck. However, she has found it difficult to get the money to bid on additional contracts. This loan will allow her to do just that.

Catherine's vision is to grow the company and one day hand it over to her son. "I come from a small town in New York, and jobs are hard to come by," explained Catherine. She hopes this company will one day employ people from her town. 

Help this entrepreneur fulfill her vision and provide jobs in her hometown!

loans.use: to bid on additional contracts.

loans.name: Nereida

texts.en:
Nereida, originally from Cuba, immigrated to the United States over ten years ago with her husband in pursuit of a better life. Her husband spent many years working in the trucking and transportation industry, while she focused on business and accounting. Longing to both work together and own their own business, Nereida and her husband decided to combine their talents and create GM Cargo, Inc. 

GM Cargo, Inc. acts as a transportation service for multiple businesses, with the most notable being TBS Factoring. They have hired two drivers, with Nereida's husband acting as a third. Nereida handles the accounting and payroll for the enterprise. Working together, Nereida has grown to love owning her own enterprise and cites freedom as a motivating factor for their success. 

In order to expand her business and fulfill more contracts, Nereida needs the money to fulfill them. Help this hardworking entrepreneur grow her business!

loans.use: to fulfill additional contracts.

loans.name: Maria Eladia

texts.es: Doña Maria Eladia, es soltera, tiene hija mayor de edad habita con ella y vende cosméticos para ayudar a su mama en lo poco que puede, Doña Maria depende de sus ingresos por la venta de Productos de Pulperia, lo que ofrece a su clientela que tiene establecida, ella es el único sustento de su hogar, y con lo que vende logra pagar los gastos básicos del hogar y comprar nuevamente sus productos pero necesita incrementar su inventario por lo que solicita crédito para comprar  Azúcar, Aceite, Abarroteria, Cosméticos y otros productos de pulperia.  Su propósito es incrementar su inventario cada día.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Eladia is single. Her adult daughter lives with her and sells cosmetics in order to help her mother as much as she can. Doña Maria depends on the income from sales to an established clientele in her corner shop. She is the bread winner in  her household. She uses her the income from sales to pay for basic expenses for her household and to buy new products. 

She needs to increase her inventory, so she is applying for a loan to buy sugar, oil, groceries, cosmetics, and other corner shop products. Her goal is to increase her inventory every day.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, soap, groceries, oil and other products for her corner shop

loans.name: Karina Lissette

texts.es: Karina tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hijo de 4 años y sus pequeña hija de un año de edad. Karina trabaja como empelada en una empresa cercana a su localidad desde hace dos años. Karina solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir una galera  para la pila y una puerta para el servicio sanitario que actualmente lo tiene con una cortina de tela. Con el préstamo comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, lamina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Karina is 20 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner, their 4-year-old son, and their small one-year-old daughter. She has worked as an employee in a business near her home for two years. 

Karina applied for this FUSAI loan since she hopes to construct a shed for her washing basin and a door for her bathroom which currently only has a cloth curtain. With the loan, she will buy cement, sand, bricks, galvanized sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails to build a shed for her washing basin and a door for her bathroom.

loans.name: Renie

texts.en:
Renie provides transportation services within their community in order to make a living. He has been providing these services for more than eleven years. He was able to provide the needs of his family and successfully repaid his previous loan used for motor accessories. He always finds ways to earn money for the family. 

Currently, he is taking another loan to buy new set of tires. In the future, Renie wants to provide his family with a comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis was removing junk from his estate one afternoon and noticed the egregiously high costs associated with such a simple task. A few days later, he decided to create a business focused on providing this service of removing junk from properties at more reasonable rates. Now, 10 years later, Unwanted Clutter Co. is thriving and looking to expand. 

He currently works with his son and fiancée. While the greatest part of the business has been the opportunity to become a reality TV show, Louis draws his inspiration from the daily satisfaction of his customers and hopes to continue to expand. In order to do so, he needs to purchase an additional vehicle.  

Help Louis grow his junk removal service!

loans.use: to purchase an additional vehicle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita helps her husband in operating their own transportation service to make a living.  Having operated this business for more than five years, the couple have been able to provide the family needs and to successfully repay her previous loan used for repairs. 

To maintain a better service, she has taken new loan to renew licenses and buy new tires. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to renew licenses and buy new tires.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo  manages a farm as a tenant farmer. He plants and harvests corn and coconuts to sell in town.  He has been doing this for more than 15 years and also has offered transportation services. With his generated income, he successfully repaid his previous loans used for these activities. He always finds ways to gain higher returns for it is his only source of income. To prepare for the next planting season, he took out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds. His hopes and dreams are to have a better future and an improved farm to have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella  owns and operates a plot of farmland, raising bananas to earn a living. With her husband, she has successfully meet their needs and has repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. She wants to improve the farm to gain more returns for the family. She took out a new loan to purchase farm chemicals, fertilizer, and new seeds in preparation for the next planting season. In the future, Bella's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals, fertilizer and new seeds

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey helps his parents with their transportation service business for a living. His previous loan from GDMPC Microcredit, which he used in this business, was successfully repaid. He also helped support his parents in their daily expenditures.  

Jeffrey has taken a new loan now to buy motor accessories and new tires. He always wants to improve the business in order to have his own transportation service business for his own family. In the future, he hopes and plans to have another motorcycle to be used for expanding his service-based business.

loans.use: to buy motor accessories and new tires

loans.name: Enid Tatiana

texts.es:
Enid es una joven de 18 años, ella siempre ha soñado en ser una gran enfermera para ayudarle a los demás, ella tuvo que desplazarse a vivir a una ciudad debido a que el municipio donde vivía no habían los suficientes medios para salir adelante y poder cumplir los sueños , ella siempre desde la infancia le ha tocado bastante duro, ella vive con la mama, siempre han sido una familia muy humilde, debido a esto la única que trabaja en la casa y lleva los gastos es la mama. 
Ella actualmente estudia Auxiliar De Enfermería y  va cursando el segundo semestre de enfermería, para llegar hasta ahora le ha tocado bastante duro y ha logrado las cosas con mucho esfuerzo, ella sueña con ser una profesional y poder ayudar a la mama y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella necesita el convenio de kiva porque la mama es la única que responde con los gastos en la casa y a ella le parece una buena ayuda para que las cuotas le queden un poco más económicas de lo que ella tiene que pagar mensual, ella esta ayuda le serviría mucho  ya que el dinero que se ahorra al momento de realizar los pagos mensual le puede servir para gastos en la casa o en el transporte.
texts.en:
Enid, 18, has always dreamed of being a nurse in order to help others. She had to move to live in a different town because the town where she's from had no opportunities to get by and achieve her dreams. Ever since childhood, she has had a hard life. She lives with her mother and they've always been a family of humble means. Because of this, her mother is the only one who has an income and pays the household costs. 
She is currently studying to be a Nursing Assistant. She will be taking her second semester of nursing. To get so far, she has worked quite hard and achieved things with great effort. She dreams of being a professional and being able to help her mom and have a better quality of life. 
She needs the loan from Kiva because her mother is the only one that pays the expenses at home. The loan is a good help to pay the fees because the loan repayments are smaller monthly payments. This helps her greatly because she can save the money she needs to make the monthly repayments and use some of the savings for household costs or transportation.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en: Angelica is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She is applying for a loan of $800 (USD) to improve her business. She opened her clothing kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $800 (USD). She earns a good income from her business. She will use her loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as long- and short-sleeve shirts, trousers, shorts, and bags. She is a very hard-working woman and operating her business has become her regular activity for the past three years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy long- and short-sleeve shirts, trousers, shorts, and bags

loans.name: Gerónima

texts.es:
La señora Geronima habita en el municipio de santa Rosa del peñón, comarca mina la india, una comarca donde la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la explotación de oro y a la comercialización. 

La señora Geronima 57 años de edad soltera tiene una nieta bajo su cargo ella estudia en la secundaria, con lo poco que gana mantiene el sustento diario de su nietecita y el de ella.
 
Tiene cinco años de iniciar esta pequeño negocio el cual consiste en la venta de eskimo, gaseosa y la venta de pescado, este negocio lo empezó con esfuerzo propio en su vida, pero son sus sueños obtener un mayor crecimiento y  vivir en mejores condiciones. 

La forma de vender su producto, esto lo hace en su propia casa de habitación y sale a vender pescado a la comarca más cercana de su municipio.
  
El destino del crédito solicitado es para la compara de Eskimo, Gaseosa, Pescado y dos termos para poder movilizarse a la venta de pescado.     

Espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio de Kiva y Ceprodel de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho en el desarrollo de su vida
texts.en:
Geronima lives in the Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality in the Mina la India region.  Most of the inhabitants of this area work at mining gold and selling it.

Geronima is 57 years old and single.  She has a granddaughter under her care who goes to high school.  With the little that she earns, she provides the daily support for her granddaughter and herself.

She started this small business five years ago.  It consists of selling ice cream, soft drinks, and fish.  She started this business with her own effort.  She dreams of getting increased growth and having better living conditions.

The way that she sells her product is from her own house.  She also goes out to sell fish in the closest region in her municipality.

She will use the requested loan to buy ice cream, soft drinks, fish, and two thermoses in order to be able to move around when selling fish.

She hopes to God that she will continue receiving this privilege of the small loans from Kiva and CEPRODEL.  They help her a lot in evolution of her life.

loans.use: to buy ice cream, soft drinks, fish, and two thermoses.

loans.name: Nandintsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Nandintsetseg, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been growing and selling vegetables on her land since 2011. Her husband is an electrician and works at a power plant. Their children go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to offer a food delivery service to local people. She is a good cook, and besides growing vegetables, she wants to do something that generates income. Her food delivery service is a good idea, as her home is near many small construction sites. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to offer a food delivery service.

loans.name: Cheila Carolina

texts.es: Cheila Carolina es una joven mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene 23 años de edad y habita en el barrio La Batea del municipio de La Gateada. Ella anhela tener su propia granja productora de cerdos y aumentar la oferta en los próximos años, también desea enseñarle a su hijo de tres años de edad cuando sea grande y termine de estudiar alguna carrera profesional, su esposo que es comerciante de queso le apoya con el manejo técnico de los cerdos y la comercialización cuando se cumple el periodo de engorde de los mismos. Cheila solicita el crédito para comprar 6 cerdos, los cuales engordará durante 4 meses, proporcionándoles una alimentación balanceada que incluye maíz que su misma familia lo produce en su finca como parte de las actividades agrícolas que por varios años le han proporcionado estabilidad.
texts.en:
Cheila Carolina is a very hardworking and enterprising young woman. She is 23 years old and lives in the La Batea neighborhood of the municipality of La Gateada. She longs to have her own farm producing pigs and to increase the offering in the coming years. She also wants to teach her three-year-old son to run the business when he is grown and has finished studying for a professional career. Her husband is a cheese merchant and he supports her with the technical management of the pigs and selling them when their period of fattening is completed. 

Cheila is asking for the loan to buy six pigs that she will fatten over four months, providing them with a balanced diet including corn her family produces on their farm as part of the agricultural activities that have provided them with stability for many years.

loans.use: to buy six pigs that she will fatten over four months in order to sell

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan José es un hombre de 36 años edad, emprendedor y dedicado por completo a las actividades comercial y de recreación como son venta de carne, repuestos de moto y brindar el servicio de molienda a su vecinos. Junto a su esposa quien administra el negocio han procreado tres hijos, todos estudian y también apoyan a sus padres en sus horas libres. Don Juan quiere proporcionar mayor seguridad a su familia y negocio ubicando verjas de metal en el porche de su casa, ya que algunas veces ladrones han querido entrar para robarle, dicha mejora en su casa necesita de la compra de tubos, varillas, 5 discos de 7 pulgadas, 2 potes de pintura y 60 platinas con los cuales construirá las verjas necesarias.
texts.en:
Juan José is a 36-year-old, enterprising man who is completely dedicated to his business and recreation. He earns a living by selling meat and motorcycle spare parts, and by providing milling services to his neighbors. His wife does the administrative work for his business, and they have three children who are in school and help their parents in their free time.

Juan wants to make his home more secure for his family and business by installing a metal gate on the porch of his house because thieves have tried to get in and rob him several times. To make this improvement to his house he needs to buy tubes, rods, 5-7" discs, 2 cans of paint, and 60 bars to construct the necessary gate.

loans.use: to buy tubes, rods, 5- 7" discs, 2 cans of paint, and 60 bars which he will use to construct the necessary gate.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom lives with her family in the south of Tajikistan. She is a careful mother of four children. Her children Mastona, Farruh, Muhammajon and Murotjon are not yet adults. She always wanted to start her own business. Dilorom is going to start a business selling food. She built a food shop with this aim. Now, she is going to buy food items and begin her new business. Her food shop is located near her living house. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy food items for organizing a new business

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 34-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband. She’s cooperating with her husband in order to satisfy their family needs. As for her, she started her work in the agriculture since 3 years ago. Today, Hiyam is demanding to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy new agriculture requisites such as seeds, seedlings for plantings...  in order to improve her business and, therefore, increase her productivity. Hiyam has big responsibilities to care for and this is the perfect time to better develop her work and enlarge her earnings.

loans.use: To buy new agriculture requisites such as seeds, seedlings for plantings

loans.name: Soliha

texts.en:
Soliha is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a rental worker. Their family's living condition is so poor that Soliha decided to organize her own business deal. She is going to help her husband to earn a living. 

Soliha wants to organize a business of a beauty salon. She will open her salon in her house. She took part in a course, “To get Ahead”, at a women’s organization. Soliha got a certificate and is happy about it. 

She needs financial support to start her new business. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy equipment for a beauty salon and to repair her workshop. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her beauty salon and to repair her workshop for organizing the new business.

loans.name: Tuty

texts.en:
Tuty is married and has three children. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Tuty decided to start a new animal husbandry business in order to generate income to contribute to her home’s finances. She studied the "To Get Ahead" course with a women's organization and got enough skills for business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. 

Tuty is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy cattle to organize a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for a new business

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en: Miguela prepares and sells cooked food in her community. She has been in business for more than 16 years. Miguela earns good income for her family's daily expenditures and supports her children's education. Her family helps her in her business and she is very happy working with her family. With her income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. To improve sales and meet her customers' orders, she took out a new loan  to purchase raw ingredients to prepare more food for sale. GDMPC has been her partner in improving her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare more foods for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 45, resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Porferio and she is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Susan oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits to her a boundary (daily quota) each day. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Susan is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories, and also to pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Susan hopes to have more units of tricycle and she dreams to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
This is Eliza, 69, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Constancio, a farmer, and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eliza operates a house rental business. It is rented on a monthly basis. She also has a farm with different plants and trees for additional income. She earns a minimum of 30,000 PHP in sales every month.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. 

Eliza dreams to continuously expand her business and hopes for good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

loans.name: Mirembe Kawuwa Group

texts.en:
The group is located in a rural area and is composed of 7 members who include: Sulaina, Florence, Olivia, Rosemary, Veronica, Mary and Paulina. They carry out different activities which include farming, animal rearing, retail shops, arts and crafts, and coffee selling.

Sulaina is a married woman aged 53 with 10 children of whom 4 are attending different schools in different areas. She is also taking care of 6 children who are orphans. She deals in farming where she grows crops like coffee, maize, beans and bananas. She also trades coffee as her side business. She started her business in 1990. She works 6 days in a week and 10 hours per day. She started her business to improve on her income and to get food for the family. She acquired this loan to purchase coffee and to add to another business of trading bark cloth which is much sought after by traders from the city especially those that sell crafts. It is also used for traditional functions.

Her future hope is to educate her children and the challenge she faces is the poor weather conditions. She is an honest and hardworking woman. The group thanks the Kiva lenders for the tremendous support rendered to them.

loans.use: to buy coffee for trade.

loans.name: Balikuddembe Kigenya Group

texts.en:
This group previously benefited from a Kiva loan and they are very grateful.

Margret, a retail trader, used the loan to buy items that expanded her business and gave her a competitive edge over other retailers. Her profits grew by at least 45%. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their generosity and she and the group members are committed to maintaining their partnership. Margret will use this loan to buy a fridge that will keep her perishable goods and beverages fresh and cold. This, she hopes, will also boost her sales. She is hard-working and thanks UGAFODE for the great work in the communities. 

The lady standing in the photo is the UGAFODE credit staff.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos comes from a cell, in Kanoni subcounty of Kiruhura district. He is married with six children who are all in school. He is a very honest and hardworking man.

Enos deals in cattle fattening and cattle trade. He has applied for a loan of ugx.2,500,000 Ugandan shillings to help him buy more cattle for fattening and, with the remainder, to pay school fees for his children. 

His major challenge is heavy sunshine, which dries up all the grass and water, leaving the animals helpless with nothing to feed on. If he gets this money, he hopes to construct a dam to store water during the dry season. This will help him to maintain the business at a sustainable level.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for a dam.

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is 31 years old and is married with two children. She is running a carpentry business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy wood for making buildings, chairs, tables, cabinets, dining tables and chairs for schools. 

Belina opened her carpentry business in 2011 with her own working capital of $200. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a builder. She is happy with the loan because it will help her to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy wood for making buildings, chairs, tables, cabinets, dining tables and chairs for schools

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a member of a youth group in Nairobi. He and his group recently decided to embark on a project to build and run a pay-per-use sanitation facilities for income generation. He is also a representative for the youth at the chief's office. 

Maurice seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets for his group. He hopes that the toilets will help create a cleaner environment and generate income to offset the loan. He hopes to grow this franchise in future to create employment opportunities for the youth.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Belkin Geovanny

texts.es: Belkin es una joven mujer soltera de 21 años de edad, habita en el Barrio La Batea del municipio de Muelle de los Bueyes, es estudiante de la carrera de Licenciatura en Derecho y tiene mucha experiencia en el área de comercio ya que tiene varios años de poseer una pulpería la cual le ha permitido obtener ingresos para pagar sus estudios y apoyar a su familia que es de escasos recursos económicos. Belkin necesita ampliar su negocio y ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes quienes han crecido por su tan esmerada atención y buenos precios, ella solicita el crédito para abastecer el negocio con productos como refrescos artificiales, jugos, bebidas energéticas, aloe, cuajadas, huevos, carne de res, pollo, carne de cerdo, crema y frutas frescas para elaborar refrescos naturales.
texts.en:
Belkin is a young, single 21 year old woman.  She lives in the La Batea neighborhood in the Muelle de los Bueyes municipality.  She is a law student, and she has a lot of experience in the area of commerce.  She has had a food store for several years.  This has allowed her to get income to pay for her education and to help her family, which has scarce financial resources.

Belkin needs to expand her business and offer a variety of products to her customers.  Her customers have grown because of her painstaking attention to them and her good prices.

She is requesting the loan to stock the business with products like soft drinks, juices, energy drinks, aloe, curds, eggs, beef, chicken, pork, cream and fresh fruits to make the natural soft drinks.

loans.use: to stock her food market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business selling alcoholic beverages, soft drinks, french fries and sweets, among others. He hopes to merge this with his billiards hall to create a complete recreational site for his neighbors.

loans.name: Erika

texts.en: Erika is studying for an AB in Mass Communication at a university in Mindanao. Her mother died soon after she was born and her father earns a living by preparing roasted pigs to sell. She recently began living with her grandparents. Her previous loan was used to pay her previous school tuition fees. She is continuing her studies and has done the next semester enrollment. She took a new loan again to pay for the summer class tuition fees. She is hopeful to become successful in order to help those who supported her in her younger age.

loans.use: to pay for the summer class tuition fees

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 43, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married and she has children. She and her children manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Yolanda dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Maryuri Del Socorro

texts.es: Es originaria de Rosita, tiene 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 10 años cursa su quinto grado de primaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Cuenta con una experiencia de 9 años de ser docente. Su esposo también se dedica a la docencia. Con esfuerzo hace año y medio compraron una pequeña vivienda de madera y tambo. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda y que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales, para construir un cuarto de minifalda de concreto y madera: Cemento, bloque, madera, clavos, zinc, arena fina, arena gruesa, hierro y cubrir los costos de mano de Obra. Anhela tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de su familia y comprar electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Maryuri is from Rosita.  She is 30 years old, and is married with two children. The eldest is 10 and is in the 5th grade in elementary school; the little one is two years old. Maryuri has been in education for 9 years, and her husband is also an educator.

A year and a half ago. with great effort, they bought a small wooden house on stilts. In order to improve their house so the family can live in a dignified and secure manner, she is asking for her first loan so she can buy materials to build a minifalda room (concrete base and wooden walls). She will use the money to buy cement, cinder blocks, wood, nails, zinc, fine and coarse sand, iron, and to pay for labor costs.

She dreams of having a safe home with the basic conditions necessary for her family's comfort, and to be able to buy appliances.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a room with a concrete base and wooden walls: cement, cinder blocks, wood, nails, zinc, coarse and fine sand, iron, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Maritza Teresa

texts.es: Es originaria de Rosita, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada, tiene dos hijos, menores de edad. Cuenta con una experiencia de 13 años de ser docente. Su esposo, también es maestro. Vive en una comunidad llamada SanSanWas, que en sumo/Mayagna significa: Agua de Pino, que se ubica a 20 kilómetros del área urbana de Rosita, el viaje dura aproximadamente una hora. Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años habita en una casa de madera y tambo que se encuentra en regular estado. El préstamo que está solicitando por primera vez a Pana Pana es para construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus hijos y familia en general.
texts.en: Maritza is originally from Rosita, she is 21 years old, and is married with two young children. She has 13 years of experience being a teacher. Her husband is also a teacher. She lives in a community called "SanSanWas," which in the Sumo/Mayangna language means "Pine Water." It is 20 kilometers from the urban area of Rosita, and the trip takes approximately one hour. For about ten years Maritza has lived in a wooden house on stilts that is currently in mediocre condition. The loan that she is requesting for the first time from Pana Pana is to build a house with a heavy concrete and wooden base. Her dream is to have a safe home with the basic conditions for the comfort of her children and her family in general.

loans.use: to build a house with a heavy concrete and wooden base.

loans.name: Karla Antonia

texts.es: Es originaria de Rosita, tiene 23 años de edad, soltera. Con el objetivo de estudiar su carrera universitaria, trabaja de lunes a viernes en una casa comercial, gracias a los ingresos percibidos, le han permitido comprar una pequeña vivienda de concreto.  Solicita su primer préstamo para comprar materiales para repellar su vivienda: cemento, arena fina y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es ser una exitosa profesional.
texts.en:
Karla is from Rosita. She is 23 years old and is single. She works from Monday to Friday at a business so that she can study for a university degree. The money she has earned has allowed her to buy a small concrete house.

She is asking for her first loan to buy materials to plaster her house.  She will use the money to buy cement, fine sand, and to pay labor costs. Her dream is to become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy materials to plaster her house.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora habita en el municipio de santa Rosa del peñón, comarca mina la india departamento de león, una comarca donde la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a explotar oro y al comercia. 

La señora Teodora 57 años de edad casada no tiene hijos  bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana mantiene el sustento diario de su hogar, su esposo trabaja en la explotación de oro en una pequeña mina que se encuentra ubicada en la comarca donde habita.
 
Tiene dos años de iniciar esta pequeña pulpería el cual consiste en la venta de cosméticos, y alimentación para la población, este negocio lo empezó con un pequeño capital que lograron obtener de la ganancia de su esposo, pero son sus sueños vivir en mejores condiciones. 

La forma de vender su producto, esto lo hace en su propia casa de habitación, esta idea le surgió porque el trabajo que ejerce su esposo es un riesgo para su salud y en un futuro pretenden sobrevivir de esta pequeña pulpería.  
El destino del crédito solicitado es para la compara de Maíz, frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite Arroz Y cosméticos para un mejor surtido en su negocio.    

Espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio de Kiva y Ceprodel de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho en el desarrollo de su vida.
texts.en:
Teodora lives in Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality, in the India region of León, a region where the majority of the population works in mining gold and business. Teodora is 57 years old, married, and does not have children dependent upon her. With the little she earns she supports her home. Her husband works in gold mining in a small mine located in the region where she lives.

Two years ago she began a small convenience store where she sells cosmetics and groceries. This business began with a bit of capital that they saved from her husband's income, but their dreams are to have better living conditions. The store is located within their home, an idea that that emerged because her husband's work is a health risk and in the future they plan to live of of this small convenience store.

The loan will be used to buy corn, beans, sugar, oil, rice and cosmetics to better stock her business. She trusts in God to continue receiving support from Kiva and Ceprodel through these small loans that help her so much in the development of her life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, oil, rice and cosmetics to better stock her business.

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en: Amarzaya, 38 years old, lives with his wife and children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been growing vegetables such as potatoes, carrots and cabbage since 2012. After harvesting his vegetables, he sells them to local people at wholesale prices during autumn. Now he is requesting a loan of 1125 USD to buy potato and carrot seeds in order to begin growing vegetables. This agricultural business is the only income source of his family so growing vegetables earlier helps him to increase the output.

loans.use: to grow vegetables

loans.name: Thôn 7-Hoằng Hải Group

texts.en:
Nga works in furniture manufacturing. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Nga is 45 years old and she is married with two children.

Nga is the group leader of the Thôn 7-Hoằng Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members.

Nga lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Nga has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.



With her business profit, Nga hopes to remodel her house, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more material for furniture making

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen operates a service-based business, providing beauty parlor services in the local community, while her husband does farming. Belen has been providing this service for more than nine years. Her services are quite good. She had a better income to meet their needs and she successfully repaid her previous loan, used for the business. 

Currently, Belen is taking a new loan to purchase new cosmetic products, in addition to her beauty services. She plans to use the profit generated from the parlor to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase new cosmetic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fee and buy education equipment.

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en: Anunciacion is a widow who previously managed a farm for a living. Her children, who already have their own families, want her to settle down with them but she wants something to do on her own. She opened and started to operate a general store in their village. Currently, the store is running well. Her previous loan from GDMPC used in her farming activities was successfully repaid. To improve her store, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, Anunciacion wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Es una señora amable, tiene 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 14 años, cursa su segundo año de secundaria y el menor de 8 años, estudia su segundo grado de primaria. Trabaja mesera en un restaurante del municipio de Rosita. Desde hace 12 años habita en una vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera. Con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales, para mejorar el techo de su vivienda: Láminas de zinc, clavos, madera, material para curar la madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de familia en general.
texts.en: Rosalia is a friendly woman, 30 years old, married, with 2 children. Her oldest is 14 years old and in his second year of secondary school and her youngest is 8 years old in second grade in primary school. She works as a waitress in a restaurant in Rosita. For 12 years she has been living in a home made of concrete and wood. With the goal of improving her home, she is seeking her first loan to buy materials to improve her home's roof: sheet metal, nails, wood, wood treatment, and labor. Her dream is to have a concrete home with basic amenities for her family's comfort.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her home's roof: sheet metal, nails, wood, wood treatment, labor.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, shampoo, water, bread and oil. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $200. Elsa is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, shampoo, water, bread and oil

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Es un señor cordial, originario de Rosita, tiene 51 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos, mayores de edad e independientes. Trabaja como docente de educación técnica en una institución del Gobierno Central. Desde hace 10 años habita en una vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera, en la cual habitan 6 personas. Con el objetivo de tener su propia vivienda, con sus ahorros y aguinaldo compro un terreno. Solicita su primer financiamiento para construir su vivienda y vivir de manera segura y digna con su familia. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de familia en general.
texts.en: Edilberto is a friendly man, originally from Rosita, who is 51 years old, married, with four grown independent children. He works as a technical education teacher in a Central Government institution. For ten years he has lived in a home with a heavy wooden and concrete base, with 6 other people. With the goal of having his own home, he bought land with his savings and bonuses. He requests his first loan to build his home and live in a safe and dignified way with his family. His dream is to have a secure home with the basic conditions for the comfort of his whole family.

loans.use: to build his home.

loans.name: Harini

texts.en:
Harini made an early payment. The due date should have been in the next 2 months. However, Harini sold a large number of fish to a big buyer and she earned a nice profit. She’s very happy for that. 

To improve her business, Harini is re-applying for a loan to MUK. With the new loan size of 10,000,000 IDR, Harini will buy a place in the market where she can sell her fish. Before, she only rented a place. She has a new plan to increase her business with the greater number of customers she can meet at the new place.

Pursuing this business, Harini hopes to get satisfactory results. She could meet the needs of the family and she will save all the profit to support her children's education until university.

loans.use: To buy a place in the market to sell her fish.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married. She has two children. For the last 5 years Irina has had her own business - selling shoes at the local market. She loves her business and would like to develop it further. 

Recently Irina remodeled her house. Her family now lives in much better conditions. At the same time Irina spent a lot of money and now her business needs working capital.

Irina is asking for a loan to purchase more inventory to increase her assortment of shoes. She hopes to receive additional profit and start saving for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to increase her assortment of shoes.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don Antonio es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor desde que percibió los grandes problemas económicos que atravesaba su familia, tiene 54 años de edad y habita en el municipio de Muelle de los Bueyes. Él anhela tener su propia granja productora de cerdos y aumentar al doble de la actual oferta en los próximos años, también desea enseñarles a sus hijos 3 hijos quienes un estudian y saben cuán importante es desarrollar esta rentable actividad. Antonio solicita el crédito para comprar 7 cerdos, los cuales engordará durante 4 meses, proporcionándoles una alimentación balanceada que incluye maíz que el mismo lo produce en su finca como parte de las actividades agrícolas que por varios años ha desarrollado como una manera de subsistencia.
texts.en: Antonio has been a hardworking, enterprising man ever since he noticed the significant economic challenges his family has gone through.  He is 54 years old and lives in the Muelle de los Bueyes municipality. He dreams of having his own pig farm and doubling his current offering in the next few years. He also wishes to teach his children, who still are in school and know how important it is, to develop this profitable activity.  Antonio asks for this loan to buy 7 pigs, which he will fatten for 4 months, giving them a balanced diet that includes corn that he grows on his own farm as part of the agricultural activities that he has developed for a number of years as a way to survive.

loans.use: to buy 7 pigs, which he will fatten for 4 months to make them marketable

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian operates a motorcycle transport service for a living, and has been doing this for many years. She earns a good income from this and had successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for spare parts and accessories. To continue to provide a good service, she took a new loan to purchase a new set of tires. In the future, Vivian hopes that she will be able to buy another motorcycle for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Lorgenia

texts.en:
Lorgenia owns and operates a retail store for a living. Aside from this, she also has a coconut farm, which she harvests and sells in town. With these activities, she earns a good income to sustain their living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilization of her farm, but this previous loan didn't cover all areas of her farm. 

To complete the fertilization of her farm, she took a new loan currently to buy organic fertilizer for her coconut farm. In the future, Lorgenia wants to be successful in her business and be able to improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her coconut farm.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ruth dreams of having workers that will help her in her business, and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase merchandise: dairy products, basic grains, rope, toilet paper, sardines, sodas, ground beef, instant soups

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with seven children. With three children currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jocelyn has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jocelyn has taken a PHP 5500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jocelyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rudianto

texts.en:
Mr Rudianto lives in Kuantan, in Riau province on Sumatra Island.  Rudianto explains himself how and why he became a reseller of Nazava water filters: “One of the basic daily needs for all living beings, in this world is water. Without water, there is no possibility of life in the world.
Unfortunately, clean water is not available everywhere, in the area where I live there is no access to clean water.  Therefore, we buy large bottles (19 L) of mineral water for our daily drinking water needs. These bottles get ever more expensive. We never buy drinking water at so-called refill stations because the water does not meet drinking water standards.
I found out about Nazava by chance in November 2013, not long after that the 4th of December 2013, I submitted a request to become a Nazava reseller. Why did I directly apply to become a reseller? Why not try out the product first?  to find out if it really works?
It is the excellence of the product and the foundation on which Nazava is based, namely, for the benefit of humanity all over the world, that made me take the decision to become a reseller directly. Hopefully, later on, Nazava water filters will be present in each and every house in my area
Also without Nazava I have enough to do in my live, 24 hours in a day feels inadequate. But that is just for me. Should I close the door when there is an opportunity that can positively affect many lives if I take it? There is a series of words that I am aware of from the Prophet Muhammad: The best of men are the most useful to others
Therefore, God willing, together with I Nazava I can do more for the benefit of the people, amen. “
With this loan Rudianto, can buy up to 200 filters which help hem provide safe drinking water to around 1000 people.

loans.use: to buy up to 200 filters which help him provide safe drinking water and benefit the people of Riau, Sumatra

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en:
Mr. Wahyu lives in Yogyakarta, in the heart of Java, the most populous Island of Indonesia. Yogyakarta is often plagued by falling ash from volcanoes. As everywhere in Indonesia, getting drinking water is also difficult in Yogyakarta and its surrounding villages. 
Nazava water filters enable people to filter their rain, well and tap water so it becomes safe to drink, without the need of boiling it. In this way, people can live healthier lives while saving much money on buying or boiling water.
Wahyu owns a business that sells machines and he started selling Nazava Water Filters a year ago.  “I tried to use a Nazava filter myself first. The potential for this business is very high. It is my ambition to be able to dominate the market in Yogyakarta,” Wahyu explains.   
Wahyu’s future promotion actions will include promoting the filter in markets and malls 
Wahyu would like Nazava to be more active in helping out resellers by organizing meetings between resellers of Nazava in Indonesia so they can share marketing tips. Nazava should be the center to be as a facilitator of development-reseller reseller
With this loan Wahyu can buy up to 200 filters which help hem provide safe drinking water to around 1000 people.

loans.use: buy up to 200 filters which help hem provide safe drinking water to around 1000 people.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced. She has two grown sons. Tatyana has her own business. She sells men's clothing at the central market in Pavlograd city. Her kiosk is in a good location at the market and many potential customers come her way. Tatyana enjoys selling clothing and would like to develop her business further. 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to help her increase the assortment of spring and summer clothing - light jackets, sportswear, shirts, etc. The larger assortment, the more customers, and increased profit as a result.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of spring and summer inventories.

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Alimaa, 48 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a curriculum developer at a high school since 2006. She and her husband have built a two-floor house and rented the first floor to an internet cafe owner. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,375 USD to buy fiberglass, foam and hardwood flooring to renovate the second floor. Then she can rent her house's second floor to some business. She is very concerned about the house because a poor quality house will ruin the renter's business and damage her trustworthiness.

loans.use: to renovate the second floor of her house.

loans.name: Altanbat

texts.en:
Mr. Altanbat, 35 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been running an automobile repair shop since 2012. Also, he and his wife grow vegetables on their land. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,125 USD to buy a tractor for tillage so that he can grow vegetables and have a large harvest in the autumn. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a tractor for tillage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more education equipment and pay the tuition fee at school.

loans.name: Nancy Ayrus

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como La 12 De Marzo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso # 1. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  17 y 20 años que  estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Nancy es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ganar algo por su cuenta, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende granos, detergentes, embutidos, legumbres, carnes entre otras cosas de primera necesidad y otros productos básicos en el hogar, este negocio lo comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo  hace 2 años y cada vez lo ha ido mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido, ella está muy contenta con su negocio ya que así se gana algo por bien de sus hijos y su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 2 años y le gusta porque con la ayuda de los créditos comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the sector known as The 12th of March in the city of Portoviejo the members of the Credit Group "El Nuevo Paraiso" Number 1 meet every fifteen days. It is a  place with humble people dedicated to agriculture and commerce in general. Nancy, age 42, lives here. She is married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 17 and 20, who attend high school and college. Her husband is a driver. 



Nancy is a woman who likes to work in order to earn money for her bank account. She has a food store in her home where she sells grains, detergents, cold cuts, beans, and meats, among other necessities and basic household supplies. She started this business with the first loan she received from the group 2 years ago and it continues to improve with the help of of the loans she has received. She is very happy with her business since it is how she earns something for the well-being of her children and her family.  

   
Nancy will use this loan to stock her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other basic necessities. She has been in the Credit Group for 2 years and she likes it because she started her business with the help of the loans. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that he used to pay for spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of a tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit, and also to buy some equipment in a repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Redentor hopes to buy another vehicle and dreams that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.* 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of a tricycle unit.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Rosita, tiene 41 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 16 años, que cursa su quinto año de secundaria. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y guiriseria. Desde hace más de 5 años habita en una casita de madera y tambo. Con el sueño de mejorar su vivienda y vivir de manera segura, solicita su primer préstamo para comprar materiales para cambiar la madera de su casa: Láminas de zinc, clavos, madera cepillada y rustica y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: She is a friendly woman, originally from Rosita, 41 years old, married and has a 16-year-old son, who is in the 5th year of secondary school.  Her husband works in farming and artisanal mining.  For the past 5 years, she has lived in a wooden house on stilts.  With the dream of improving her home and living more securely, she asks for her first loan to buy materials to change the wood of her house: zinc sheets, nails, planed and rough wood, and to cover the labor costs.  Her dream is to have a home made of concrete.

loans.use: to buy material to change the wood of her house

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She sells women's denim clothing, including denim pants, skirts, shirts, coats and jackets, at a local market. Irina has ample retail experience and sells high-quality merchandise in popular styles. She has regular customers and always sells at reasonable prices. 

Recently, Irina was able to rent a second kiosk. She needs 25,000 hryvnia in order to increase her denim stock for sale at the second kiosk. 

Irina hopes to receive additional income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to sell at the second kiosk.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela helps her husband in running a 'buy and sell' business to earn a living. She buys assorted lumber and sells it in volume and at retail in town. She has earned better income from this and was able to sustain the business. With her income, her previous loan used for the business was successful. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy more coco lumber to resell. A portion will be used to repair her motorcycle used in the business. She is hopeful to gain more revenue from the business and be able to provide the educational costs for her two children.

loans.use: to buy more coco lumber to resell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita and her husband operate their own coconut farm to earn a living. She has grown and harvested coconuts for more than twelve years and she earns a decent profit. She makes additional income from pig raising. Her previous loan, which she used for her piggery business, was successfully repaid and it gains more income. She plans to improve the farm, so she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional profits to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rosario Noemi

texts.es:
EL Grupo de crédito Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, 5 mayores de edad y el menor de 11 años que estudia en colegio, con ella viven tres hijos uno de ellos con capacidades  especiales. Su esposo es carpintero.
Doña Rosario tiene  un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende gaseosas, aguas, jugos, energizantes y varios víveres de primera necesidad, este negocio lo implemento con el primer crédito que recibió y cada vez trata de surtir mas su tienda de víveres,  los días que más vende son los fines de semana ya que ella vive al frente de unas canchas de football y de vóley y en estos días hay muchas personas en este lugar. Gracias a este negocio ella se gana algo por su cuenta que le sirven para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar gaseosas, aguas, jugos y víveres para seguir surtiendo su tienda. Lleva 9 años en el Grupo de crédito y le gusta porque así cada vez mejora su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The credit group Eloy Alfaro meets every fortnight in Cantón Montecristi, a place known for its rich culture, internationally recognized pre-colonial craftsmanship, and famous Panama hats.

Mrs. Rosario is 55 years old, married, and has six children - five of whom are adults, and one who is 11 years old and studies in school. She lives in Cantón Montecristi with her husband, who is a carpenter, and three of her children, one of whom has a mental disability. 

Doña Rosario has a small business in her home where she sells sodas, water, juice, energy drinks, and various food staples. She implemented this business with the first loan she received and she tries to stock her grocery store with supplies. The days she sells the most are on weekends, as she lives in front of some football and volleyball fields and there are many people in this place. Thanks to this business, she earns something on her own that helps her get ahead.

This loan is going to be used to buy soft drinks, water, juice, and food to continue stocking her store. She has been in the credit group for 9 years and she likes it because it helps improve her business. Her dream is to have a well stocked store.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, juice, and food.

loans.name: Juliana Maricela

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como La 12 De Marzo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso # 1. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Juliana, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  8 y 6 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor y también trabaja en una camaronera.
Doña Juliana con la finalidad de ayudarle a su esposo a llevar la dura carga de mantener el hogar realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice para su trabajo, su esposo en la época invernal siembra maíz y maní,  necesita del crédito para poder pagar la mano de obra de sus cultivos.  Ella por su parte se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene un corral en su casa en el cual cría una buena cantidad de pollos los mismos que al venderlos le permiten obtener buenas ganancias hasta que los cultivos empiecen a rendir sus frutos.
Este crédito es para pagar mano de obra para las siembras y para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan  los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeñas.
En la foto está la socia con sus hijas.
texts.en:
In the sector known as The 12th of March in the city of Portoviejo the members of the Credit Group "El Nuevo Paraiso" Number 1 meet every 15 days. It is a place with humble people dedicated to agriculture and commerce in general. This is where Juliana lives. She is 31 years old, married, and from this relationship has two daughters, ages 8 and 6, who attend school. Her husband is a farmer and works on a shrimp farm as well. 


Juliana, with the goal of helping her husband carry the heavy burden of maintaining the household, requests this loan so that her husband can use it for his work. In the winter he plants corn and peanuts and needs the loan to be able to pay the farmhands for the planting. For her part, Juliana works raising chickens. She has a pen at her home where she raises a good amount of chickens, which she sells in order to earn enough money until the crops begin to yield their fruits. 


This loan is to pay for farmhands to do the planting, and to buy feed and medicine for the chickens. Juliana has done 4 cycles with the Credit Group and she likes it for the help the loans give her. Her dream is to give the best to her little ones. In the photo is the member with her daughters.

loans.use: to pay the farmhands and to buy feed and medicine for chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema  es una joven de 20 años, la cual vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, desde hace 2 años tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, negocio que le permite poder tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, por ello se esfuerza mucho cada día para poder mejorar su negocio.

Zulema esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para poder mejorar sus ventas y poder atender los pedidos de sus clientes, de esta manera seguirá trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandi is a young woman of 20 who lives in the city of Aguaytia. She has had her little business of selling groceries for 2 years. The business allows her to have income to be able to get ahead; for this reason she exerts herself greatly every day to improve her business.

Sandi is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have offered her, she will be able to buy merchandise to improve her sales and satisfy the requests of her customers.
