In this way she will continue working and striving to be able to make a reality of her great dream: to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her business. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income is assisting with their everyday household expenditures. She and her partner are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has an apartment for additional income.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 15,000 PHP, to buy duck eggs, baskets, and crackers. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rochelle dreams to know more about business so she can think of more ideas on how to expand her business. She attends weekly fellowship meetings* that inspire her to go on with life no matter what the obstacles because she has a big God who will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for duck eggs, baskets, and crackers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of different toys and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of different toys and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members, where she can share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of different toys and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 40 years old, married and has seven children, four of whom are currently in school.

Liliosa and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan of PHP 6,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Liliosa has been a NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Liliosa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 24-year-old married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Liza's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost. 

She is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Liza has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been with NWTF since 2010. She is now requesting a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Lydia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 33 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Joan has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 60 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Luciana has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Luciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 56 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school. 

Noemi raises pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

Noemi has been raising pigs for four years, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to support her business.

In the future, Noemi would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 48 year-old Abu. He is married and has three children who are 17, 15 and 4 years old, one of whom is a school-going child. In 1996, Abu established his cement, paints and zinc business. He began his business because he wanted to help take good care of his family wellbeing. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

Abu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Abu requires a loan in order to buy more cement, paints, zinc, head pans and shovels. In the future, Abu plans to improve his business and his family status. Competition and rainy season are his challenges. He is working forward to funding, as he requires more capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cement, paints, zinc, head pans and shovels.

loans.name: Donnys

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Donnys, quien con su anterior credikiva compró materias primas como maíz plátano, leche, arroz, azúcar y dos juegos de mesas, con sus respectivas sillas.  Sus ventas se incrementaron y también sus inventarios, con los que le cumplió a su clientela. Donny en su agradecimiento, pide a los financiadores de Kiva que sigan apoyando a los empresarios del futuro.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará materias primas, y acondicionará dos carretas, para tener una mejor imagen comercial e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Donnys, who with his previous Kiva loan bought basic ingredients such as corn, plantains, milk, rice, sugar, and two sets of tables and their respective chairs. His sales increased, as well as his inventories, with which he satisfied his customers. Donnys, in his gratitude, asks the Kiva investors to continue supporting the entrepreneurs of the future. He is now applying for a new loan through which he will buy basic ingredients and renovate two carts, in order to have a better commercial image and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients and renovate two carts

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer luchadora de 31 años, vive con su hija de 8 años y desde que se separo del hombre que era su marido ha tenido que llevar con todas las responsabilidades del hogar.
Ella nunca se ha rendido y ha hecho hasta lo imposible para sacar a su hija adelante sin importar las adversidades.
Ella inicio con un taller de confección a terceros desde hace 21 meses y ha cosechado muy buenos frutos de su esfuerzo y dedicación.
Actualmente genera dos empleos pero su meta es generar otros tres puestos de trabajo.
Ella guarda la esperanza de poder comprar una maquina fileteadora, pues desea aumentar la capacidad de producción y afrontar su desafío más grande en estos momentos y son las fallas de las negociaciones extranjeras que han estado deteriorando los precios nacionales de producción.
Su mayor sueño es tener un taller versátil capaz de enfrentar estas dificultades y mantenerse a flote.
texts.en:
Angela is a hard-working woman of 31. She lives with her 8-year-old son, and since she separated from the man who was her husband, she has had to take on all the responsibilities of the household.

She has never given up and has done everything possible to raise her son, no matter what the adversities.

Twenty-one months ago she established a third-party sewing workshop, and she has harvested very good fruits from her effort and dedication.

Now she provides two jobs, but her goal is to generate another three employment positions.

She keeps the hope of being able to buy an overlock sewing machine, since she wants to increase her production capacity and take on her greatest challenge at this time, which is the faults of the foreign business that have been undermining the domestic production prices.

Her greatest dream is to have a versatile workshop capable of facing these difficulties and staying afloat.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Hernán Darío

texts.es: Hernán ha sido un hombre que de verdad sabe cómo salir de adversidades pues le ha tocado enfrentarse a diferentes adversidades como enfermedades como paludismo y otras que lo mantuvieron alejado del comercio un buen tiempo y que las supero volviendo a su actividades económicas ya que es un hombre que le estorba la cama que no se puede quedar quieto que tiene que sentirse productivo, generar sus propios recursos. Sus actividades y actitudes como comerciantes las aprendió gracias a su padre y diferentes trabajos que tubo antes de 1997 cuando decidió que era hora de crear su propio negocio y es así como monto su propia microempresa donde vende legumbres y frutas en su hogar pero también sale en un carretilla todos los días a ofrecer sus frescos productos a toda la comunidad llevándolos a la casa de los clientes. Por ellos solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en frutas y verduras como mangos, naranjas, moras, aguacates, tomates, cebollas, papas, limones entre otros para tener una mayor cantidad de productos lo que le generaría mayor ventas pues llegara a muchos más clientes. Su gran sueño es hacer crecer su negocio volverse el distribuidor principal de su barrio.
texts.en:
Hernán has been a man that truly knows how to overcome adversity as he has been confronted with different adversities such as illnesses like malaria and others that kept him away from his business for a good while, which he overcame, returning to his economic activities. Since he is a man that is bothered by laying in bed. He cannot stay there quietly, he needs to feel productive, generating his own resources.

 He learned his activities and attitudes such as trades thanks to his father and different jobs that he had before 1997, when he decided that it was time to create his own business. This is how he built his own microbusiness where he sells fruits and vegetables in his home, but he also goes out to the highway every day to offer his fresh produce to the entire community, bringing them to the customers' homes. 

This is why he is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies in fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, oranges, blackberries, avocados, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and lemons among others in order to have a greater quantity of produce. This will generate better sales as he will bring them to many customers. His great dream is to make his business grow, becoming the main distributor of his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, oranges, blackberries, avocados, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and lemons

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un trabajador hombre que toda su vida se ha dedicado a las labores del campo, actividad que aprendió desde muy pequeño trabajando al lado de sus padres.
El empieza sus labores de siembra y cosecha de alimentos desde muy temprano y termina en las horas de la tarde todos los días, con esta actividad se sostiene y consigue sus propios ingresos.
El solicita ayuda para comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, abonos y riegos; elementos que le permitirán seguir ejerciendo su actividad y seguir teniendo rentabilidad.
Su meta es lograr tener un gran campo con distintos tipos de cultivos que le brinden estabilidad económica y poder ofrecer más empleos.
texts.en: Gustavo is a hard-working man who has been a farmer all his life. He learned the trade from his parents at a very young age. He starts work very early in the morning, sowing and reaping until mid-afternoon. Farming is his only source of income and allows him to be independent. He asks for a loan to buy farming supplies such as seeds, manure, and irrigation. Having these will enable him to keep his farm going and profitable. His goal is to own a large field with many types of crops in order to have financial stability and create more jobs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian nació en Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque en el norte del Perú y viajo a Lima para poder estudiar y salir adelante. El es el menor de tres hermanos y vive solo en la capital en un cuarto alquilado ya que su familia vive en Cajamarca(sierra del Perú). Sus padres son docentes en un colegio del estado y apenas recibe apoyo por parte de su madre ya que su padre no lo ayuda económicamente. Christian trabaja en sus horas libres en la madrugada y los fines de semana como ayudante, pero apenas le alcanza para solventar su manutención por lo que le seria imposible seguir estudiando sin el apoyo económico de los prestamistas de Kiva, teniendo que sacrificar su carrera por trabajar a tiempo completo.
El no contar con el apoyo de sus padres y las carencias económicas no han desanimado a Christian en lograr su sueño de ser profesional, por lo que esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo que le brindan de alcanzar su meta y salir adelante, y así como a el a todos los jóvenes con sueños similares de educación y progreso.
texts.en:
Christian was born in Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque department in northern Peru.  He traveled to Lima in order to be able to study and to get ahead.  He is the youngest of three siblings.  He lives alone in the capital in a rented room because his family lives in Cajamarca (Peruvian highlands).  His parents are teachers at a state school.  He just barely gets support from his mother because his father does not help him financially.

Christian works in his free times, in the early morning and the week-ends, as a helper.  However, it barely covers his living expenses.  Therefore, it would be impossible for him to continue studying without the financial help of the Kiva lenders.  He would have to sacrifice his career in order to work full time.

He does not have the support of his parents, but his financial needs have not discouraged Christian from achieving his dream of being a professional.  Therefore, he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they provide to reach his goal and to get ahead.  He is grateful that Kiva helps young people, like him, with similar dreams of education and progress.

loans.use: to pay for his production mechanic education.

loans.name: Sokvy

texts.en:
Sokvy is 38 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She has five children to take care of, three of whom are still in school. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income, and to make a living she has been in this business for five years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 29,000KHR per day and save about 10,000KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the third micro-loan for Sokvy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a higher income, to make a better living and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow them reduce household spending and enjoy better lighting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking utensils for her business.

loans.name: Adalberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Luis ha sido un hombre emprendedor y trabajador toda su vida y se gana la vida con la compra y venta de plátanos al por mayor.
Este oficio lo aprendió empíricamente y lleva con él hace algún tiempo. El trabaja todos los días desde las 7:00 am hasta las horas de la noche.
El solicita dinero para comprar mayor cantidad de plátanos y de esta forma tener un inventario más amplio de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Esto le permitirá expandir su negocio y seguir ejerciendo la actividad con la que ha sostenido a sus tres hijos y esposa todo este tiempo.
Un anhelo que manifiesta es poder mantener su trabajo activo por mucho tiempo y aunque genera empleo a dos personas ocasionalmente, desea tener más empleados y hacer más productivo su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis has been an enterprising and hardworking man his whole life. He earns his living buying and selling bananas wholesale. He learned on the job and works whenever he has the time from 7 am into the evening hours.

The money Luis is seeking is to buy a larger number of bananas so he has more inventory to offer his customers. It will allow him to expand his business and continue his work. With the income he has supported his wife and three children all this time.

Luis would really like to continue active work for a long time. Although he provides occasional work for two people, he wants to have more employees and make his business more productive.

loans.use: Buy more bananas and expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire quality bean seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel nació en Lima,vive en el populoso distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su padre que es retirado de la policía, su madre, ama de casa y sus 2 hermanos. La remuneración que percibe su padre como jubilado no es suficiente para seguir costeando su carrera técnica en Electrónica Industrial y Miguel tendría que dejar sus estudios para comenzar a trabajar por lo que no podría continuar los mismos sin el apoyo económico de los prestamistas de Kiva. La familia a realizado actividades vendiendo comida para juntar fondos mes a mes para pagar los estudios, sin embargo el apoyo que reciben es cada vez menor y ya no reúnen lo suficiente.
Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y trabajar en una empresa que le permita crecer profesional y personalmente a la vez que apoya a sus padres que tanto han sacrificado por que el salga adelante.
Miguel agradece el apoyo que le brindan para poder realizar no solo su sueño de estudiar y ser profesional, sino también el impacto positivo que esto representa en su familia al salir adelante juntos.
texts.en:
Miguel was born in Lima.  He lives in the populous district of San Juan de Lurigancho with his father, a retired policeman; his mother, a housewife; and his two siblings.  The retirement payments that his father gets are not enough to continue paying for his technical degree in industrial electronics.  

Miguel would have to leave his studies in order to start working.  He would not be able to continue with his education without financial help from the Kiva lenders.  The family has engaged in business activities by selling food in order to get together funds, month to month, to pay for his studies.  Nevertheless, support from that is diminishing, and they now do not get enough.

His dream is to finish his studies and to work for a company that will allow him to grow professionally and personally.  At the same time, he wants to support his parents, who have sacrificed so much so that he can get ahead.

Miguel is grateful for the support being provided so that he is able to not only fulfill his dream of studying and becoming a professional, but also for the positive impact that this represents for his family to get ahead together.

loans.use: to pay for his industrial electronics studies.

loans.name: Awen Indah Group

texts.en:
After six months maintaining the pigs, the Awen Indah group paid off the loan to MUK. Recently was the right time to sell the pigs, because during one week was a big holiday for Hindusm and the price for pig was very expensive. They all sold the pigs together to a big buyer and earned a satisfactory profit. Ni Komang sold her pigs and all the profit will be used to purchase more piglets. She wants to increase the population of her piggery. Ni Komang has a plan to increase the quality of her pigs by giving them nutritious feed and vitamins, thereby she hopes she can earn more profit.

With this loan, the Awen Indah group continue its borrowing. In addition to developing the business by buying piglets, it will also be used to buy feed and fix cages. From the previous loan, they can save for venture capital. The new loan is used to develop the business. All members of the group feel very grateful for these loans because they can develop business and generate revenues to improve the welfare of their families.

Ni Komang will use her loan to buy two superior quality piglets and feed. She plans to keep pigs for fattening. She’s also purchased a sow with her own money. Ni Komang thanks to MUK, Kiva and lenders because of the support provided to develop the business and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy two superior quality piglets and feed

loans.name: Yune Mariuxi

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Alfa Y Omega. Lugar de gente humilde  dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Yune, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos de 21, 19, 17 y 1  años, dos de  los menores estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo trabaja en un almacén de motos.
Doña Yune es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con su esfuerzo ganar sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia, ella tiene una pequeña tienda que le da buenos beneficios, allí también vende productos de Avon y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días, ella deja a crédito los productos de catalogo y cobra semanalmente, lleva 7 años dedicada al comercio y un año a su tienda la cual la surtió con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería y víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque cada día mejora su vida. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Estancia Vieja in the parish of Colon and the city of Portoviejo there is a communal banking group called Alfa and Omega that meets every two weeks.  Portoviejo is a city known for its humble people and its agricultural and commercial activity.  

Yune lives in this town.  She is 39 years old, is married, and has four children ages 21, 19, 17, and 1.  Two of the younger children study at the University and in high school.  Her husband works in a motorcycle shop.

Yune is a woman who likes to take care of herself and with her own efforts earn her own income for the good of the family.  She has a small store that gives her good benefits.  She also sells Avon and Belcorp products (beauty and cosmetic products as well as accessories and perfumes for women).  She works every day.  She sells on credit the products from the catalog and charges people weekly.  She has been working in this area for 7 years and with her own store for one year.  She supplied her store with a previous credit that she received from the communal banking group.

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, costume jewelry and food items to supply her store.  She has been with her communal bank for two years and she likes it because every day she improves her life.  Her dream is for her children to finish their studies and to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy perfume, costume jewelry and food items.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 46 years old and married with two children in school. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a retail business selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient and clean cooking energy package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feeds for her local chicken and re-stock more 60 chickens and construct a permanent shelter for her chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new cooking utensils, stock (food items) for cooking to customers  and expand his cooking space

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como 4 esquinas en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura o al comercio en general. Ellos decidieron unirse para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la institución y con los créditos mejorar  sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Letania, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y hijos. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Letania es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante por sus propios medios y  con sus ganancias  salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de catalogo de varias marcas como Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), bisutería  de Brilho y otras. Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los creditos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y cumplir con todos sus proyectos.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Four Corners in the Colón Parish of the city of Portoviejo the members of the Credit Group "Nueva Esperanza" ("New Hope") meet every 15 days. They are the same people who work in diverse activities like agriculture, or commerce in general. They decided to join together to be able to gain access to the benefits that the institution offers, and to improve their businesses with loans.


One of the members of this group is Letania. She is 39 years old and married, with children. Her husband is a merchant. Letania is very hardworking woman who always liked getting ahead by her own means and with her earnings, in order to move forward, she works selling catalog products from various brands like Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories) and costume jewelry from Brilho and others. She works three days a week for at least two or three hours a day. She leaves her products on credit and collects the money every eight days. She has more than 7 years experience in this activity and it is going very well. What she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics. 


This credit is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and costume jewelry. This is the first cycle in the Credit Group and Letania likes it because the loans are easy to do. Her dreams are to continue succeeding and to finish all her projects. The small photo is of a member who could not be there when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Alfa Y Omega. Lugar de gente humilde  dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos  hijos de 8 y 7  años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Mayra y su esposo tienen  una tienda de víveres en Santa Ana lugar en el cual arriendan un local desde hace ya 6 meses, venden todo tipo de víveres y también son distribuidores de leche de una marca muy reconocida a nivel nacional, este negocio ya lo tienen por muchos años atrás y es con el cual iniciaron su actividad comercial, distribuyen la leche en tiendas y locales ya sea en esta ciudad o en lugares cercanos, mientras su esposo sale a entregar la leche a las tiendas ella se encarga del local
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres y leche que es lo que más ganancias le deja. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the "Alfa y Omega" credit group meet in the area known as Estancia Vieja in the city of Portoviejo and the parish of Colón. This area is home to a humble group of people who generally make a living in agriculture and trade. Here Mayra lives, a 31 year old woman who is married. She has two children with her husband who are 8 and 7 years old and go to school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Mayra and her husband have a basic goods store in Santa Ana, where they started renting a space six months ago. They sell all types of basic rations and also distribute a brand of milk that is recognized at the national level. They have already had this business for many years, and it is with this that they started their retail activities. They distribute milk at stores and other locales within the city and other nearby areas. While her husband goes out to deliver the milk, Mayra runs the store. 

This loan will be used to stock up her store. She will buy basic rations and milk, goods that leave them with greater earnings. She has been in this credit group for three loan cycles and she lives it because the loans are a help to her. Her dream are to have her own business space and give her children the best she can.

loans.use: to buy rations and milk.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 25 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maricris's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Maricris is requesting out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Maricris has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, She will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Maricris would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Teresita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy clothes, needles, thread and spare parts for the maintenance of her sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, needles, thread and spare parts for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Sombang Lestari Group's new loan is for the same amount as their last loan and for the same members of the group. They need a new loan for their businesses because they have a strong will to become successful pig breeders. The loan will be used to improve their business by purchasing superior piglets or a sow. The group can pay off the whole loan on time, and they can sell the pigs for a good price. The price for pork is about 25,000 IDR per kilogram. 

Ni Kadek, the head of the group, maintained three pigs and they all sold. She gained a profit of 750,000 IDR after deducting the cost. She is really grateful for that. Now she can use the profit to renovate her house a little bit and support her children's education. During the last loan period, she did not have any problems. All of the pigs grew well. She thanks the lenders, Kiva and MUK, for supporting her business.

Ni Kadek will use her new loan to buy three superior piglets for 300,000 IDR a piece. She has a plan to maintain them for fattening. She hopes MUK and Kiva will always support her and the group, not only with the loan but for training. Ni Kadek sits in the front row, second from the right.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets to raise.

loans.name: Gloria Mariela

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como La 12 De Marzo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso # 1. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  20 y 3  años, el menor este año empieza a estudiar en un jardín de infantes. Su esposo es mecánico. 
Ella aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una academia de la localidad hace varios años y tiene el titulo de artesana. Doña Gloria para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que genera mantener el hogar  desde hace dos  años instaló en el centro de la ciudad un salón de belleza en local que arrienda, ella realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Con la ayuda del primer crédito compro lo necesario para comenzar con su negocio y con la ayuda de todos los créditos  lo mejora por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y otros productos de belleza que ella utiliza en sus trabajos. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son tener su local propio.
texts.en:
In the area known as La 12 de Marzo in the city of Protoviejo, the members of the credit group El Nuevo Paraíso #1 meet every two weeks. This is a place of unassuming people who work in agriculture and general businesses. Gloria lives here.  She is 35 years old, married and has 2 children from this marriage who are 20 and 3 years old; the younger begins attending a preschool this year.  Her husband is a mechanic.

Ella studied personal beauty and grooming at a local school a number of years ago and has a certificate in Beauty Artistry. In order to make her own money and to help her husband with the costs associated with maintaining the home, Gloria opened a beauty salon in the center of the city in a space she rents. She has done a wide range range of work such as coloring, haircuts, fingernail polishing, among other things. She works every day from 8:00-20:00 and sometimes later if her customers need her services. With the help of her first loan, she bought the necessary materials to start her business and with the help of all the loans, she improves it for the benefit of her family.

She will use this loan to buy dyes, permanents, and other beauty products that she uses in her work.  She has been a member of the credit group for 2 years and she likes it for the help and the benefits she gets at the bank.  Her dream is to have her own space.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents and other beauty products

loans.name: Mateito  (Junín) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mateito se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, que se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y del Ecuador.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo de Crédito que les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Susana, tiene 40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos de 23, 14 y 4 años, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil. 
Doña Susana para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a elaborar y vender bisuterías, ella elabora collares, pulseras, anillos y aretes a personas que le piden. Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres para lo cual está adecuando una parte de su casa,  así ella espera obtener mejores ingresos sin dejar de elaborar y vender sus bisuterías, ya que esto le daría tiempo para ambos negocios.
Este crédito es para comprar materiales para elabora sus bisuterías y víveres para surtir su tienda. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. Sus sueños es tener su tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The credit group Mateito meets every fifteen days in the Junín canton, known for its friendly, hardworking people and because this area distills the best brandy within the province and in all of Ecuador.

This is a group of people who decided to unite and form this credit group. which has helped them greatly to improve their small businesses. They engage in various activities such as trade, services, selling meals and other activities.

One of the members of this group is Susana, who is 40 years old, who with her  partner has three sons, aged 23, 14 and 4 . The younger two study in school. Her husband is a mason. 

To earn her own income and thereby help her partner with the home and children’s school expenses, Susana crafts and sells jewelry. She makes necklaces, bracelets, rings and earrings for people who order them. 

Her dream is to have a grocery store, for which she is rebuilding part of her house. She expects better revenue without having to give up jewelry sales, and thereby have time to devote to both businesses.

This loan is to buy materials to craft the jewelry and for food items to stock her grocery store. She has been in the credit group for four loan cycles with the group’s loan. She is the president of the credit group and likes the group a because it is very close-knit. Her dream is to have shop well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and materials to craft jewelry.

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Alfa Y Omega. Lugar de gente humilde dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora  Olga, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 4  años que  estudian en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Olga con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, y Belcorp  (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), ropa y sabanas, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos ya que su pequeña esta en el jardín de infantes, ella deja a créditos  y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, ropa y sabanas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The members of the "Alfa y Omega" credit group meet every two weeks in the area of Estancia Vieja located in the city of Portoviejo and the parish of Colón. This area is known for its humble people who make a living generally in agriculture and commerce. 

A woman named Olga lives here, a 39-year-old married woman with a four-year-old daughter in nursery school. Her husband is a merchant. 

With the goal of having her own income and being able to help her husband with the expenses, she makes a living selling products through Avon and Belcorp catalogs (beauty products, make-up, perfume and women's accesories), clothing and bedsheets. She works every day usually in the morning, as it is easiest for her to make her rounds while her daughter is in nursery school. Olga sells on credit and collects payments each week. She loves to work in sales and she has been doing it for three years. It has gone very well for her now that she a large amount of customers. 

This loan will be used to buy perfume, accesories, make-up, clothing and bedsheets. She has been in this credit group for two years and enjoys it because the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is to give her daughter the best that she can.

loans.use: to buy perfume, accesories, cosmetics, clothing and bedsheets.

loans.name: Gema Monserrate

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Alfa Y Omega. Lugar de gente humilde dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señorita Gema, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Ella ya termino sus estudios universitarios.
Doña Gema es una joven que a pesar de su profesión no ha logrado conseguir un trabajo acorde a su profesión decidió instalar un pequeño negocio en la casa de sus padres, allí ella con la ayuda de su mamá tienen  un soda bar donde venden todo tipo de comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, papas fritas, hot dog, sanduches, tostadas, jugos y batidos de frutas, trabajan todos los días en las tardes y noches, ya son tres años que tiene su negocio.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood known as Estancia Vieja, in the parish of Colon, in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank group “Alfa y Omega” meet every fifteen days. The people in this place are of humble economic circumstances and work in agriculture and general commerce.

Gema lives here. She is 25 years old, single, and lives in her parents' house. She has finished her university studies.

Gema is a young person who, despite her training, has not obtained a job in her profession. She decided to open a small business in her parents’ house. There, with her mother’s help, they have a soda bar where they sell all kinds of fast food, such as hamburgers, French fries, hot dogs, sandwiches, toasted corn nuts, fruit juices and smoothies. They work every day in the afternoon and evenings. She has had her business for three years.

She will use this loan to buy supplies that are necessary for making the foods. She has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because they provide her with the loans. Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her snack bar.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos es casado y tiene 3 hijos. La familia vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propia Santos es albañil y necesita credito para comprar material de construccion como ladrillo y cemento  para construir un deposito en su casa para guardar materiales. Santos es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Santos is married and has 3 children.  He owns a well-built house in El Alto where he and his family live.  Santos is a construction worker and is applying for a loan that he will use to buy construction materials: bricks and cement.  Santos's earnings are the family's only income and that's why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks and cement).

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en: Vitaliy moved to a small town recently. About a year ago he purchased a small store and began selling various construction supplies. Vitaliy sells goods at affordable prices and thus has many repeat customers. Vitaliy would like to increase the variety of his inventory. He hopes to receive more income and invest most of it back into the business.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of construction supplies.

loans.name: Rahiema

texts.en:
Rahiema is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. The income from her business helps cover their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this growth with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rahiema dreams to have another store and more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and studying the Word of God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia es soltera pero tiene un hijo. Ella vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Virginia se dedica al comercio y necesita un préstamo para comprar enaguas, sombreros y otros artículos que ella vende Virginia no tiene a quien acudir por eso necesita de su ayuda.
texts.en: Virginia is single but she has a son. She lives in El Alto, in a brick and cement house that she owns herself. Virginia works in commerce and needs a loan to buy underskirts, hats and other articles. Virginia has no one to turn to, so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy underskirts, hats and other items for her business

loans.name: Clara Floricelia

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Alfa Y Omega. Lugar de gente humilde dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Clara, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos  hijos de 22 y 10  años, ambos viven en su casa y la menor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Clara  es una muy buena esposa que al ver que su marido no gana lo suficiente en sus faenas en el campo decidió poner su propio negocio, ella tiene a cargo el bar de una escuela de la localidad, allí vende bocadillos y comidas que ella mismo prepara como empanadillas, sanduches, corviches, entre otros. A veces hace almuerzos y meriendas pero solo bajo pedido, ella también vende productos de catalogo de Azzorti (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas),  los mismos que vende puerta a puerta.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres para la preparación de los alimentos y cosméticos Azzorti. Lleva 10  ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood known as Estancia Vieja, in the parish of Colon, in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank group “Alfa y Omega” meets every fifteen days. The people in this place are of humble economic circumstances and work in agriculture and general commerce.

Clara lives in this place. She is 49 years old. She is married and has two children from this relationship. They are 22 and 10 years old. Both live at home and the youngest is studying in school. Her husband is a farmer.

Clara is a very good wife who, seeing that her husband didn’t earn enough in his work in the fields, decided to start her own business. She has a snack bar in a school in the town. She sells snacks and foods that she prepares herself, such as empanadas, sandwiches, and corviches [balls of grated plantain with a filling inside], among other things. Sometimes she makes lunches and light fare, but only by previous request. She also sells items from the Azzorti catalog (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women), which she sells door to door.

She will use this loan to buy supplies for preparing the foods and also Azzorti cosmetics. She has been in the loan group for 10 cycles and is very happy because they have helped her a lot. Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food supplies and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store and been in NWTF since 2013. She is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so that she can build a house for her family.

With your help Ma. Lyn will be able to rebuild her life.

In the future, Ma. Lyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 66 years old and married with ten children, six of whom are in school. Esperanza works very hard to provide for them.

Esperanza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, spices, etc.

Esperanza has been in this business for 18 years.

In the future Esperanza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, spices, etc..

loans.name: Ariuntuya

texts.en: Mrs. Ariuntuya, who is 39 years old, lives with her husband and young daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. In 2007, she opened a driving school while her husband runs a pub for a living. Their older daughter studies in Taiwan while their younger daughter goes to a local high school in Mongolia. She is requesting a loan for $2,200 to open new branch of her driving school. By doing this, she can generate more income for her family while one of her children remains in Taiwan and another will soon graduate.

loans.use: to open a new branch of her driving school.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her; she was able to buy more of the products she needed in her tailoring business. Her income from her business is assisting her with paying her family's everyday household expenditures. She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more fabric, thread and other materials for her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Erlinda dreams that her business will become stable and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fabric, thread and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Hania

texts.en:
Hania previously received a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to sell in her general store. The additional earnings this loan helped her bring in were a big help in paying for her children’s education, and in meeting her personal, household and business expenditures. She is requesting a new loan, for 21,000 PHP, to buy new items to sell because the more items on display in the store, the better it does. Hania dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from their fellowship and her religion.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 people who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: 03 Văn Bắc Group

texts.en: Chăm earns a living by farming pigs, and is applying for a loan to buy more of them to raise. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of three children. She also leads the 03 Văn Bắc solidarity group, which has five members. In 2014, Chăm joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business, and has successfully repaid two loans from the fund. She has been in her current line of work for more than ten years, and says one of the biggest difficulties she faces is a lack of capital. In the future, she hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Dofui

texts.fr: Mariée à un douanier, Dofui pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille a démarré la vente des produits alimentaires à domicile. Pour la bonne marche de l'activité, elle fait son troisième prêt à WAGES pour acheter du riz, de la tomate, de l'huile et autres produits. Elle espère réinvestir dans l'activité. Madame Dofui est âgée de 31ans avec une ancienneté de 05ans.
texts.en: Married to a customs agent, Dofui started up selling food products from her home, in order to contribute to the needs of her family. So that her business will run well, she is doing her third loan with WAGES to buy rice, tomatoes, oil and other products. She hopes to reinvest in her business. Ms. Dofui is 31 years old with 5 years of experience.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Gladys Loreley

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  15 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es maestro.
Doña Gladys es maestra en una escuela de la localidad y también se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño bazar en el centro de la ciudad en un local que arrienda desde hace más de 8 años, vende ropa, zapatos, artículos de bazar, tarjetas, peluches, entre muchas otras cosas, cuando ella está trabajando su mamá y sus hijos le ayuda en su negocio, así ella además de tener un sueldo en el lugar donde labora tiene sus propios ingresos por su negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes y artículos de bazar. Lleva 10 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Crédito Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio Group meets every 15 days in the Montecristi region, known for its rich colonial culture and artisan products recognized at national and international levels. It is the place of the famous straw hats.

In this place lives 39 year old Gladys. She is married and has two children ages 15 and 10 who are students in school. Her husband is a teacher. Gladys is a teacher in a local school and also has a business. Her small bazaar is in the center of the city in a location she has rented for more than 8 years. She sells clothing, shoes, a variety of items such as cards, stuffed toys, and many other items. When she is working he mother and children help her with the business, in this way in addition to her salary she has her own income from her business.

This loan is to buy clothing, perfumes, and other items to sell. She has been a member of the Crédito Mujeres del Nuevo Milenio Group for 10 years and she enjoys it because of the help provided through the loans. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr:
Mr WENDINMI représente le groupe ESPOIR.  Il se porte bien. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le 05mois. 01 va à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Il vend de produits de beauté depuis 03ans. Il s’approvisionne  au grand marché. 
Mr veut s’acheter 07douzaines de parfums, 05douzaines de produits de beauté.
IL  désire épargner ses bénéfices. Il ambitionne toujours s’acquérir une moto  et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Wendimni represents the Espoir group. He is doing well. He is married and the father of three children. The oldest is 8 years old and youngest is 5 months. One goes to school and the other four are in his care. He has sold beauty products for three years. He gets his supplies at the big market. He wants to buy himself seven dozen perfumes and five dozen beauty products. He seeks to save his profits. He is constantly striving to acquire a motorcycle for himself and to better care for his family.

loans.use: to buy himself seven dozen perfumes and five dozen beauty products.

loans.name: Crisby

texts.en:
Crisby is 48 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is separated with three children now at their adult age. 

Crisby is engaged in operating a PUJ for hire for 10 years already and earns approximately PHP15,000.00 each month from doing this type of work. At present he is also engaged in banana production activity. 

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs and renovation. Crisby has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Crisby hopes to expand his banana production activity.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovation

loans.name: Verónica Regina

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como La 12 De Marzo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso # 1. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos  hijos de 15 y 8 años que  estudian en colegio  y escuela. Ella vive sola con sus hijos.
Doña Verónica es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya sea ofreciendo sus productos puerta a puerta o en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes si necesitan algún producto, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 3  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual trata de darle lo mejor a sus hijos y que estos tengan un mejor porvenir.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
In the "12 de Marzo" sector of Portoviejo city, the (all female) members of the "El Nuevo Paraíso #1" loan group meets every fortnight. Here in Portoviejo the people are humble and work in farming and business.

And it is here that Verónica lives. She is 41 years old and a single mother to two children, aged 15 and 8 years old respectively. They are both in school. Verónica lives with just her children.

Verónica is a housewife who, in order to earn money to pay household costs, works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day, selling her goods door-to-door or from her home where her customers come to visit when they need something. Verónica sells on credit, collecting payments every week. Verónica has been doing this work for over three years. With this work, Verónica is trying to give her children the best that she can, and to ensure that they have a better future.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear. This is the group's fifth loan cycle. Verónica likes the loan group as payments are easy to make. Verónica's dream is for her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to buy education equipment

loans.name: 01 Quang Trung - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Nụ is 58 years old, married and has four children. He lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Nụ is the group leader of the 01 Quang Trung - Hoằng Châu solidarity group, which consists of six members.

For the past ten years Nụ has raised poultry and cattle on his farm. A lack of capital is the challenge he faces in developing it.

This is Nụ’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. As leader of the group he is applying for a 43,500,000 VND loan to be apportioned among his group members. He will use his loan money to buy food and fodder for his poultry and cattle. Nụ hopes his business will do well and his children will find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and fodder for his poultry and cattle.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza is 41 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Rizza is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her raising livestock.

With your help, Rizza can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 40 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cologne, face powder, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, juice, etc., to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as cologne, face powder, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, juice, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like cologne, face powder, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, juice, etc., to sell

loans.name: Sherel

texts.en:
Sherel is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 34 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Sherel's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Sherel has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with three children. She is 38 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Alma has a business buying and reselling bananas in the Philippines and has been in this business for one year. 

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more bananas to sell.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 30 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Arlene has been fattening pigs for one year and also earns additional income from buying and reselling bananas.

Arlene is borrowing 11,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña is 21 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Niña's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Niña is taking out a 8,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Niña has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Niña would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 59 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Perla has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Perla is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Berlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Berlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a bakery, buying and reselling bananas, and a general store. 

Berlyn is borrowing 13,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Urbana

texts.en:
Urbana is 58 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Urbana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Urbana has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, bath soap, canned goods, cooking oil, juice, and detergent soap.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis vive en una zona rural al norte de Nicaragua, la cual además de ser distante del casco urbano es de difícil acceso. Se dedica a la producción de café, como principal actividad económica.
El es un emprendedor que considera que las adversidades son parte del proceso para mejorar y sacar adelante su pequeña empresa. Trabajar bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo, le ha ayudado a mejorar los procesos de producción y manejo de su café, y con ello a incrementar la calidad y el precio del mismo.
En los últimos años ha alcanzado hasta un 50% en el aumento de su producción; esto ha motivado a Luis a seguir mejorando su finca y producción de café. Como parte de estas mejoras, él además de estar solicitando un crédito para el mantenimiento de su café, en este caso también está solicitando financiamiento para adquirir una despulpadora y construir un beneficio de café que le permita beneficiar su café, lo cual le ayudará a disminuir la pérdida por rendimiento y mejorar la calidad de su café. Con estas mejoras, en su finca Luis confía en que podrá tener mayores ingresos en este nuevo ciclo lo cual le ayudará a seguir reinvirtiendo en su finca y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis lives in a rural area in the north of Nicaragua. Being far from any urban area, access is difficult. Luis makes a living producing coffee.

Luis is an entrepreneur who believes that adversities are just part of a process of prospering and making his little business better. Working with a Fairtrade certificate has helped Luis to improve production and management of his coffee, and this has resulted in an increase in the quality and price of his coffee.

In recent years, Luis has increased production by 50%. This has motivated him to continue improving his farm and production. As part of these improvements, Luis is applying for a loan to look after his coffee. He is also applying for a loan in order to buy a coffee pulper and to build a coffee processing plant. This will help Luis to reduce his capacity losses and to improve the quality of his coffee. Luis is confident that these improvements at his farm will allow him to earn a higher income this quarter. This will help him to continue re-investing in his farming and improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a coffee pulper and to build a coffee processing plant.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.en:
Giovanni  operates a piggery and raises pigs for sale. For five years in the business, he has earned well for the family. He also sells pork meat in their village to earn more profit. 

He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy feeds in order to sustain his business and provide his child a better education. 

His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business as well as the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy feeds

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag, 33 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as cook at hotel since 2008. Her husband is serviceman and works at the same company she does. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,800 USD to buy a natural gas vehicle for transportation. Her workplace is far away from her home and everyday she needs to deliver her son to kindergarten. 

So, she has decided to buy a natural gas vehicle after studying its effects on the environment and economic factors such as fuel usage. The natural gas vehicle has advantages such as less fuel usage and release of harmless pollutants.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas vehicle

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora manages her own farm in Kinuman, Ozamis City in order to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used for her farm. She had to continue working in their farm to sustain her daily needs. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer for completion of her farm fertilization. She always finds ways to improve her farm for the betterment of her family's life. In the future, she wants to improve their house to make a comfortable living for them.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for stick brooms, soft brooms, net bags, sandpaper, and other products to resell in her business.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Genelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Genelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Maribel is applying for a 7000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and pay for construction labor to restore her family home. She is committed to working very hard to rebuild her devastated life. Her hope is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Honey Cris

texts.en:
Honey Cris works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase sugar, rice, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, soap, milk, and sugar.

Honey Cris has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, soap, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Eufronia

texts.en:
Eufronia is 61 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Eufronia has been in the pig fattening business for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Eufronia is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Sento. She is married, and has four children aged 27, 24, 20 and 7 years old. Two are school-going children.

In 2003, Sento established her groundnut business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. She began her business because her foster parent was unable to pay for her education, so she was introduced to business. After she got married her husband gave her some money to start the groundnut business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Sento has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bags of groundnuts. Sento has got the land to build a dwelling house and a store. She still continues to educate her children. She hopes this loan will help her to generate more income. She is a family person and very friendly. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
This is Asha. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more more goats for her business. She looks forward to the financial support with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more more goats

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married with eight children, four of whom are in school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chizi has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.
