With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en:
Raheli is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Dénise

texts.fr: Dénise vit avec son conjoint gérant et leur enfant à Lomé. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré en 2012 la vente des produits cosmétiques de manière ambulante. Dénise est aidée par 01 personne et fait sa première demande pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère à l'avenir accroitre son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Dénise est âgée de 34ans.
texts.en: Dénise lives with her husband, a manager, and their child in Lomé. In order to contribute to the household budget, in 2012 she launched a business selling cosmetic products as a street vendor. Dénise has one person helping her. This is her first request for a loan to restock merchandise. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and improve her family's life conditions. Dénise is 34 years old.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is married and operates an internet cafe business with his wife to earn a living. For more than five years, they have earned a good income for the family running this business. He is determined to send his children to school and provide a better education and with this in mind, they work with love and they never get tired working. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more chairs and cubicle dividers for the internet cafe. In the future, he wants to build a concrete home for his family.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and cubicle dividers for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Crestita is 55 years old and her four children are in school.

Crestita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Crestita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu appreciates her previous Kiva loan which improved her living standards. Besides the poultry business, Mbeyu operates a business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct-selling personal collection products business in the Philippines.

She requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell including lotion, body spray, body soap, and shampoo.

Glenda has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell including lotion, body spray, body soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is married with six children. Four of her children are in school and two are adults. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Umazi has operated a fruit-selling business for the past four years. She sells from the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase coconuts and mangoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and mangoes for resale

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of banana business in the Philippines.

Debora requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for eight years now.

Debora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en:
Emmie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of coconut shells business in the Philippines.

Emmie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconut shells to sell.

She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Emmie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Esternista

texts.en:
Esternista is 28 years old and married with two children. With both of her children currently in school, Esternista works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like sugar, salt, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

Esternista has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, salt, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, milk, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Esternista would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like sugar, salt, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: Pyalo

texts.fr: Pyalo est une jeune dame de 38ans qui a pour mari un commerçant et mère de famille. En 2005, elle a démarré son activité de vente de boissons et se fait aidée par 02 personnes. Avec ce cinquième crédit qu'elle octroie à WAGES, madame Pyalo souhaite acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Elle espère élargir sa boutique et assurer épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Pyalo is 38 years old, married, with children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. In 2005, she launched her business selling beverages. She is helped by two people. With this fifth loan from WAGES, Mrs. Pyalo would buy more merchandise in order to meet customer demand. She hopes to expand her store and assure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola Andrea es una joven de 29 años, madre cabeza de hogar  de 2  niñas, alguien con muchas metas en la vida las cuales quiere desempeñar  para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a las hijas.
A ella  le gusta mucho  la Hotelera, ve en esta muchas posibilidades, tanto laborales como personales, aquí ve un futuro prometedor para ella y la familia, dice que quiere  demostrarle a las mujeres que pueden salir adelante solas, luchar por alcanzar las metas, quiere que las hijas se sientan orgullosas de ella, que digan que la mama no necesito de nadie para que ellas tuvieran una buena estabilidad económica, en ocasiones trabaja en eventos, recepciones, aniversarios o en almacenes de cadena donde demuestra el carisma y la actitud necesaria para la carrera que está estudiando. 
Paola  es alguien con entusiasmo, es una mujer  sincera, honesta, respetuosa y colaboradora, son cualidades que la hacen mejor persona  y una mejor madre, es cumplida y responsable con las cosas que le asignan, sabe que tiene que esforzarse a pesar de tantas cosas que le han pasado, luchar y alcanzar las metas es lo que la motiva cada día más.
Actualmente vive con la mamá, las hijas y los hermanos, ella quiere seguir estudiando y es por eso que acude al convenio kiva, ya que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante como parte del desarrollo personal y para mejorar la calidad de vida de las hijas.
texts.en:
Paola Andrea is a young woman of 29. She is the head of household and mother of 2 girls, someone with many life goals that she wants to redeem in order to be able to bring her daughters a better quality of life and wellbeing.  

She likes the hotel industry as she sees many possibilities in it, workwise so much as personal. Here she sees a promising future for herself and her family. She says that she wants to show women that they can come out ahead alone, fighting to reach their goals. She wants her daughters to feel proud of her, that they say their mother did not need anybody to give them economic stability. On occasion she works events, receptions, anniversaries or in chain stores where she shows the necessary charisma and attitude that she is studying. 

Paola is someone with enthusiasm; she is a sincere, honest, respectful and collaborative woman, qualities that make her a better person and better mother. She is polite and responsible with the things that she is assigned. She knows that she has to stay strong despite all of the things that have happened to her. What motivates her each day is to fight and reach her goals. 

She currently lives with her mother, her daughters and her brothers. She wants to continue studying, and it is because of this that she turns to the Kiva agreement, because she has a strong desire to come out ahead as part of her personal development and in order to improve her daughters' quality of life.

loans.use: to pay a semester of schooling.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell for her buy and sell used clothing business.  Jinky has been in this business for 6 years. She also earns additional income from fish vending.

Jinky has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Annielyn

texts.en:
Annielyn has been running a general store to make a living.  Her husband is operating a service based business in addition to farming.  The couple earns a good living from their efforts and investments.  Annielyn's previous loan was successfully repaid from the revenue generated from the business.  To improve sales, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, Annielyn wants to make improvements to her house and enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Sullay

texts.en:
Please meet with Sullay. He is 35 years, married and has two children who are one and four years old. In 2007, Sullay established his spare motor parts business, which includes tires, brake pads, fan belts, batteries, windscreens, inner tubes, motor oil, etc. He began doing business for his mother when he was a small boy. When he became mature, he started his own business. 

Sullay has a special interest in business because the income he gets from this business is used to provide his family's livelihood.  It is from his business proceeds that he has bought a car and two pieces of land. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Sullay requires a loan in order to buy lift pumps, oil filters, universal joints, and brake kits.  He has completed his building project.  His business has also expanded.  He is planning to acquire a large shop to display his stock of goods.  He is a determined and hardworking businessman. He has many loyal customers because he deals in very good original spare parts. 

He thanks you for supporting him and his family.

loans.use: to pay for spare motor parts for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist and maintain her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married mother of five children, all of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She prepares local brew and sells it to her neighbors and passersby.She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase ingredients such as maize flour, water and chemicals for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as maize flour, water and chemicals to make local brew

loans.name: Jovert

texts.en: Jovert is 34 years old, married and has two children. His wife engages in a vending business, while he manages their farm. Jovert is growing corn in their fields. With his profit he earns from farming, Jovert is able to improve their house. At present his goal was to harvest more corn and increase his income from farming. Jovert will prioritize his children's education from the profits he will earn. With regards to his goal, Jovert is requesting a loan of P35,000 to buy farm inputs and pay for the labor cost of planting the corn. Jovert will do his best to have good crop and be able to attain his goal.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for the labor costs to plant corn.

loans.name: Jizeile

texts.en:
Jizeile is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jizeile is 28 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a bag-making business in the Philippines. Jizeile requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her bag-making business.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jizeile would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make bags

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 32 years old and married with one child.

Karen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Karen has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Karen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maricel has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Sia is 36 years old, married, and has four children. In 2004 Sia established her used clothing business. She began her business to provide assistance to her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located at city centre and her customers are mainly women. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 850,000 SLL from this business every month. 

Sia has received and successfully repaid two loans and  is now requesting for a third loan of 3,000,000 SLL. Sia requires this loan to help her buy more used clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will increase her income level. In the future, Sia plans to develop her plot of land, educate her children, and continue with her business. Sia used proceeds of her previous loans to pay school fees and buy learning materials for her children.
Sia is very grateful and wishes you well.

loans.use: to purchase more  used clothing.for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase rice, beans, sweets, biscuits, bread, groundnuts, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sweets, biscuits, bread, groundnuts, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, short sleeve and long sleeve shirts

loans.name: Mwavuo

texts.en:
Mwavuo is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. 

For the past seven years he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby. 

With this loan he wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
Juan de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado es un padre muy responsable, tiene cuatro hijos a quienes cuida junto con su esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maiz y frijoles y por temporadas trabaja en una hacienda.

El trabajo de agricultor se lo enseño su padre, quien fallecio cuando él era muy pequeño todavia desde entonces tubo que aprender a sobrevivir y sacar adelante su familia.

con el crédito comprara pollinaza, abono y fertilizantes materiales que utiliza para la siembra.
El sueño de Juan es mejorar su vivienda, que sus hijos tengan lo necesario y que sean personas de bien y utiles para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Juan is 29 years old and has a 6th grade education.  He is a very responsible parent with four children in his care along with his wife. He is farmer and plants corn and beans and performs seasonal work on a ranch.

He was taught how to be a farmer by his father who passed away when he was still very small.  Since then he has had to learn to survive and raise his family.

With this loan, he will buy manure, compost and fertilizer used for planting. Juan's dream is to improve their home, that his children have what they need and they are good people and useful to society.

loans.use: to buy manure, compost and fertilizer for planting corn.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad  de 60 años, está casado, vive con su hijo y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos terneros para el engorde y con un desarrollo adecuado. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener algo de ganancia en el desarrollo terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad y el proyecto.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos is 60 years old, is married, and lives with his son and wife, who are his number one priority. With this loan, he hopes to purchase some calves to fatten and bring to the proper weight. The idea is to take advantage of the pasture space that he has, and the good land and climate conditions, to be able to have these animals and later make a little profit by selling the fattened cattle for meat. With this purchase, he will be able to establish another line of work and also have savings that will allow him to have more and more animals and invest more in his plan for the property.

This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He hadn't ever received other loans from state banks, but Fudecosur has given him this loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Narcisa has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to nurse her coffee plants in this new season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs in order to help her coffee crops in this new growing season.

loans.name: Geiner

texts.es: Geiner, tiene la edad  de 43 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de siembra y asistencia para la plantación de aguacate, además de comprar algunas árboles de aguacate para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de aguacate. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Geiner is 43 years old, is married, and lives with his children and wife, who are his number one priority. With this loan, he intends to purchase fertilizer and fungicide, and pay for the labor to sow and cultivate his avocado farm. He also intends to purchase some avocado trees to replant at the beginning of the rainy season. He plans to do this to increase the density of plants and take advantage of the fertility of the soil, climate conditions, and other factors that favor the growth of avocados.

With these improvements to his crops, he hopes to make a little profit, improving the living conditions of his family. He also hopes to invest a little more in his fields to fulfill other goals.

This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He hadn't ever received other loans from state banks, but Fudecosur has given him this loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant and cultivate his avocado farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Sionita

texts.en: Sionita sells meals and snacks in her stall at their village. She has four children and her youngest child is the only one attending school. Sionita wants her youngest child to finish his study and find a better and stable job. She is doing her best to meet all her children's basic needs. If she is not satisfied with her sales in her stall, Sionita goes around their village to sell her cooked snacks. Sometimes her customers request different snack foods but she can’t pursue it due to financial constraints. In this connection, Sionita is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy raw materials and ingredients for cooking meals and snack foods to sell. She will get her child's needs in school taken care of purely through her earnings from the business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and ingredients for cooking meals and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace operates a clothes-selling business and she appreciates the support of her previous loan. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a big business in the future. 

Grace is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES, with which she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 52-year-old married woman with eight children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosalina has an ice-cream vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. 

Rosalina has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials for her business. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.en: Esperanca is taking a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as oils, cigarettes, sugar, salt and body lotion. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 600 USD. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, cigarettes, sugar, salt and body lotion

loans.name: Al-Ilham 4 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ilham 4. It consists of four women who are all hard working. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 150,000 YER. 

Jamala is 33 years old and married, with seven children. Her oldest child is 15 years old and the youngest one is 5. She is an uneducated woman, but she knows her advantages very well. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She said she had a small amount of money that she saved up herself. Jamala invested that money in her own business. She started her business five years ago, selling make-up and accessories in order to help her husband with the family's expenses. She sees this business as profitable for her. To further expand her business, Jamala has requested a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories and cosmetics to sell to women in her area. Jamala expects a boost in her income and to be able to enroll her children in a private school.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories and cosmetics to sell to women in her area.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 47 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock such as cereals, creamer, coffee, sugar, and noodles to sell.

Vivencia has taken out and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Vivencia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as cereals, creamer, coffee, sugar, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Tabitha operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. A challenge for her is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to buy a variety of fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit for resale

loans.name: Dilma Araceli

texts.es:
Doña Dilma es una mujer capaz, luchadora de 39 años de edad, quien tiene aproximadamente 25 años de experiencia en cultivar y producir café la cual forma parte de una familia de tradición agricultora ya que la caficultura por generaciones ha sido el único medio de ingreso económico para poder cubrir las diferentes necesidades del hogar. Fue a través de sus padres como ella adquirió los conocimientos a una edad de 13 años y posterior mente en compañía de su conyugue con quien siguiera trabajando en la misma actividad de forma propia siendo sus suegros quienes le apoyaran al heredarle una pedazo de tierra para trabajar. Por la falta de apoyo económico por sus padres ella no pudo estudiar de forma completa cursando solo 4 años de educación ya que los ingresos no eran suficientes para apoyarle. De su relación tiene tres hijos quienes asisten a la escuela de la comunidad y ayudan a sus padres en algunas actividades en el campo.
Sus metas para este nuevo año es hacer sus cultivos de café en uno 100% productores pudiendo obtener de ellos una excelente cosecha para ir poco a poco creciendo y generando mayores ingresos cada año. Sus sueños como madre para con sus hijos apoyarles en sus estudios y lograr que ellos puedan prepararse académicamente para poder tener mayores oportunidades en la vida y muchas puertas abiertas. Por lo que ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL financiamiento con el cual quiere comprar insumos agrícolas para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y así al final de esta temporada lograr obtener un excelente resultado.
texts.en:
Dilmar, 39, is a strong and capable woman who has about 25 years’ experience in growing and producing coffee.  It is part of a family tradition, being the only source of income for generations, which has allowed them to cover the household expenses.  She learnt the trade from her parents at 13, and has continued learning with her husband who also works in the same line of work.  Her husband has his own plot of land which he inherited from his parents.

Dilmar could not finish her studies due to the financial difficulties that her parents had at the time.  She only managed to complete four years of her education because her parents did not earn enough income to support her.  She has three children from her relationship who all attend high school in the area and help their parents with some activities in the fields.

Her goals this year are to get 100% production from her plantations so she can get a good harvest and make progress little by little, generating more income each year in the process.  As a mother her desire is to support her children through their education so that they can prepare themselves academically to have more opportunities in life with several ways of making a living.  

For this reason she is asking for a loan from COMIXMUL so she can buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee plantations and have the best results at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies which will help her protect her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 38 years now.

Vivencia requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Please meet Isatu. She is now 30 years old, is married, and has 2 children, the first of which is 5 years old and the youngest 9 months. In 2009, Isatu established her cosmetics business. She began her business because she was trained as a businesswoman and wanted to help her husband provide a living for their family. Working 7 days a week, 8 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from her business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more cosmetics for resale. In the future, Isatu plans to expand in business in order to have a better living and provide a quality education for her children. Isatu is very hardworking and friendly. She thanks you for your support and wishes you well.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to look after and maintain her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Ernesto Amilcar

texts.es: Ernesto tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Ernesto se gana la vida trabajando en una empresa como auxiliar de construcción, de esta forma lleva el sustento a su familia. Ernesto desea mejorar las condiciones del piso del corredor de la vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y ladrillo de piso. Espera contar con este financiamiento y así poder brindar a su querida familia mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: Ernesto, 25, lives in his own house with his partner and children.  He works in a construction company, which gives him enough income to support his family.  He would like to improve the hallway in his house so he has made the decision to ask for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and floor bricks.  If he gets this loan, he will be able to improve the living conditions for his beloved family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks for the floor so he can make improvements to the floor of his house.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad, a 28-year-old man, is a taxi driver. He is single and lives in the Baku region with his parents. Rashad and his family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city who have been displaced since his childhood. His parents are elderly and can’t work.

Rashad has been transporting passengers between various areas of the Baku region for 6 years. A few days ago, the engine of his car broke, so he couldn't work. Then he applied to Komak for a loan to repair his taxi. Rashad needs 600 Azerbaijan new manats (AZN). He hopes that his car will be repaired soon so he can start to work again. Rashad gives great thanks to Kiva for its help. In the future, he wants to get married.

loans.use: to repair the engine of his taxi

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Flora to improve her business. She is married and she opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own $150. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion, fanta, sprite and noodles. Flora is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion, fanta, sprite and noodles

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es: María tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas de 16 años, 9 años y 3 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de pollo por libras de forma ambulante. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio y es así como va sacando adelante a su familia junto con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja en una fabrica. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y lámina galvanizada.
texts.en:
Maria, 38, lives in her own house with her husband and their three daughters who are 16, 9 and 3 years old. Maria sells chicken by the pound door to door. She has worked this job for 5 years and through it and the help of her husband who works in a factory, she has improved the life of her family.

Maria is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a bathroom, which requires materials such as brick, cement, sand and sheets of galvanized metal.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand and sheets of galvanized metal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, foliar treatment and other things for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Berta Luz

texts.es: Berta tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos, su esposo falleció hace algunos años por lo que ella sola asume la responsabilidad de su hogar. Berta se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de prendas de vestir, muchas personas la prefieren dado que su trabajo es muy fino y a muy buenos precios. Su vivienda es muy humilde y actualmente el techa se encuentra deteriorado y desea repararlo lo antes posible. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera ya que no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso por su cuenta, poro si con la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Berta, 56, lives in her own house with her children.  Her husband passed away a few years ago so she alone has taken on the responsibility for looking after the household.  She earns her living making and selling dresses.  Lots of people come to her because she produces work of high quality at a good price.  

Her home is quite humble and at the moment the roof is in a state of deterioration.  She would like to repair it as soon as possible.  For this reason, she has asked FUSAI for a loan to buy corrugated sheets, nails and wood, because she hasn’t got enough money to afford it herself.  However, she can pay off the loan by using the instalment system through the loan system.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets, nails and wood to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Saipa

texts.en:
Saipa previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of used-but-quality clothes. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of used-but-quality clothes. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Saipa hopes to have multiple stalls for her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of used-but-quality clothes.

loans.name: Olga Arely

texts.es: Olga tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 24 años, 17 años y 14 años de edad. Olga es pequeña comerciante de tienda en la cual ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes.  Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro perimetral para cerrar su vivienda y proteger sus pocas pertenencias  y a sus hijos. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro.
texts.en: Olga is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her three children, aged 24, 17, and 14 years. Olga owns a small shop, where she sells a variety of staple products to her customers. With the desire of improving her living conditions, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in building a perimeter wall to close off her home and protect her children and her few belongings. With the amount requested, she will buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Norma es una mujer luchadora, capaz con 44 años de edad, casada y madre de siete hijos los cuales 2 trabajan dando asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y los otros 5 estudian en diferentes grados de educación en la escuela de la comunidad los cuales se integran en el apoyo a sus hermanos al salir de sus clases. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario incompleto cursando hasta cuarto grado y no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. En compañía de sus padres ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra siendo ellos quienes también le heredaran la tierra que en familia trabajan para salir adelante la cual está ubicada a 10 minutos desde su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan caminando. Su único desafío al cual algún día le gustaría es el estado de la carretera al momento de trasportar el grano ya que no es la adecuada para el ingreso de vehículos hasta la propiedad.
Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que mejoraran sus cultivos de café ya que por medio de esto ella podrá asistir su plantación y la tierra para generar ingresos para su familia al final de la temporada. Sus planes y metas a futuro, ampliar sus cultivos de café comprando más tierra en la que ella pueda trabajar y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos trabajando en el patrimonio que hoy en día, ella y su esposo construyen el cual será heredado a ellos para que posteriormente construyan sus hogares y tengan como generar ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
Norma, 44, is a capable, hard-working woman who is married and has seven children.  Two of them work on their coffee plantation and five attend school and help their siblings when they get home.  Norma was only able to get a fourth grade education because her parents could not afford for her to continue.  She learned agriculture from her parents and inherited land from them which is a ten minute walk from her house.  The only challenge she faces is the fact that the road to her land is in bad condition and not adequate for vehicle transport of the coffee beans.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers to improve her coffee crop.  With these products she will be able to care for her crop and land to generate an income for her family at the end of the season.  Her future goals are to produce more coffee by buying more land to work on and to strengthen her children's patrimony.

Her dream is to see her children working on the estate she and her husband have and which they will inherit to build their homes on and have an income for their families.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and compost for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Lia Inés

texts.es: Lía es una ya veterana mujer de 51 años de edad, con un feliz matrimonio en el cual como fruto hubo un hijo que actualmente tiene 15 años que a raíz de los problemas financieros que aquejaban su hogar decidió montar un negocio el cual lleva un año de vida y es la venta de mercancía como ropa para hombre y dama, esta decisión la tomó debido a su edad pues era un limitante a la hora de conseguir un empleo. Distribuye y ofrece mercancías a sus vecinos y familiares quienes le comprar ya que son productos de calidad y muy lindos, solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía, con la cual re-nutrirá sus estilos y podrá ofrecer una mayor variedad no solo en diseños si no en tipo de blusas y jeans dando más colores etc. etc. Su principal sueño es demostrar que a pesar de su edad puede trabajar, ser útil que la edad no sea un limitante ni una excusa a la hora de aportar ingresos en la casa y más cuando son tan indispensables para la alimentación y pagos de deudas pero para lograr todos estos objetivos sabe que la única manera es invertir en su negocio pues así crecerá y quizás en un futuro pueda tener un almacén de ropa reconocido en la ciudad
texts.en:
Lía, 51, is an experienced woman who has a happy marriage and a 15-year-old son.  Because of financial problems in the household, she decided to set up her own business selling merchandise such as men's and women's clothing, which she has been doing for a year now.  She decided on this business because of her age which limited her employment opportunities.

She sells goods to neighbors and family who wish to buy quality products.  She is requesting a loan to buy a wider variety of products with new styles and colors in blouses and jeans.  

Her main goal is to work, despite her age, and not let it get in the way of her earning an income for the household.  Especially given the fact that money is necessary for food and to pay off debt.  She knows the only way to do this is by investing in her business and expand.  In the future perhaps she can have a well-known shop in the city.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as men's and women's clothing, in order to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Para esta  época de verano y sol, es necesario contar con un buen par de lentes  para proteger nuestra vista de los  fuertes  rayos solares. Eduardo ofrece gran variedad de anteojos para todos los gustos y temporadas.  No tiene ruta específica, los comercia por distintas calles de la capital.  Este no ha sido su primer trabajo, anteriormente se desempeñaba como guardia en una empresa de seguridad.
Su esfuerzo ha rendido frutos, porque sus productos han tenido una buena aceptación por los capitalinos.  Eduardo quiere mantener ese ritmo de ventas, asimismo, desea contar con más mercadería. Él solicitó un financiamiento en KIVA MiCrédito  para la compra de lentes, corta uñas y cordones, artículos que cuentan con fuerte demanda entre sus clientes.  Su meta es llegar a todo los rincones del país, así logrará buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
In this season of summer and sun a good pair of sunglasses are necessary to protect the eyes from the strong solar rays.  Eduardo offers a wide variety of glasses for everyone and every season.  He does not have a specific work route, but sells in different streets of the capital city.  This is not his first job as he used to work as a security guard for a company.

His efforts have paid off because the products he sells are popular among the capital city locals.  Eduardo wants to continue his sales momentum and have more merchandise on hand.  He has requested a loan through KIVA MiCrédito to buy sunglasses, nail clippers and lanyards, which are popular among his customers.  His goal is to sell everywhere throughout the country and earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy sunglasses, nail clippers and lanyards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en:
Like many people in his area, Akmal runs a farming business. Akmal lives in an agricultural region and has been growing vegetables for over ten years. His wife helps him. They live in a large house and have two small children together. Akmal earns an additional income from animal husbandry, where he mainly feeds cows. 

Akmal aims to develop his farming business so that he can earn a higher income and improve his living conditions. He is requesting a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and cattle

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is thirty-four years old and single. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosie requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosie has been in pig fattening for five years now. So far, she has borrowed six times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila operates a food kiosk business selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Seasonality is the main challenge to her business.

With the loan she has requested, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for the support.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is a hardworking woman who greatly appreciates the financial support that Kiva lenders gave for her previous loan. The previous loan improved her living standards and she would now like to apply for a loan to buy more reeds for her basket-weaving business. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more reeds for her business

loans.name: José Alexander

texts.es: José es un hombre que ha dedicado toda su vida al cultivo pues fue criado con las enseñanzas de una humilde familia de campesinos que anteponen el trabajo por sobre todas las cosas ya que a pesar de su poca preparación estudiantil tienen muy claro que su actividad es determinante para la alimentación de todos, agricultores y ganaderos personas en ocasiones tan marginados pero tan esenciales en cualquier cultura o ciudad, José se desempeña como criador de ganado bovino en una finca, pero cansado de esta situación de estar empleado sin oportunidad de crecer económicamente decide con la ayuda de un crédito montar su propia cría de ganado y es precisamente esto en lo que usara el crédito para la compra de ganado con los que empezara su proyecto buscando fortalecerse y crecer hasta tener un capital suficiente parta la compra de una finca propia en la cual pueda tener su ganado y constituir una familia
texts.en:
José has worked all his life in agriculture. He was raised by a humble family from the countryside for whom their work is the most important thing. Despite their lack of education, they know that many depend on the food they grow. Farmers are many times neglected but they are very important for the society, regardless of their culture or origin.

José raises cattle in a farm. However, he grew tired of being an employee and not having the opportunity to improve his financial situation and decided to request a loan to start his own cattle business. He will use the loan to buy cattle and start with his project. He will try to expand and strengthen his business in order to be able to buy his own farm, where he can raise his own cattle and start a family.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start his own business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more natural products for weight loss, skin care, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Sor María

texts.es: La señora sor es una reconocida vendedora de artesanías en el parque principal del municipio donde habita, más de 10 años de experiencia la hacen acreedora de una excelente reputación entre los habitantes del sector pero dichas personas no son su principal nicho de ventas ya que su pueblo es conocido por ser un muy buen destino turístico por lo que cada año en temporada tiene que idearse la manera de poder atraer clientes con sus novedosos y curiosos objetos artesanales, pero estos no son todos los productos que venden también distribuyen vestimenta típica de los  colombianos en especial de los antioqueños como: carriel, sombrero, ruana, alpargatas entre otros su principal sueño es poder continuar con la tradición de vender artesanías de seguir con esta hermosa tradición ya que gracias a ella está remodelando y ampliando su casa por ende decidió dedicar el resto de su vida a la fabricación de bellas piezas artísticas, pero como madre también tiene que velar por su hijo de 10 años a quien quiere darle una buena educación y en un futuro poder enviarlo a una universidad, por esta razón solicita un crédito para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de artesanías con las que quiere seguir creciendo su negocio, adecuar su hogar y darle un futuro a su hijo.
texts.en: Sor is a well known hand made crafts seller in the main park of the town where she lives. More than ten years' experience has earned her an excellent reputation among the residents of the area, but these people aren't her main sales niche, because her town is known as a tourism destination. That is why every year, in season, she has to find a way to attract customers with her new and interesting hand made objects. But these aren't the only products that she sells. She also distributes traditional Colombian clothing, especially Antioquian, such as carriels, hats, ruanas, espadrilles and more. Her main dream is to be able to continue with the tradition of selling hand made crafts so she can keep this beautiful tradition, because thanks to her they are remodeling and enlarging their home. That is why she decided to spend the rest of her life making these beautiful artistic pieces. as a mother, she also has to care for her son, who is 10 years old. She wants to give him a good education and future to be able to send him to college. For that reason, she is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make the hand made crafts to continue growing her business, to do home improvements and to give her son a future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make handmade crafts, such as wood, shiny items, vinyl and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and table.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her thrift store. Her income from business is assisting her family's everyday household expenditures. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more used clothes and pants to sell. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Fatima dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
	
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more used clothes and pants to sell.

loans.name: Maliam

texts.en: Maliam is 42. She is married with seven children. She has sold vegetables and fruits for the past two years. With this loan, she would like to buy more tomatoes, onions and eggplants to sell. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the better future of her business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, onions and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz es dueña de un restaurante el cual inicio hace 13 años con la ilusión de poder mantener los gastos de su familia, actualmente tiene 68 años pero los ánimos de trabajar de una persona de 20 ya que atiende su negocio sola y su restaurante debido al tiempo y el exquisito sabor de sus platos es muy solicitado por los clientes, es una persona muy perseverante, alegre, muy sonriente, de esas mujeres que a pesar de no ser familia los clientes conocidos llegan la abrazan fuertemente debido al afecto que le tienen, solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima como alimentos y bebidas para dar abasto a una temporada que se avecina y en la cual sus ventas se elevan ya que el año pasado se acercaron muchos clientes pero no a todos les pudo expresar su amor a través de un plato de comida, su gran sueño es seguir con su restaurante por varios años.
texts.en: Luz is the owner of a restaurant that she started 13 years ago with the dream of being able to pay the family expenses. Right now, she is 68 years old, but she has the work drive of a 20 year old. She runs her business alone and because of the delicious flavor of her dishes, she is very popular with customers. She is a person who perseveres and is cheerful, and smiling. She is one of those women who despite not being family, is greeted by the customers with big hugs because of the affection they have for her. She is asking for the loan to buy raw materials such as food and beverages to stock up for the coming season when her sales increase. Last year, a lot of customers came her way, but she was unable to express her love for them through a plate of food. Her big dream is to continue with her restaurant for several years.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as food and beverages to stock up for the coming season.

loans.name: Katuku

texts.en:
Katuku is a married mother and has kids, all of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Over the past years, she has operated a fruit-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

Katuku is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase mangoes, oranges, and bananas for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, oranges, and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Avon and natural products to sell door-to-door, in the hope of earning a higher income.

loans.name: Wendy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Wendy es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, muchos ánimos y esperanzas de salir adelante y de cumplir lo propuesto en su vida manifestando a sus 25 años la gratitud y el respeto primeramente a DIOS por darle la vida y muchas bendiciones a diario y posteriormente hacia sus padres por haber inculcado en ella valores y principios. Ella es casada y madre de 2 hijos quienes viven con ella pero solo uno de ellos estudia en la primaria en la escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo es quien elabora la mayor parte de trabajo en el campo ya que ella se involucra únicamente en el tiempo de corte y recolección del grano pues la mayoría del tiempo pasa al cuidado de sus hijos y los quehaceres en el hogar. Wendy tiene un grado de estudio de primaria completo gracias al apoyo de sus padres que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar estudiando. 
Ella tiene como meta seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café de manera que puedan generar mayores ganancias para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos, apoyar a su familia en todo lo necesario y demás que ellos necesiten ya que otra de sus metas son los arreglos a su casa de habitación la cual necesita mejoras. Por lo que Wendy hoy en día solicita financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia y mantenimiento aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas, etc. que evitaran la contaminación de plagas y enfermedades en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Wendy is a strong and enthusiastic woman, with hopes of prospering and achieving her life goals. Wendy is 25 years old and is grateful and respectful first to God for giving her life and blessing her every day. She is also grateful to her parents for the values and principles that they gave to her. 

Wendy is married and a mother to two children who live with her. One child is studying in the local primary school. Wendy's husband does most of the work in the field while Wendy herself only helps with the cutting and harvesting of coffee. Wendy spends most of her time looking after the children and the household chores. Wendy completed primary school thanks to her parents support but, due to a lack of money, she could not continue with her education.

Wendy's goal is to continue to expand her coffee crops in order to earn higher profits to look after her children's future and support her family with everything that they need. Another of Wendy's goals is to make improvements to her house. Today Wendy is applying for a loan in order to help her crops through the use of farming supplies such as fertilisers, fungicides and more. These will stop the coffee crops from becoming diseased.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure and more to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school materials, meat, chicken, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es: 61 años de edad, 3 hijos que mantener y una separación fueron varios puntos que obligaron a la señora  Ruth a buscar una forma de aportar ingresos a su hogar ya que por el rompimiento de su matrimonio no tenía quien generara dinero en su hogar, trabajo 11 años en un puesto de comidas rápidas de una amiga, trabajo que tuvo que abandonar por serios problemas de salud que este le generaba, con un dinero ahorra y con ayuda de sus hijos logro montar un puesto de comidas rápidas al frente de su hogar el cual atiende solo fines de semana y es muy destacado por el aseo que maneja, requiere un crédito para la compra de surtido como panes, quesos, chorizos, papas, carnes entre otros para abarcar la temporada que se acerca, su única aspiración es poder dividir su hogar y darles a cada hijo una parte de su hogar en una muestra de afecto para el día que ella les llegue a faltar pues sabe que su vida gira entorno a ellos y solo se sentirá tranquila cuando pueda dejarle a cada hijo un techo al cual puedan acudir
texts.en: Reaching 61 years of age, having three children to look after, and her separation from her husband were three events that forced Ruth to look for a way to bring home an income. Following the break-up of her marriage, there was nobody at home to earn an income. Ruth spent 11 years working at a friend's fast-food stall but she had to leave this work following some quite serious health problems. With savings and help from her children, Ruth managed to start her own fast-food stall outside of her house. She serves customers at the weekends and is popular for offering clean products. Ruth needs this loan in order to buy stock such as cheese, chorizo, potatoes, meat and more to start the upcoming new season. Ruth's only dream is divide her home into separate parts, and to give each of her children their own part of the house. She wants to do this to show them her love. Ruth knows that her life is affected so greatly by her children and she will only feel at peace when she can give each of her children a roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy stock such as cheese, chorizo, potatoes, meat and more to start the upcoming new season.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is 53 years old. He is kind man with a good soul. Rustam has been busy with his farming business more than 20 years. He grows watermelon on 2 hectares of land. Rustam sells watermelon in a local market. He earns additional income from animal husbandry, and he keeps mainly horses. Rustam’s business is the only source of the family's income because his wife is a housewife. She helps Rustam with managing his business. Rustam always tries to provide for the well-being of his 2 children. He plans to develop the business and maximize profits. 
The profits he earns will improve the family's living standard. He is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for growing watermelon. He awaits your support and in advance thanks you for the support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for growing watermelons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional used but quality clothing needed in his business.

loans.name: Villen

texts.en:
Villen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Villen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.  She has been in this business for 28 years now.

Villen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.

loans.name: Paladie

texts.en:
Paladie is 27 years old. She is married with two children. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more electric equipment for sale such as cell phones, batteries, and TV sets. She plans to reinvest with the profits that will be obtained in her business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more TV sets, cell phones, and batteries for sale

loans.name: Dolphina

texts.en:
Dolphina operates a stall at the market selling fruits and vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. Her biggest challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

Dolphina decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to buy sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She appreciates the support of lenders.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is managing a fishpond business. With her desire to have additional source of income, Bernadette is also managing a piggery business. She raises hogs to respond immediately to her children's necessities in finishing their studies. 

Bernadette needs an additional capital to sustain both her fishes' and hogs' feed. She wishes for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. Bernadette hopes to expand the business, earns enough profit for the education of her children and their basic needs as well.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Wilma is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.
Wilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a 13,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.  She has been in this business for 7 years. 
In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
In 2009 Mary, a married 45-year-old mother of two children aged 10 and 18 years, established her mixed-articles business. Trained as a business woman, she began it to help provide for her children. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month,

Very hard working, honest and friendly, Mary is requesting a loan of Le5,000,000 to buy more articles for resale. In the future, she plans to open a bigger shop and educate her children to university level. 

Mary thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more mixed articles for resale

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
This is Luvuno. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more kiosk shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and sugar. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and an iron.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a married woman and has five kids who attend school. They live at a their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a farming business for the past five years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding to large-scale farming in the future. 

With the KES 35,000 loan, Jacinta wants to purchase more seedlings and herbicides to kill pests. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and herbicides to kill pests

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 41-years-old and married with one child. 

Natividad is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Natividad has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 29-year-old Veronica from Harare. She is married with three children, two of whom attend school.  Veronica runs a manufacturing business producing bed spreads, seat covers, and baby wear. The business has been in operation for eight years. She says the main challenge she faces is liquidity constraints. Veronica has requested a loan of $400 to buy raw materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to ease the cashflow challenges she is currently facing.  Veronica plans to grow the business fourfold.

loans.use: to purchase fabric material for tailoring

loans.name: Maritza Damaris

texts.es:
Ambiente agradable, mercadería variable y calidad de atención es lo que reciben las personas que visitan la pequeña tienda de Maritza, quienes no dudan en regresar. Ella tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Es licenciada en computación, pero desde que estaba en la universidad se vio con la necesidad de comercializar productos, actividad que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingreso. Su esposo es su mano derecha, quién le envía remesas para la inversión del negocio y la educación de sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar perfumes, camisas para mujeres y camisetas para hombres, lo que le permitirá complacer las demandas de sus clientes. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que de esta  manera logrará obtener estabilidad económica. Una de sus metas es ampliar el espacio dónde atiende a los clientes, algún día espera tener una gran tienda, asegura que no dejará de trabajar, hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
Agreeable atmosphere, varied merchandise, and quality attention is what people receive who visit Maritza's small shop, and they have no doubt of returning. She is 38 years old, married, and has 3 kids. She is licensed in computing, but since she was in university she saw the necessity of selling products, an activity that she has turned into her principal source of income. Her husband is her right hand to whom she sends the remittance investment in the business and the education of the kids. 

She requests the loan in order to increase production of her capital that she needs to buy perfumes, shirts for women, and shirts for men which will allow her to oblige the demands of her clients. She puts her trust in the financing given that in this way she will achieve economic stability. One of her goals is to enlarge the space where she attends to clients, and some day she hopes to have a big and won't stop working until she achieves it.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, shirts for women and for men.

loans.name: Al-Shatha Group

texts.en:
Al-Shatha is a group consisting of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 105,000 YER from AL- Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). 

Joma'a is a 32- year-old married woman with five children. She is the leader of the group. Despite her miserable conditions, she didn't surrender to them.  Instead, she decided to help her husband with the expenses of the family. Joma'a started her business two years ago selling women's clothes door-to-door.  However, this business needs a lot of money to purchase more clothes in various kinds in order to grow. The money that she accumulates is not enough for that and most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes and resell them to her customers.  For further enlargement, she decided to begin selling ice cream and children's sweets.

Joma'a looks forward to expanding her business more through opening a stall selling ice cream. Her dream is to support her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes and resell them to her customers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old, married, and has nine children. With one child still in school, Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, coffee, etc. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Virginia has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling fish.  

Joann requested her sixth loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish

loans.name: Marie Flor

texts.en:
Marie Flor is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marie Flor is 26-years-old and has three children who are currently in school.

Marie Flor has a food wrapper making business in the Philippines. Marie Flor requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like flour, salt, etc. for her business.

Marie Flor has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marie Flor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like flour, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Laetitia

texts.en:
Laetitia is 23 years old. She is married and has one child. 

She sells clothes and related items. She has spent five years in the business. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes, belts, and umbrellas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, belts and umbrellas for sale.

loans.name: Nilpha

texts.en:
Nilpha is 36 years old and married with two children who are both currently in school. Nilpha works very hard to provide for them.

Nilpha runs a general store in the Philippines. Nilpha has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like detergent soap, canned goods, bread, cereals, chocolate drink, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

In the future, Nilpha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like detergent soap, canned goods, bread, cereals, chocolate drink, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Marivic requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items to sell in her general store. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 44-years-old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

Yolanda has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cows for her business.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables, rice, wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and cooking oil for resale.  She thanks Yehu for its financial support

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, rice, wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has four children  who attend school. She operates a kerosene selling business, which she has been doing for six years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

Halima is requesting a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase gallons of kerosene to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Halima lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos nietas de 15 y 14 años de edad. María  se gana la vida honradamente mediante la prestación de servicios domésticos, dicho oficio es el que le permite colaborar con la economía de su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida quien es jornalero mantienen la economía del hogar. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de un cuarto dormitorio de su vivienda puesto que se encuentra en mal estado. Con el monto solicitado comparará lámina galvanizada, polines y pagará por la mano de obra para la reparación del techo.
texts.en:
