55-year old María lives in her own house with her husband and two nieces aged 15 and 14. She earns her living in the honorable occupation of servant, a job that enables her to contribute to household finances alongside her husband who is a day laborer.

María is seeking this loan from FUSAI to repair the roof of a bedroom in their house which is in poor condition. With the money she will buy galvanized sheets and beams, and pay for the work to be done.

loans.use: buy galvanized sheets and beams to repair the roof of a bedroom, and pay for the work to be done

loans.name: Jovienice

texts.en:
Jovienice is married and has one child. She works hard to support her family. She sells beauty products in the Philippines. She earns additional income from raising pigs and operating a general store. 

Jovienice requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more products such as lotion, facial cream, etc. to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as lotion, facial cream, etc. to sell

loans.name: Moboh

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Moboh. She is married and has two children, age 10 and 25 years.

In 2012, Moboh established her Cotton and Lace Clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-employed and secure a source of revenue for providing livelihood for her family. Working seven days a week and seven hours hours a day, she earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Moboh requires a loan in order to buy more clothing for resale. In the future, she plans to improve her business and educate her children. 

Moboh thanks you for your support and wishes you well.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Raelyn

texts.en:
Raelyn, 50, is a married woman with five children. Two of them are currently in school. 

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Raelyn has an herbal products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Raelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

In the future, Raelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 21 years old. She sells spare parts and has been in the business for the past three years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more bicycle and motorbike spare parts for sale. She says the profits will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle and motorbike spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
Martha requested a loan from Yehu for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a widowed woman with four children. Two are adults and two attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past six years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase salt, bread, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, tiene una tienda desde hace 12 años en la que tiene a la disposición de sus clientes variedad de productos que ellos demandan, está actividad la emprendió por iniciativa propia, ella vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 18 años de edad.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, jabón, lejía, maya metálica, alambre, entre otros materiales que le permitirán surtir el inventario de su tienda y construir una cerca alrededor de un pozo que tiene en su vivienda para proteger de algún peligro a su familia.
Su sueño es crecer con su negocio para tener más ingresos con los que cancelara la deuda adquirida y terminar de pagar un lote.
texts.en:
Francisca has run her store for more than 12 years. She sells a variety of products as requested by her customers. She started the store on her own initiative. She lives with her husband and 18-year old daughter.

The loan Francisca is seeking will be used to buy basic grains, candy, drinks, soap, bleach, metal fencing, wire etc. Then she will be able to stock her store and build a fence around the well near her house to protect her family from danger.

Her dreams include growing her business to increase income, repaying  her loan, and finish paying for a parcel of land.

loans.use: Buy basic grains, candy, drinks, soap, metal fencing and wire etc.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда предпринимательница из города Худжанд. Ей 47 лет. Она в течение 3 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Ее продуктовый магазин построен рядом с домом. Мавчуде в торговле помогает ее единственный сын. Муж в данный момент работает за границей. Мавчуда деятельная и предприимчивая женщина. Она хорошо ведет свой бизнес, у нее в магазине всегда свежие и качественные продукты, что очень важно для привлечения клиентов. Мавчуда ценит свой бизнес и всегда старается для его развития. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом. Запрашиваемая сумма нужна ей для купли ассортимента продуктов питания и частично для проведения мероприятия в доме. Она надеется, что ее поддержат.
texts.en: Mavjuda is a female entrepreneur from the city of Khujand. She 47 years old. For three years, she has been running her own business. Her grocery store was built close to her house. Her only son helps Mavjuda with her sales. Her husband currently works abroad. Mavjuda is a busy and enterprising woman. She runs her business very well. She always has fresh and high-quality produce in her store, which is very important for attracting customers. Mavjuda values her business and always works hard to develop it. Now she is requesting a loan. She needs the requested amount to buy a variety of food products and, in part, to carry out a celebration in her house. She hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to buy food products for her grocery store and, in part, to carry out a celebration in her home.

loans.name: Mweni

texts.en:
Mweni operates a fruit stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase a variety of fruits such as mangoes, bananas, oranges and lemons for sale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits for sale.

loans.name: Monica Andrea

texts.es:
Mónica es una hermosa joven que inicio su vida de empresaria gracias a una tía que la invito a una reunión en la cual les mostraban el producto y la manera de distribuirlo y a partir de eso lo único que ha hecho es vender, pues en su mente esta su hija con tal solo 19 meses de edad a la cual le tiene que brindar todo el apoyo posible tanto económicamente como afectivo en pocas palabras desempeñar el papel de madre y padre.
Sus ventas fueron afectadas por un periodo en el cual tuvo que parar el negocio pues su madre estaba gravemente enferma con la ayuda de dios supero su enfermedad, y está retornando al negocio, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercancía como, jabones, shampos, cremas de manos entre otras dado que tiene un sueño cuidar y brindarle todo el apoyo a su hija madre y a ella misma progresando como empresaria hasta poder montar su propio local en el cual distribuirá sus productos ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Moníca  is a lovely young woman who started her life as a businesswoman thanks to an aunt who invited her to a meeting where she was shown the product and how to distribute it. The only thing she had to do was sell it. She thought of her 19-month old daughter whom she had to support both financially and emotionally, in other words take on the role of both mother and father.

Her sales were affected for a period when she had to stop because her mother was seriously ill. However, with God's help she got better, and Moníca returned to her business. She is now seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as soaps, shampoo, hand cream etc. She wishes to care for and support her mother and daughter in every way she can, as well as progress as a businesswoman until she has her own premises where she can also sell clothing and footwear.

loans.use: Buy soaps, shampoos, hand cream etc.

loans.name: Maria Cristela

texts.es:
María, atiende su negocio desde hace 15 años, el cual consiste en brindar el servicio de anillado, fotocopias, digitaciones y venta de material didáctico, ella atiende el negocio con la ayuda de sus hijos y una empleada, la estabilidad del negocio se ha mantenido desde que inicio. María es casada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 20, 18 y 17 años de edad.
Está solicitando capital para pagar reparaciones a computadoras y fotocopiadoras, ya que son sus herramientas de trabajo, con lo que mejorara sus servicios y atraerá más clientes, espera recuperar con buenas ganancias lo invertido.
Su visión es continuar fortaleciendo el negocio, para dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y ofrecer empleo estable.
texts.en:
María has had her business for fifteen years. She offers different services, such as spiral-binding, photocopies and keyed-in transcriptions. She also sells educational material. Her children and an employee help her and she has managed to keep the business running since she started it. María is married and lives with her husband and three children aged 20, 18 and 17.

María is requesting a loan to repair her computers and copying machines, which are the tools she uses to work. This will result in improvements to the services she offers and in more customers. She hopes that this investment will result in good profits.

Her vision is to continue strengthening her business in order to improve her family’s living conditions and be able to offer her employee a more stable job.

loans.use: to repair her copying machines and computers.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa familiar junto a su compañera de vida, dos hijos de 14 años (gemelos) y una hija de 12 años de edad. Carlos trabaja como bodeguero en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como se gana la vida y junto a su esposa quien es pequeña comerciante dan a sus hijos e hija lo necesario. Carlos desea mejorar las condiciones del piso del corredor de la vivienda y cambiar una puerta que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava y una puerta y además pagará mano de obra para la realización de las mejoras.
texts.en:
Carlos is 42 years old and lives together with his life partner and three children; two 14-year-old twins and a 12-year-old daughter. Carlos works in a warehouse, located close to where he lives. His wife is a businesswoman. This is how they make a living and provide for their children.

Carlos wants to repair the floor of his house and change a door that has deteriorated with time. With the requested amount, he will buy cement, sand, gravel and a door, and he will pay for the labor needed to do the work.

loans.use: to repair his floor and a change a door. He will buy cement, sand, gravel and the door.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams, galvanized metal sheets and nails, and to pay for the labor needed to build the roof of her house.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз энергичная молодая женщина, занимающаяся собственным торговым бизнесом на центральном рынке своего района Спитамен. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Семь лет назад Дилафруз открыла магазин, где по сей день занимается там продажей швейных принадлежностей. В частности она продает бисер, бусины, нитки швейные и вязальные, пуговицы, стразы и изделия из них и т.д., то есть все, что необходимо для портних. Ей нравится ее торговый бизнес и сейчас она хочет увеличить ассортимент товара в своем магазине. Для этой цели Дилафруз просит кредит, чтобы закупить больше ассортимента швейных принадлежностей. Она с надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Dilafruz is an energetic young woman who has her own business at the local market in Spitamen.  She is 26 years old, married, and has two children. Seven years ago, Dilafruz opened the shop where she currently sells sewing supplies. She sells everything that dressmakers need, such as beads, thread for sewing and knitting, buttons, rhinestones, and so forth. She likes her retail business and now she wants to offer a wider variety of products in her store. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase a large assortment of sewing supplies. She hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies for her store to increase her inventory

loans.name: Sidnooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA représente le groupe SIDNOOMA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 10mois. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales  depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces environnantes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de 100kg de maïs et 01 sac d’haricot.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son champ d’activité et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative of the Signooma group. She carries herself very well. She is married and the mother of 3 children, the oldest of whom is 12 and the youngest of whom is 10 months old. Two of Rasmata's children currently attend school.

Rasmata has been selling cereals for 8 years. She stocks up in the surrounding areas. She wants to purchase 1 bag of 100kg of corn and 1 bag of beans. With her profits, she wants to reinvest in her business. Rasmata's ambition is to expand her type of business and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 1 bag of 100kg of corn and 1 bag of beans

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она всегда стремится к тому, чтобы улучшить условию проживания. Она имеет одного ребенка. Фотима пережила много тягости жизни. Она потеряла своего мужа и осталась без кормильца. Она была вынуждена найти источника дохода. Итак, 8 лет назад она открыла свою маленькую лавочку, где продавала семечки, конфеты и жвачки. Вначале было очень трудно. Несмотря на все трудности, она продолжала свою деятельность. Благодаря упорному труду она смогла развевать свой бизнес. Данное время она продает продукты питания на местном рынке. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 Сомони для покупки продукты питания. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Fotima is a sincere and hardworking woman. She always works to improve her living conditions. She has one child. Fotima has lived through many difficulties in life. She lost her husband and was left without a breadwinner for the family. She needed to find a source of income. Thus, eight years ago, she opened her own small shop where she sold seeds, candy and gum. At first, it was very difficult. Despite all of the difficulties, she continued her business. Thanks to her hard work, she was able to develop her business. She currently sells groceries at the local market. She wants to increase her working capital and, consequently, her earnings. She is requesting a loan for 2000 somoni to buy groceries. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy food items to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Higia

texts.en:
Higia is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $1,500. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, noodles, cigarettes, water, coffee, sugar, eggs, bread, body lotion and milk. 

She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, noodles, cigarettes, water, coffee, sugar, eggs, bread, body lotion and milk

loans.name: Agbenoxevi

texts.fr: Commerçant de produits d'alimentation générale depuis 2012, Agbenoxevi s'approvisionne généralement au Grand Marché de Lomé et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de garder sa clientèle. Il souhaite agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il est marié et père de 04 enfants. Agbenoxevi est âgé de 42ans.
texts.en: Having been in the food products business since 2012, Agbenoxevi stocks up on his items in the Grand Market of Lomé and is requesting his first loan to be able to purchase more merchandise in order to keep his customer base. He hopes to grow his business and to provide for the needs of his family. Agbenoxevi is married and the father of 4 children; he is 42 years old.

loans.use: to purchase general food products

loans.name: Zaydona

texts.ru: Женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями нуждается вашей финансовой поддержки. Она трудится и живет в горном Таджикистане. Зайдона заботливая мать 2 детей. Она начала свою деятельность 3 года назад, так как ее дети нуждаются в ее поддержки. Зайдона занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает коров и продает молочные продукты как молоко, кефир, сметану и т.п. Зайдона продает свою продукцию местным жителям. Ее покупатели довольны ее продукцией. Зайдона данное время хочет увеличить количество своих коров. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки коровы. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This woman with a wonderful heart and mind needs your financial support. She works and lives in mountainous Tajikistan. Zaydona is an attentive mother of two children. She started her business three years ago, as her children needed her support. Zaydona practices cattle breeding. She fattens up cows and sells dairy products such as milk, kefir, sour cream, etc. Zaydona sells her products to local residents. Her customers are satisfied with her products. Currently, Zaydona  wants to increase her number of cows. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy cows. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Jofran

texts.en:
Jofran is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jofran is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jofran has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Jofran requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Jofran has been in this business for one year. In the future, Jofran would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Leonora is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fruits, sugar, milk, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fruits, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending and motorcycle transport.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cerelyn is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Cerelyn has a direct selling Personal Collection products business in the Philippines. Cerelyn requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products of Personal Collection to sell.

Cerelyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Cerelyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more products of Personal Collection to sell.

loans.name: Ana Emilou

texts.en:
Ana Emilou works hard to support her family. Ana Emilou is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ana Emilou requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional frozen foods and materials for her business.

Ana Emilou has been in this business for 4 years now.

Ana Emilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods and materials for her business.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 24 years old. She is married with three children. She owns a general store, and she has been successful within the business, but most especially because the previous loan helped a lot to increase the inventory of the business.

With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, sugar and salts for sale. She plans to use the profits for building a house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salts and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing for her children.

For the past four years, she has operated an open air food business, selling to her neighbors and students at a neighboring school. In addition, she also does a farming business which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Especially during the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate. She dreams of establishing a retail shop and a café in the business.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, salt and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is married and lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Manzurajon

texts.en: Manzurajon was born in 1973. She began her business 13 years ago. Manzurajon sells clothes in a local market. Manzurajon is the main provider of her family because her husband is a builder and has a small income. She has 3 children. Two of them are adults but they do not have a source of income yet. She works hard from early morning until late evening to earn for her family's living. Manzurajon wants to increase working capital because the business struggle is big. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy underwear, socks, women's dresses, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy underwear, socks, women's dresses, etc.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Эту 32-летнюю женщину на фотографии зовут Нилуфар. Она замужем за предпринимателя, у них один ребенок в возрасте 12 лет. Нилуфар со своей семьей живет в селе района Спитамен. На протяжении 10 лет Нилуфар занимается животноводством. Она у себя во дворе разводит коров и быков для дальнейшей продажи. Это ремесло она унаследовала от своих предков. Они тоже жили за счет животноводства. Нилуфар сама ухаживает за скотом. Эта деятельность ей нравится. И сейчас она хотела бы увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить пару голов крупнорогатого скота. Она полагается на поддержку.
texts.en: This 32-year-old woman in the photo is named Nilufar. She is married to an entrepreneur. They have one child who is twelve years old. Nilufar and her family live in a village in the Spitamen District. For the past 10 years, Nilufar has been practicing livestock breeding. She raises cows and bull calves in her yard for future sale. She inherited this trade from her ancestors. They also lived off of cattle breeding. Nilufar looks after the cattle herself. She likes this business. Now she wants to increase the size of the herd in her barnyard. This is why she requested a loan to buy a pair of cows. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a pair of cows to develop her business.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is young woman with new ideas. She is 20 years old. Sayora lives with her parents. Her parents are poor people, so she did not have the opportunity to enter to any university. She has a dream to get a higher education. 

Sayora decided to organize her own business. She is going to sew children's clothes and sell them in a local market. Sayora with this aim took part in a course called "To Get Ahead" in a women's organization and got a certificate. Now, she is ready to start her business, but she does not have money. 

Sayora is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy fabrics for organizing a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for organizing a new business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour and sugar for resale. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy as wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth buys fish at the market and then sells the fish in her village. She is 35 years old and married. She has three children who are attending school at the elementary level. Lilibeth's husband is a farmer, growing rice in their fields. Through her generated income from vending of fish, Lilibeth can provide daily food for her family. Lilibeth wants to sell more fish and save some of her profits for her children's education at the secondary level. Lilibeth doesn’t want to see her children have to find a job soon. She is doing her best to give them a better way of living and wants her children to finish their studies in college. Lilibeth wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy fish in the market to sell in their village. She is wishing for a good health to continue operating the business. She is also hoping for the growth of it.

loans.use: to buy fish at the market to sell in her village.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 24 years old. She runs a spare parts boutique and has been in the business for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more wheels and tires for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more wheels and tires for sale.

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
Meselemani is married with four school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated an agricultural selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges of disease outbreak and pests affecting her crops.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to help in the production of a coffee seedbed.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 39-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Annie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Annie has requested a PHP 3000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home. She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mejumaa has operated a shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

Mejumaa is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops in the coming season.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en:
Muhabat is 50 years old. She is a kind woman from South Tajikistan. She is married and has four children. Muhabat is also a grandmother. She has two grandchildren. 

She has been busy with the farming business for more than three years. She grows wheat, maize, watermelon, etc. She has her own land where she does sowing. She has no problem with watering so she gets a good harvest. 

Muhabat usually uses her profit to buy food items for her family. Now she must do new sowing but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is married with four children. She  is 56 years old and lives in Bonifacio Misamis Occidental. 

She is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice field. 

Feliciana has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to own a rice field some day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice production.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Femme de 43ans, Kossiwa se bat chaque fois pour apporter le meilleur d'elle même à sa famille. Pour cela, elle revend des céréales à domicile et s'approvisionne généralement à Blitta (une localité située à environ 265km de la ville de Lomé). Le premier crédit sollicité à WAGES lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille. Elle souhaite créer une boutique et assurer l'éducation de la famille. Kossiwa est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en: Kossiwa is a 43-year old woman who constantly battles to provide the best she can for her family. In order to do this she sells cereals from home and generally gets her supplies from Blitta (a town which lies around 265 kilometers from the town of Lomé). This first loan requested from WAGES will enable her to buy more goods so that she can better respond to her family's needs. She would like to set up a shop and provide for her family's education. Kossiwa is married and mother to two children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha owns a retail business, and she has established a new business of selling foodstuffs. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, salt, and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand the business. She is very happy with the previous loan, which helped in the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, salt, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits congelés pour revendre, Komlan âgé de 49ans demande un second crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Il est aidé par 02 personnes et souhaite à l'avenir créer d'autres succursales et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il a une ancienneté de 04ans dans l'activité et a pour femme une revendeuse.
texts.en: Komlan, 49 years old, is seeking his second loan in order to stock up on merchandise: frozen foods. He has two people helping him. In the future he would like to open  addtional sales points and be able to provide for his family needs. He has been in business for four years. His wife is a vendor.

loans.use: to buy frozen  foods.

loans.name: Pablo Alexander

texts.es:
Pablo, está acompañado desde hace diez años, vive junto a su compañera de vida y dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, para cubrir los gastos familiares se dedica a vender medicina natural y ofrece su servicio como taxista, actividades que realiza desde hace ocho años, su horario es de 6:30 a.m. a 4:30 p.m.; le colabora su esposa y ya tiene un distribuidor que le da a mejor precio los productos que luego el revende.
Comprara pastillas para el estomago, jarabes, pomadas, vitaminas, reconstituyentes, entre otros medicamentos naturales para responder a las necesidades de sus clientes y tener mejores ingresos, con los que se dispone a cancelar la deuda y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
Su sueño es mantener su negocio funcionando para tener estabilidad económica que le permita comprar un taxi.
texts.en:
Pablo has been in a common-law relationship for 10 years. He lives with his life partner and their two children, aged 3 and 5 years old. In order to pay the household expenses he sells natural medicine and works as a taxi driver. He has done this for 8 years. He works from 6:30 am until 4:30 pm. He works with his wife and he has a distributor who gives him a good price for the products which he re-sells.

He will buy pills for the stomach, syrup, ointments, vitamins, tonic, amongst other natural medicines to fulfill the needs of his clients and increase his income. He will use that to pay off the loan and improve the lifestyle of his family. His dream is to keep his business functioning, establish economic stability which would allow him to buy a taxi.

loans.use: to buy pills for the stomach, syrup, ointments, vitamins, tonic, etc.

loans.name: Wendnsongde Group

texts.fr:
Mme ALIMATA représente le groupe WEND N SONGDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgé a 04mois. 01 va à l’école.
Mme vend des habits  depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 10 douzaines d’habits.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir une boutique pour habits  et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alimata represents the Wendnsongde group. She is married and mother to two children, the eldest of whom is nine years old and the youngest four months old. The elder child goes to school. 

Alimata has been selling clothing for the past two years and gets her supplies from the market in her area. She would like to buy ten dozen sets of clothes. 

She would like to reinvest her profits in her business and her ambition is to open a clothing shop and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ten dozen sets of clothing.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Imelda has been working hard to manage her textile business, which does textile items. 

To help expand her business, Imelda has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more uniform material and traditional cloth, called Gomesi, to sell. 

This will help Imelda to generate greater profits and pay her family bills. 

Imelda hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a very big textile shop. 

Imelda is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Imelda who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more uniform material and traditional cloth, called Gomesi

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is a 59-year-old married mother of one. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

An NWTF borrower since 2012, Ardiana is taking out a housing loan for PHP 4800 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

With your help, Ardiana can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Kidosho

texts.en:
Kidosho is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business, making curtains and men's and women's garments. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With this loan, Kidosho wants to purchase cloth materials and, sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as hand cream, shampoo and face cream.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a farmer who has a plantation. She has been in the agricultural business since 2010. She grows watermelon, vegetables and crops. Nasiba sells her products at the local market. She has a lot of clients, who prefer her goods because she grows vegetables of high quality. 

Nasiba is a well-bred person and has good knowledge, as she was one of the best pupils at her school. She is bringing up two children. Nasiba’s husband is a builder. Her business is the main source of family income. 

She has acquired a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds and to pay for laborers. She awaits your support and believes that your support will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for laborers

loans.name: Yaqueline Isamariel

texts.es: Yaqueline  tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida  sus tres hijos de 11 años, 10 años y 6 años  de edad. Ella es una mujer con espíritu emprendedor que se dedica a la venta de helados como: charamuscas, chocobananos, chocosandías y hielo. Junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía de su hogar y dan a sus hijos lo necesario. Yaqueline solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda así como poner dos puertas que se encuentran en mal estado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y dos puertas.
texts.en:
Yaqueline is 28 years old and lives in her own home along with her life partner and three children, ages 11, 10 and 6. She is a woman with an enterprising spirit who works selling ice creams such as candy twist, chocobanana, and chocowatermelon. She and her life partner meet their household expenses and provide the necessities for their children.

Yaqueline is requesting this loan from FUSAI to repair the roof of her home and to replace two doors that are in bad condition. With the requested amount she will buy galvanized sheeting, purlins and two doors.

loans.use: To buy galvanized sheeting and purlins to repair her roof and to replace two doors that are in bad condition.

loans.name: Cebada Y Trigo Group

texts.es:
“Salvación y Perfección” significados de Cebada y Trigo; estas palabras son las que 4 integrantes que integran un  grupo en VisionFund eligieron para ser identificados de los demás grupos y no solo eso sino que se basaron en el aspecto espiritual comenta Regina, representante del grupo, ya que en todo momento no solo en la religión todos necesitamos obrar de la mejor manera para tener las puertas abiertas en todo momento.
Además son palabras importantes para Regina, Ma Rutila, Roxana y Cristina para llegar a ser un grupo perfecto y solidario y es lo que les ha permitido seguir como grupo y mantener los beneficios que la fundación tiene para ellas. VisionFund ha motivado a sus clientes para que sigan con sus negocios y puedan generar el ingreso que necesitan para tener una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo que los beneficiados sean los hijos de los clientes.
Doña Regina es una líder muy entusiasta, trabajadora y con muchos sueños es por ello que sus compañeras la eligieron como representante del grupo “Cebada y Trigo”  menciona que gracias a su hermana ella se enteró de la organización y sobre todo las facilidades de pago ya que se adaptan a las posibilidades de sus clientes.  Doña Regina que se encuentra en la parte frontal de la imagen tiene un gusto especial por la moda, hace algunos años ella estudio una carrera de diseño de ropa pero por cuestiones económicas no ha podido consolidar uno de sus sueños que es elaborar trajes típicos para bailables ya que muestran el folklor del país pero nunca es tarde para hacerlo, ahora ella cuenta con una máquina de coser y en sus ratos libres realiza ropa y si tiene algún pedido con mucho amor y dedicación lo hace. Usará su crédito para comprar tela, botones, cierres y más material para seguir con su actividad.
Por otro lado Ma Rutilia es una integrante más del Grupo Cebada y Trigo ella es padre y madre de su hogar, ella dice que ahora que no vive con su esposo a puesto más empeño para darle lo mejor a su familia que es su hijo de tan solo 17 años que aun sigue estudiando, ella quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y con el crédito solicitado seguirá con la cría de becerros.
Roxana  apesar de ser muy joven ha visto que la vida no es fácil y se tienen que buscar los medios para subsistir y más ahora que se acerca su boda, ahora irradia una gran felicidad ya que espera con ansia la llegada del regalo más grande y maravilloso que hay  sobre la tierra “un hijo” ella quiere brindarle lo mejor cuando lo tenga es sus brazos y es así como gracias al crédito que a solicitado a  la fundación podrá comprar borregos e iniciará con la cría de ganado así ya no tendrá que preocuparse por atender a sus invitados que compartirán una fecha muy importante para ella y su futuro esposo.
Finalmente Cristina que tiene el interés por apoyar con los gastos del hogar menciona que VisionFund le a dado la pauta para comenzar con la venta de ropa a mayor cantidad, anteriormente ella contaba con un pequeño puesto en donde no tenía variedad de ropa, sin embargo ahora con el crédito ella podrá comprar más mercancía que sus clientes necesitan. 
Así es como ellas depositan toda su confianza en que saldrán adelante gracias al apoyo y a su propio esfuerzo.
texts.en:
“Salvation and Perfection” are the meanings the four members chose for “ Cebada y Trigo” which is a communal bank in VisionFund to identify it from other groups. Not only this but they are grounded in a spiritual aspect says Regina, the leader of the group, as not only in religion do we have to act in the best manner possible to keep all the doors open. Also the words are important for Regina, Ma Rutila, Roxana y Cristina in order to become a perfect and united group which has allowed them to continue together and reap the benefits that that union gives them.

VisionFund has motivated their clients to continue with their businesses so they can generate the resources they need to have a better quality of living and more importantly benefit the children of the members. Regina is a very enthusiastic leader, hard-working and with many dreams. So the other members of the group elected her as the representative of the“Cebada y Trigo” group. She says that she learned about the organization and the loan payments that are adapted to their clients from her sister.

Regina who is in the front part of the photo has a special taste for fashion. A few years ago she studied a fashion design course but for financial reasons she could not carry out one of her dreams, which is to make tradition clothing used in dancing to exhibit national folklore. But it is never too late to start. She now has a sewing machine and in her spare time she makes clothing. When she has an order she fills it with much love and dedication. She will use the credit to buy fabric, buttons, zippers and other material to continue with her work.

On the other hand, Rutilia is the head of her household. She says she no longer lives with her husband and she puts more effort into providing the best for her family, which is her 17 year old son who is still studying. She wants to offer a better quality of living to her son and with the loan will continue to raise calves. Roxana despite her young age, has seen that life is not easy and has had to find out how to sustain herself. Her marriage is approaching and she radiates with happiness as she waits with some anxiety the arrival of the greatest gift that there is on earth, a child. She wants to give it the best when she holds it in her arms. Thanks to the loan she can buy lambs and start raising animals. Then she won't have to worry about taking care of her guests that will share such an important date with her and her husband. Finally Cristina wants to help with the household expenses, mentions that VisionFund has given her a hand in starting her business of selling clothes. Before she had a small stand with little variety in clothing but with the loan she can buy more merchandise that her clients want. So they are all putting their confidence in getting ahead thanks to your help and their effort.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, etc.

location.town: Purisima Concepcion Mayorazgo, San Felipe del Prog

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with five children who go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

She works in a retail shop and sells to all categories of people. She generates additional income from selling charcoal; Rose has been in this business for four years. 

Rose has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler, and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elineta is 45 years old and lives in Paiton, Tangub City. She is married with 13 children.

Elineta engages in the buying and selling of cows, and earns approximately PHP 8,000 every  month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan to purchase three cows to raise.

Elineta has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Elineta hopes to improve her livelihood in order for her to cater more to her client's needs.

loans.use: to purchase three cows to raise

loans.name: Beakate

texts.en:
Beakate is 21 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Beakate's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Beakate is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Beakate has been with NWTF since 2014 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.

 In the future, Beakate would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 43 years old and married, with three children. With all of her children in school, Beatriz works very hard to provide for them.

Beatriz's business and her family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Beatriz has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Beatriz has taken a 7,700 PHP housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Beatriz is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

Belen has restarted her general store business. She has been with NWTF since 2012 and is now requesting a 7,200 PHP housing loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Belen will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en: Shpresa has been doing very well with her activity of buying & selling thrifty items. Here it is what she said to her loan officer during her interview: " for such positive outcome, I'll have to thank all my lenders that with their financial help and their compassion made it possible. I want to run my activity now in two different locations: in one booth, i want to sell thrifty clothes and in another one, i want to sell used linens, curtains, pillow cases, etc.  and to achieve this, I need lender's help again."

loans.use: To buy used linens, curtains, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maribel De La Asunción

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado.
En este lugar vive la señora Maribel, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de  21, 15 y 6  años que estudian en universidad, colegio y  escuela.
Doña Maribel es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, toallas entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan algo, trabaja en los ratos que está desocupada,   deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad razón por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, sabanas y toallas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Grupo De Crédito Cristo Resucitado meet in the citadel Libertad # 2 of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the true tamarinds.
Maribel, age 42, lives here. She is a single mother of three children, ages 21, 15, and 6. Her children are in university, high school, and elementary school.
Maribel is a woman who has had to work a great deal in order to get her children ahead. She is a merchant and sells all kinds of clothing, sheets, towels, and other items. She sells door-to-door and also from her home; her customers come over when they need things.
She works when she is not busy. She leaves her products with her clients on credit and charges every 15 days. 
She has been doing this work for over 10 years, so she has a very good clientele.
She will use this loan for the purchase of more merchandise such as: clothing, sheets, and towels. She has been a member of this group from the beginning and she likes it because the loans finance her business. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sheets, and towels.
